conversations.value: Grr... I'm gonna get you for that!
Skeever-brain!
Wolf-breath!
Horker-face!
Oh yeah? Well, I've seen mudcrabs that're smarter than you!
Waaaaaaah....
Elf-ears!
Milk-drinker.
Draugr-breath!
You... you take that back!
Mammoth-nose!
You can't catch me!
Well, you smell like a Hagraven. And you look like one, too!
This next song goes out to the Dragonborn. The savior of Skyrim.
This is a local favorite and one of the first songs I ever learned. Ragnar the Red.
This one's a favorite of mine. A legend we all know and love...
This is an ode to Skyrim's truest sons and daughters... the Stormcloaks. This is an ode to Skyrim's staunch protectors... the Imperials.
What matters is their heart.
Sometimes the famous come to us. Sometimes men and women come to us to seek their fame. It makes no difference.
Don't let Vilkas catch you saying that.
And their arm.
You have my brother and I, obviously. But I don't know if the rest will go along quite so easily.
Did you call me?
Leave that to me.
You know this one? I saw him training in the yard with Vilkas. You know this one? I saw her training in the yard with Vilkas. I told you, this is the whelp that Vilkas mentioned.
Master, you're not truly considering accepting him? Master, you're not truly considering accepting her?
But I still hear the call of the blood.
I am nobody's master, Vilkas. And last I checked, we had some empty beds in Jorrvaskr for those with a fire burning in their hearts.
Of course we did, icebrain.
Show this new blood where the rest of the whelps sleep.
I hope we keep you. This can be a rough life.
Nice to have a new face around. It gets boring here sometimes.
New blood? Oh, I remember you. Come on, follow me. New blood? Oh, hello. I'm Farkas. Come, follow me.
Ah, yes. I heard you gave him quite a thrashing.
Apologies. But perhaps this isn't the time. I've never even heard of this outsider.
Skjor and Aela like to tease me, but they are good people.
They challenge us to be our best.
We all do. It is our burden to bear. But we can overcome.
The quarters are up here. Just pick a bed and fall in it when you're tired.
Tilma will keep the place clean. She always has.
Farkas!
All right, so here you are. Looks like the others are eager to meet you.
Good luck. Welcome to the Companions.
Come to me or Aela if you're looking for work.
Once you've made a bit of a name for yourself, Skjor and Vilkas might have things for you to do.
Aye.
Vilkas, take him out to the yard and see what he can do. Vilkas, take her out to the yard and see what she can do.
What are you waiting for? Just keep swinging! Pull him back!
Hey, a fight!
Come on now, watch the footwork. Keep your balance. Strike when the shoulder turns. He's giving you openings! Watch the eyes! Just keep moving, you'll wear him out!
Are those two at it again?
Nice! Come on!
Get him! Chop chop! Get in there and push! All right!
Looks like someone's been digging here. And recently.
Tread lightly.
Be careful around the burial stones. I don't want to haul you back to Jorrvaskr on my back.
Shor's bones... how did they find this place?
Now look what you've gotten yourself into. No worries. Just sit tight. I'll find the release.

Old Nord sacrifice place. Be careful around here. Let's look for a way to open the bars. Ah, the ceremonial juncture. The old Nords used to do sacrifices here. Look around for a way to open those bars.
This looks like the guardian chamber. The key to that door has to be around here somewhere. "Every door has a key," says Vilkas. Sometimes he is wrong, but look around anyway.
Then the judgment of this Circle is complete.

His heart beats with fury and courage that have united the Companions since the days of the distant green summers. Her heart beats with fury and courage that have united the Companions since the days of the distant green summers.
Let it beat with ours, that the mountains may echo and our enemies may tremble at the call.
It shall be so.
And would you raise your sword in his honor? And would you raise your sword in her honor?
I would stand at his back, that the world might never overtake us. I would stand at her back, that the world might never overtake us.
Who will speak for him? Who will speak for her?
Would you raise your shield in his defense? Would you raise your shield in her defense?
It stands ready to meet the blood of his foes. It stands ready to meet the blood of her foes.
I stand witness to the courage of the soul before us.
This man has endured, has challenged, and has shown his valor. This woman has endured, has challenged, and has shown her valor.
And would you raise a mug in his name? And would you raise a mug in her name?
Brothers and sisters of the Circle, today we welcome a new soul into our mortal fold.
I would lead the song of triumph as our mead hall reveled in his stories. I would lead the song of triumph as our mead hall reveled in her stories.
To reach the heights of the Companions, you must join with us in the shared blood of the wolf.
I'm glad you came. It's been a long time since we had a heart like yours among our numbers.
You are due more honor than some calls and feasting.
That pitiful ceremony behind the hall does not befit warriors like us.
We do this in secret because Kodlak is too busy trying to throw away this great gift we've been granted.
He thinks we've been cursed. But we've been blessed. How can something that gives this kind of prowess be a curse?
So we take matters into our own hands.
Are you awake?
I was starting to think you might never come back.
I would hope you recognize Aela, even in this form.
She's agreed to be your forebear.
No surprise they keep vermin around. Filthy squalor.
Nothing we can do for these ones now.
Don't even want to think about what those cretins did to them before they died.
Nobody we know, by the smell.
There's a dead one, isn't there. Thought so.
Some can't separate the animal from themselves. Go feral. This poor sod could have been anyone.
We should keep moving.
Look at this. Cowards must have locked the place down after Skjor charged in. You can taste the fear.
I don't think I need to tell you why.
They call him "the Skinner." They call her "the Skinner."
We're getting close now. Be careful. Their leader is a tricky one.
That someone would attack Jorrvaskr... it's unthinkable.
Look at that.
We grieve.
For the fallen...
Before the ancient flame...
We weep.
We shout.
And for ourselves...
We take our leave.
At this loss...
Who will start?
I'll do it.
His spirit is departed. Members of the Circle, let us withdraw to the Underforge, to grieve our last together.
You Nords and your bloody sense of honor.
We'll let it seem like it's his idea.
If Ulfric's making a move for Whiterun, then we need to be there to stop him.
Draft another letter with the usual platitudes, but this time share some of your intelligence regarding Ulfric's plans. Embellish if you have to.
Yes, sir.
Sir.
It's not a cause. It's a rebellion.
General.
Balgruuf refuses the Legion's right to garrison troops in his city. Hrongar carries on the policies of his brother and refuses to acknowledge the Legions right to garrison troops in his city.
On the other hand, he also refuses to acknowledge Ulfric's claim. On the plus side, he also refuses to acknowledge Ulfric's claim.
I'm telling you, Ulfric's planning an attack on Whiterun.
Sir?
You can't force a Nord to accept help he hasn't asked for.
That's not what my scouts report, sir. Every day more join his cause. Riften, Dawnstar, and Winterhold support him.
Call it whatever you like, General. The man's going to try to take Whiterun.
Jarl Balgruuf... Jarl Hrongar...
You people and your damn Jarls.
Well, if he wants to stand outside the protection of the Empire, fine. Let Ulfric pillage his city.
He'd be insane to try. He doesn't have the men.
Well put, friend. Tell me, Galmar, why do you fight for me?
Yes, but why do you fight? If not for me, what then?
I still say you should take them all out like you did Deadking Torygg.
You think I need to send Balgruuf a stronger message. You think I need to send Hrongar a stronger message.
I fight for their wives and children, who's names I heard whispered in their last breaths.
I fight for the men I've held in my arms, dying on foreign soil.
We're ready when you are.
The people are behind you.
I would gladly retire from the world were such a day to dawn.
If he's not with us, he's against us.
Taking his city and leaving him in disgrace would make a more powerful statement, don't you think?
I fight for we few who did come home, only to find our country full of strangers wearing familiar faces.
I fight for my people impoverished to pay the debts of an Empire too weak to rule them, yet brands them criminals for wanting to rule themselves!
What's left of Skyrim to wager?
Then let them die with their false kings.
Don't be so sure of that. We've intercepted couriers from Solitude. The Empire's putting a great deal of pressure on Whiterun.
How long are you going to wait?
How many of their sons and daughters follow your banner? We are their families.
Soon.
He's a true Nord. He'll come around.
Balgruuf won't give us a straight answer. Hrongar won't give us a straight answer.
I'd follow you into the depths of Oblivion, you know that.
I fight... because I must.
I fight so that all the fighting I've already done hasn't been for nothing.
And what would you have me do?
Things hinge on Whiterun. If we can take the city without bloodshed all the better. But if not...
I'll die before elves dictate the fates of men. Are we not one in this?
Torygg was merely a message to the other Jarls. Whoever we replace them with will need the support of our armies.
Many I fear still need convincing.
If by message you mean shoving a sword through his gullet.
Aye. But in the meantime, we have a war to plan.
We've been soldiers a long time. We know the price of freedom. The people are still weighing things in their hearts.
So we're ready to start this war in earnest then?
He knows that. They all know that.
They have families to think of.
But the day words are enough, will be the day when soldiers like us are no longer needed.
Your words give voice to what we all feel, Ulfric. And that's why you will be High King.
In the absence of the Moot, it would further legitimize his claim. In the absence of the Moot, it would further legitimize her claim.

Make sure you take the Auxiliary here. You can send him back when you get there and find nothing but old bones and cobwebs. Make sure you take the Auxiliary here. You can send her back when you get there and find nothing but old bones and cobwebs.
So what - Ulfric gets this crown and then suddenly he's High King?
The Stonefist's no fool. He's found the Crown. But we'll get to it first.
And we gave it to Elisif? And we gave it to Erikur?
It won't be a waste.
Don't you Nords put any stock in your own traditions? I thought the Moot chose the king.
Tell me again, why I'm wasting men chasing after a fairy tale.
If Ulfric gets his hand on that crown, it won't be a fairy tale. It'll be a problem.
Not everyone's agreed to the Moot.
You've been here long enough to know that Nords aren't always sensible.
We follow our hearts.
Perhaps... I'm entrusting you with what resources I can spare. But I'm warning you, if this turns out to be a waste of time and men...
No, it's not as simple as that, but the Jagged Crown would be a potent symbol for his cause to rally around.
But, if we found it first...
We're backing Elisif. When the Moot meets, they'll do the sensible thing. We're backing Erikur. When the Moot meets, they'll do the sensible thing.
A crown doesn't make a king.
Fancy a crawl through a moldering dungeon to see if you can't stir up Galmar's Jagged Crown?
Fine. I'll send the Unblooded here with you.
Tell me again why we're wasting time and dwindling resources chasing a legend. We don't even know it exists!
If it even exists.
They demand the Moot.
All the more reason then. The crown would legitimize your claim.
It'll be there. You'll see.
When have I ever been false with you?
Damn the Jarls.
No, but this one...
The Jarls are upset. They don't all support you.
You're certain you've found it?
And damn the Moot!
We should risk letting those milkdrinkers put Thorryg's woman on the throne? She'll hand Skyrim over to the elves on a silver plate.
Back to the time when a king was a king because his enemies fell before him, and his people rose because they loved him.
The Jagged Crown! It heralds back to a time before jarls and moots.
It exists. And it'll be the symbol of the righteousness of our cause. Think about it.
Skyrim needs that king. You will be that king, Ulfric. You must be.
I'd rather take a moment and look around than walk blindly into an ambush.
Auxiliary, see if you can find another way through. We'll charge in to help as soon as we hear fighting.
But there isn't any other way through, Legate.
Let's not jump to conclusions, soldier. The Legion always finds a way.
There may be some way to get through on the level above. Hurry! Maybe you can find a way through somewhere above us. You have your orders. Get moving.
I don't like the look of this. Perfect spot for an ambush. Ten to one they're just waiting for us on the other side.
Let's show these rebels what real soldiers look like.
But don't underestimate the Stormcloaks. Many are Legion veterans. They may be traitors, but they know how to fight.
Everybody ready? We charge on my signal.
For the Empire!
Time to show what you're really made of.
I don't like it. What are they waiting for?
No, but I know they're out there. No other way they can come. Now shut it or you'll ruin our ambush.
You hear anything?
Maybe they're so scared of you they ran away.
We're not leaving here until we get what we came for.
Steady now. The Legion has faced down worse than a few dusty old bonewalkers.
Don't give them a chance to warn the others!
Be careful men. There's bound to be more up ahead.
Is this what killed that Stormcloak over there? Can't be. It looks like it's been dead for a hundred years.
What in the nine holds is that?
Alright everyone! Keep your guard up. Let's move out!
Alright, let's move, men! We've got more...
We'll stay here and see if we can find anything else that could be of use.
Auxiliary, do what you do best. See if you can find some way to get that gate open.
Steady, legionnaires! We've been through worse. Just keep your guard up!
Follow me. Let's see where this leads.
Good job!
Hadvar... get away from there!
How's it going? You find anything yet? Keep looking. There's got to be some way to get that gate open. This may sound obvious, but do you see a lever anywhere?
Alright legionnaires! Spread out and see what we've got.
Even if these carvings tell us where the crown is, I'm sure we're going to have to find a way through this door.
Careful! I wouldn't do that again unless you know for sure it's going to open.
And this must be the Hall of Stories.
One thing at a time soldier. Focus on our primary mission. We're searching for the crown.
Maybe there's something on the claw itself that could help us.
See what you can figure out auxillary, I'm going to check out these carvings over here. Let me know if you find something.
Uh oh! Look out!
Oh... I've heard of this. These walls are supposed to show the history of the ancients who built this place.
Looks like we weren't the first ones here, either.
Hmm... what is that? Some kind of stone claw? I wonder what it's used for.
Too bad we can't read these carvings.  Who knows what secrets we'd uncover?
Looks like the door will open if we turn these rings the right way.
Well done. They never knew what hit them.
Now let's keep moving.
We had the advantage of surprise this time, but don't expect it to last. Let's move out.
You two, stay and guard the entrance. We don't want any Stormcloak reinforcements taking us by surprise.
Everyone else, with me.
Stormcloaks were already camped out around the entrance when we got here. They don't know we're here yet, though.
Well, that's something at least.
What's the situation?
General Tullius is counting on us to bring back the Jagged Crown, and that's exactly what we're going to do.
I realize some of you may know men on the other side. But remember this. They are the enemy now and will not hesitate to end your lives either.
Ulfric the Pretender wants that crown, but we're not going to let him have it.
Listen up, legionnaires. Those Stormcloaks are here for the same reason we are.
Hardly likely.
Just shut up and keep out of sight.
Well, King... If you don't mind, we'll just take that crown of yours and be on our way.
Alright, get the crown off that draugr!
By the nine!
Have it your way. Let's get that crown men!
Hey, I found a crown over here on this corpse. Is this the one we're looking for?
You hear anything?
Follow me. Quickly and quietly now. I want their guts on the ground before they even know we're here.
But do not make the mistake of underestimating the Legion. Plenty of them are Nords same as us.
Get yourself kitted out with what you need. Welcome to the fight, brother!
Gretta, Engar, stay and guard the entrance. We don't want any Imperial reinforcements taking us by surprise.
The rest of you lot are with me.
Cold as the inside of an ice wraith. That and some Imperials are camped out around the entrance, staying nice and warm around their fires.
Imperials? Well, if they're keeping themselves comfortable, let's slip in and send them to their graves that way.
What's the situation?
We're not leaving until we get what we came for.
No. And I'm not sure I'm better off for it now neither.
Hail, Galmar.
Hail, Ilfhild.
That's the way I like it. Short and bloody. They never knew what hit them.
Enough talk. Let's go kill some Imperials.
We had the advantage of surprise this time, but things won't be so easy from here on out.
See what you can figure out, Unblooded. I'm going to check out these carvings over here. Let me know if you find something.
Draugr. Ain't you ever seen one before?
What in the nine holds is that?
I wouldn't do that again unless you know for sure it's going to open.
For Skyrim!
But there isn't any other way through.
Let's hope that's the last of them. Come on, let's see what's down this way.
Is there anything on the claw that might show how to open this door?
Steady now! They may be uglier than Imperials but they'll go down just the same.
Maybe they're so scared of you they ran away.
We'll stick around here for a while and see if we can find anything else useful.
Alright everyone! Keep your guard up. No telling what we'll find down here.
Come on, boys. Let's spread out and see what we've got.
Hmm, looks like this is as far as the Imperials got.
Look out!
Too bad we can't read these carvings. Who knows what secrets we'd uncover?
Even if one of these pictures tells us where the Crown is, I'm betting we're going to have to find a way through that door.
Time to show what you're really made of.
Not so sure? Oh, then perhaps we should take a moment to look around a little, eh?
I don't like it. What are they waiting for?
Now let's keep moving.
Oh... I've heard of this. They say these walls show the history of the ancients who built this place.
You sure about that? Then please, be my guest and go strolling on in there. We'll stay here and watch your back...
That's done it! Alright, boys, let's get moving. We've got more...
You there, Unblooded, see if you can find another way through. We'll charge in to help as soon as we hear fighting.
Pick a man and put him down. We attack on my signal.
Hmm... that looks like some kind of claw from a statue. I wonder what it's used for.
I don't like the look of this. Perfect spot for an ambush. Ten to one they're just waiting for us on the other side.
Good job!
Steady. A few dusty bonewalkers aren't going to stop us anymore than the Imperials could.
The crown must be around here somewhere. Spread out, and keep your eyes open.
One thing at a time. We're here for the Crown. Any of these carvings show a crown?
No, but I know they're out there. No other way they can come. Now shut up or you'll blow our ambush.
Unblooded, do what you do best. See if you can find some way to get that gate open.
Looks like the door will open if we turn these rings the right way.
There may be some way to get through on the level above. Hurry! Maybe you can find a way through somewhere above us. You have your orders. Get moving.
How's it going, Unblooded? You find anything yet? Keep looking, Unblooded. There's got to be some way to get that thing open. You see a lever anywhere?
Ah! The Hall of Stories... we must be getting close now.
Don't give them a chance to warn the others!
Careful, boys. There's bound to be more up ahead.
Their spies must've found out we know about the Crown, and they don't want us to have it. But they won't stand in our way.
Listen up. Those Imperials aren't here by coincidence.
Ulfric Stormcloak is counting on us to bring him back that crown, and that's exactly what we're going to do.
Keep your wits about you and watch your shield brother's back.
I know some of you are ex-legion and may know men on the other side. But remember this. They are the enemy now and they will not hesitate to kill you.
Just shut up and keep out of sight.
Hardly likely.
Hey, I found a crown over here on this corpse. Is this the one we're looking for?
Have it your way. Let's get that crown men!
By the nine!
Alright, get the crown off that draugr!
Ralof... get away from there, fool!
If you don't mind king, we'll just be taking that crown of yours and be on our way.
It seems cowardly.
Oh, he's serious. But so am I.
You plan to march on Windhelm?
As in all things, Lord, caution... I urge us to wait and see.
Then might I urge you to consider General Tullius's request? I mean, if you are bent on offending Jarl Ulfric...
Torygg? He simply walked up to the boy and murdered him!
You there.
I have a message for you to deliver to our friend, the esteemed Jarl of Windhelm. So about this axe...
Proventus. Bring me my pen. And the good parchment.
The chests of gold didn't hurt.
It's time to act.
I'm not the High King, but neither am I a boy.
If Ulfric wants to challenge my rule in the old way, let him.
Though I suspect he'll prefer to send his "Stormcloaks" to do it for him.
And what harm is there in letting a few legionnaires die in place of your own men?
I need to make a few things clear before I accept these Legionnaires of his.
Yes, to General Tullius.
Lord, wait. Let us see if Ulfric is serious.
I'm of a mind with Irileth.
Proventus, what do you make of all this? If Ulfric were to attack Whiterun...
He was rather straight forward with Torygg.
Was it cowardly then to accept the White-Gold Concordat?
True. He's already proven his personal strength. Now he seeks to prove his army's.
Finally.

I'm not a fool, Proventus. I mean it's time to challenge Ulfric to face me as a man, or to declare his intentions. I'm not a fool, Proventus. I mean it's time to challenge Ulfric to face me as a man, or march his Stormcloaks up to the gates.
The Jarls weren't asked. We were told. And we had to like it.

This again?! That was different. Was I given a chance to object to the terms of the treaty? No. This again?! That was different. Was Balgruuf given a chance to object? No. The Jarls weren't asked. He was told. And he had to like it.
Prey waits.
That "boy" was High King of Skyrim.
Are we writing a letter, Lord?
Damnit! This isn't about gold!
Ulfric is the one who has offended.
It's time to decide.
He'll do no such thing! He'll do no such thing! A dagger in the back is all you could expect!
But, Proventus has a point. Ulfric has made it clear. In his mind, to refuse his claim is to side with the Empire.
Oblivion take them. Every miserable last one of them.
Why didn't you say so immediately?!
My men are fearless. It's the Imperial milk drinkers I'm worried about.
We'll need to set up water brigades to combat the flames.
No. Of course not. Just - don't let me down Cipius.
How long until they arrive?
You Imperials are efficient, I'll give you that.
They have catapults.
Sir!
Not long. They're hiding in the country side.
But... sir...
This is it! Time to see what these Stormcloaks are made of.
My scouts tell me they're loading them with fire.
Move it soldier. Spread the word. Go. Go. Go.
Sir, they're on the move. They'll be at the gates at any moment!
The men will be fighting in flames.
Already taken care of.
Sir.
Take a moment to breathe, soldier.
If you prefer I took my men and left...
Sir, I tried.
The outer walls are strong. If we can hold them there...
What?!
Damnit. What's he waiting for?
The men are already gathering at the gates.
Damnit. Where'd they get catapults? The city walls are already falling apart as it is.
So, he wants to take my city, walls intact.
Sir! I... I have... <breathing hard>
Breathe!
Send the word. "A new day is dawning and the sun rises over Whiterun."
This is it.
Alright.
And I'm sure you could do it, too.
So it begins.
Whenever you are.
I've toured our camps. We're ready, Ulfric...
I'm in no mood to joke.
You're certain we're ready?
Whiterun's army will no doubt be bolstered with Legionnares. And those walls around Whiterun are old, but they still stand.
Yes!
They're the meanest, toughest sons of bitches Skyrim has to offer. And they want this.
No. But neither is every man able to give that order when he must.
But you are that man, Ulfric.  You've been that man before, and you'll be him again.
And these men and women - they call themselves Stormcloaks because they believe in you...
They want this as much as you do. Perhaps they want it more.
Again?
You were right Galmar.
Whiterun is only a means to an end.
Aye, and the sons of Skyrim will greet that dawn teeth and swords flashing.
And I might be old myself, but I'll kick those damn walls down with my bare feet! - if you would only ask me to do it!
We're ready.
Is any man ever ready to give the order that will mean the deaths of many.
Give the word, my lord, and Whiterun is yours.

I'll be damned if I let this rabble take my city without raising my own sword. I will not surrender Markarth without raising my own sword in her defense. Riften denies the Emperor. You are here illegally. Stand down and you will be arrested and tried in the morning. Resist and you will die. If they want my city, they're going to have to take it from me personally.

It's a little late for that, don't you think? He wants the city this badly, he can fight me for it. She wants the city this badly, she can fight me for it. She's watching over the others. Look alive now. Somehow I doubt that will persuade them.
Aye!
Protect the Jarl with your lives! Kill them all. Protect the Jarl at all costs! Protect the Jarl!
Stay back, lord! No, Igmund. It's too dangerous.
Halt in the name of the Jarl Balgruuf the Greater! Halt in the name of the Jarl Hrongar. That's close enough. Where's Anuriel? Halt in the name of the Jarl!
Enjoy this while you can. Soon you will all be slaves.
Someone get that thing out of here and burn it.
And you. A Stormcloak? I'd thought better of you. You'll all come to regret this day.
I presume you're talking to me?
Yield. I yield, Stormcloak! The city of Markarth is yours. Stop! Enough! Stand down! It's over! Everyone stop! Enough! That's enough. I surrender... I surrender.
I said, on your knees, Elf!

When Ulfric Stormcloak becomes High King, Skyrim will finally be the way my ancestors intended. It's a new day in Markarth. The Empire has no place in Skyrim... not any more. And you? You have no place in Whiterun anymore.

Don't worry. We'll take good care of your city when you're gone. You never were able to see the forest for the trees, were you? How kind of you. And I've brought an army to give you a going away parade. You think this is personal?
Raagh!
A bit melodramatic, even for you Laila. If this was my Empire, I'd be able to worship whoever I damned well pleased. You wish to see an Empire without Talos? Without its soul?
Pack your things and go. We should be fighting those witch-elves, not bending knee to them. The Emperor is nothing more than a puppet of the Thalmor.
The Empire will return. Count on it. This isn't over. Yes, but not likely the one you intend.
Not so fast Elf!
Ready to listen to the Silver-Blood family now, Igmund? Ahhh... It's good to be home. I think I'll like living here. Balgruuf!

Thongvor. I should have executed your whole treacherous clan when I had the chance. Welcome back. I've left a few surprises for you to discover. So enters Maven Black-Briar, the glint of Imperial coin in her eyes. So tell me, what's the price for a woman's integrity these days? Vignar Gray-Mane! Your family was noticeably absent from the walls. Now I know why. Wouldn't a dagger in the back have sufficed?
On your knees!
Come Galmar, we have much to do. He's right. Galmar, come, let us restore order. Jarl Black-Briar. I must admit, I do like the sound of that. Indeed. Come, there is much to be done.
You, go pack your things. There is a burning city out there that needs a government. Jarl Black-Briar put your government together. Do it now, or there will be rioting in the streets.
Are you two quite done? Enough! Both of you! If you ladies are finished bickering, there's much to be done. If you two are finished with the touching homecoming, there's a city in chaos out there.
And you, go sit on that damn chair and start acting like a Jarl. We must move quickly to prevent further violence.
You hear me you old fool! This isn't over!
And don't worry about any rioting, Legate. I have it under control.
We will soon begin publicly executing captured men. That should send a clear message to the people.
And this... This is all wrong. How many of those corpses lining our streets wear the faces of men who once called you friend? What about their families?
One day when you can see past your own interests, you will come to see that we were right. Tell me, Vignar. Was all this worth it?
Oh? I don't expect anyone to miss my meaning.
Come, Legate. There's much to do.
But no, you're content to snatch scraps falling off the Emperor's table. Fine. Take my home. Take my city. May it burn down around you.

We Nords were proud warriors once. And we still could be. Evidenced by the men and women who fought and died bravely today. A convenient position to hold now. But mark my words, old man, in the days to come, Ulfric will spread his rebellion thin. And what then?

You could see that if you had any faith left in that black heart of yours. We need the Empire, as much as it needs us. We Nords are the Empire! Our blood built it. Our blood sustains it! You of all people should know that.
Stop right there! Were I can see you.
As you wish.
The city is yours. I surrender... I surrender... Peace! Everyone stand down. That's an order. Stand down!
Skyrim needs a High King who will fight for her, and Whiterun needs a Jarl who will do the same.

I'm still sore where I took that arrow. I hate archers. This imperial armor is damn heavy. I'm sick of waiting. When are we going to see some action? Hope I don't draw guard duty. I bet we have rabbit again. I'm getting sick of rabbit. We're running out of bread. I hope the supplies get here soon.

Aw, quit your bellyaching. Yeah, I know what you mean. It's not that bad. You'd rather be plowing a field? Not me. Go tell the commander. I'm sure the boot in your arse will take your mind off your troubles. You must be all right if you've got time to complain.
Come. You, too. We can escape through the tunnels.
And my children?
It's time to leave.
Not without a fight it isn't!
I assume everyone's gone ahead of us as planned. I just swept through the castle, no one's here.
Now. We really must be going, sir.
As soon as we can muster our forces, we'll be back.
That's the battle you need to fight. Not this. This will be suicide. And to what end?
Fine. Let's go.
We've failed. The city is lost. They're through the gates and will be here soon.
Well, I suppose some kind of speech is in order.
The Aldmeri Dominion may have defeated the Empire, but it has not defeated Skyrim!
There is much to do, and I need every able bodied man and woman committed to rebuilding Skyrim.
A great darkness is growing, and soon we will be called to fight it, on these shores or abroad.
Not until the Moot declares that title should adorn my shoulders will I accept it.
And it is for these reasons that I cannot accept the mantle of "High King."
Eh, not so bad.
Nice touch about the High King.
It's a foregone conclusion, you know.
Good. It's done.
And Elisif? And Erikur?
Come, Galmar. We've still much work to do.
It was you who fought the Thalmor and their puppets who would have us deny our gods and our heritage.
May the gods preserve you.
And of course, we couldn't have done it without you.
But more than that, it was you who fought for Skyrim, for our right to fight our own battles...
And what about Jarl Elisif? And what about Jarl Erikur?
The Imperials aren't going to leave us alone. They still have camps in the hills.
They'll continue to strike out at us, whenever and wherever they can.
And indeed, there are many that call us heroes. And indeed, there are many that call me hero.
Huzzah!
Don't you worry about her. I've sent my best men to round her up. Don't you worry about him. I've sent my best men to round him up.
I do!
How'd I do?
Thank you, I thought so, too.
But it is all of you who are the true heroes!
I'll go gather the men in the courtyard.

I am indeed Ulfric Stormcloak, and at my side the man we know as Stormblade, and the world knows as the Dragonborn. I am indeed Ulfric Stormcloak, and at my side the woman we know as Stormblade, and the world knows as the Dragonborn. I am indeed Ulfric Stormcloak...
Will she acknowledge that it is we Nord's who will determine Skyrim's future?  Will he acknowledge that we Nords deserve to determine our own future?

Will she put aside her personal hatred for me, and her misplaced love for the Emperor and his coin, so that the suffering of our people will end?  Will he cast aside the Imperial coin falling into his coffers?
Will she swear fealty to me, so all may know that we are at peace, and a new day has dawned?  Will he swear fealty to me, that all may know we are at peace, and a new day has dawned?
Yes, what about the Lady Elisif?  Yes, what about Jarl Erikur?
I'm not afraid of the remnants of the Legion, in time they'll all give up and go home.
We must be prepared to face them.
What I fear, is that the Thalmor will see our victory here and turn greater attention to our shores.
May the gods preserve us all.
Oh, I know.
Aye.
And now, I present to you, Ulfric Stormcloak, hero of the people, liberator and High King of Skyrim!
Then it is settled. The Jarl will continue to rule Solitude, I will garrison armies here to ward off Imperial attempts to reclaim the city.
And in due time, the Moot will meet, and settle the claim to High King once and for all.
To return to our glory and traditions, to determine our own future!
It was you who fought a dying Empire who sunk its claws into our land, trying to drag us down with it.
It was you who fought your kin who didn't understand our cause, who weren't willing to pay the price of our freedom.
I hate giving speeches.
Not while I'm still breathing, it's not.
The Legion will be staying here for quite some time. I don't expect there to be any further violence.
Sovngarde... sir.
It's over.
Ulfric Stormcloak!
You are guilty of insurrection, murder of Imperial citizens, the assassination of King Torygg, and high treason against the Empire.
Windhelm will need a government quickly if we are to prevent more violence.
Brunwulf. Yes, I've sent men to protect him and bring him here.
Any last requests before I send you to... to wherever you people go when you die.
Well Ulfric, you can't escape from me this time.
All hail the Emperor. All hail his Legionnaires!
I am proud of all of you.
Already done, sir.
And we'll need to hand the city over to that Free-Winter fellow.
Well, the men will be expecting some kind of speech.
Come, Rikke. There's still much to be done.
Well? What are we waiting for?
Secure the door.
Just saying goodbye.
Nothing.
We couldn't have done this without you. The Empire glories in your accomplishments...
You are traitors and will die traitors' deaths. Stand down and face public execution, or advance and face summary execution by my hands.
It matters little to me. Either way I'll be sending your heads back to Cyrodiil.
Enough!
In appreciation for your exemplary service, I am doubling your pay and compensation to the widows of your fallen comrades.
What was that, Legate?
In the meantime, we'll continue to root them out and put them to the sword.
I pray you're right, Legate.
No... But I belong to her.
Many of you will be staying in Windhelm to aid the Jarl in restoring order and stamping out any embers of rebellion that may still smolder here.
We are turning the city over to Brunwulf Free-Winter, an honorable and faithful man.
Talos be with you...
Skyrim doesn't belong to you, Ulfric.
Let this day be a final warning to all who would still call themselves Stormcloaks.
His head will be sent to Cyrodiil where it will adorn a spike on the walls of the Imperial City.
It'll make for a better song.
They'll no doubt strike whenever and wherever they can.
There's bound to be resistance. There are many Stormcloak camps tucked away in the hills.
But without Ulfric to inflame their passions, they'll settle down and return to their homes eventually.
I'll never surrender Skyrim into the hands of a corrupt and dying Empire.
Let the Dragonborn be the one to do it.
I hope we haven't just created a martyr.
The rebellion is over. Ulfric Stormcloak is dead.
Right. Well?
It wasn't so bad.
Step aside Galmar. We're here to accept Ulfric's surrender.
Attention! General Tullius has an announcement!
That's not the Skyrim I want to live in.
Ulfric. Stop.
Stop what? Taking Skyrim back from those who'd leave her to rot?
Stand aside woman. We've come for the General.
Rikke. Go.
You're free to leave.
You were there with us. You saw it. The day the Empire signed that damn treaty was the day the Empire died.
Rikke. You don't have to do this.
The Empire is weak, obsolete. Look at how far we've come and with so little.
When we're done rooting out Imperial influence here at home, then we will take our war to the Aldmeri Dominion.
Already done.
This is the Skyrim you want?!
This is what you wanted? Shield brothers and sisters killing each other?
Families torn apart?
I'm also free to stay and fight for what I believe in.
Damnit woman, stand aside.
You're a damn fool.
He has given up. But I have not.
You're wrong. Ulfric. We need the Empire. Without it Skyrim will assuredly fall to the Dominion.
Talos preserve us.
You've left me no choice...
You're also free to die for it.
And if I surrender?
What who wanted?
That Empire is dead. And so are you.
It's a little more than a rebellion, don't you think?
We aren't the bad guys you know.
It makes us right.
Perhaps you're right. But then what does that make you?
Just kill him and let's be done with it already.
This is it for you. Any last words before I send you to Oblivion?
By the gods! If it's a good ending to some damn story you're after - perhaps the Dragonborn should be the one to do it.
Heh.
The Empire I remember never surrendered.
Enough... enough...
You just said it yourself.
Good point.
Maybe not, but you certainly aren't the good guys.
You realize this is exactly what they wanted.
So be it.
The Thalmor. They stirred up trouble here. Forced us to divert needed resources and throw away good soldiers quelling this rebellion.
Come, Galmar. Where's your sense of the dramatic moment?
We surrender. The capital is yours. If you pledge no harm will come of my people, I turn over the seat of power to you.
Enough! Stop!
Cease fighting. It's over.
It's over. No more violence.
Sir...

Everyone on me. Let's show these Imperial milk drinkers what true Nords look like! Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the Empire! For the Legion! Everyone on me. Let's show these Imperials what we're made of! All right men. On me! For the Emperor! For his Legionnaires! Ready now! Everyone, with me! For the sons and daughters of Skyrim!
Rrrrraaaaaarrrrr!!!!! Rrrrrraaaaaaaaaaaaahhhhhhh!!!! Rrrrrraaaaaaaaggggghhhhhhh!!!!!!

Whiterun's walls are tall, but they are old and crumbling, like the Empire whose Legion lines them. The approach to Riften is guarded by watchtowers. They will be full of archers. Move fast, and stay low. The only way into Windhelm is across this bridge. Keep moving, stay close, and we'll be through their gates in no time. We now fight our way to Castle Dour to cut the head off the legion itself! The walls of Markarth may be high, but their age will have created weakness or secret entrances. Find them!
Destroy them quickly, and take out the archers in the towers along the way.

They'll have set barricades to slow us down. They've barricades to block us, but we'll tear through them and the Imperials behind them! They've barricades to block us, but we'll tear through them and the rebels behind them! They'll have barricades set, destroy them quickly. Keep pressing forward.

The faster we take them out, the faster we can claim this city as ours! All that remains then is the exterior gate. Find a way through to open it and the city will be ours! Beyond that are two exterior gates. Find a way to open them and we can take this city! Our objective is the drawbridge. If we can find a way to drop it, the city will be ours!
This is it men! This is it men! It's time to make this city ours!
And in that moment, the gods will look down and see Skyrim as she was meant to be. Full of Nords who are mighty, powerful, and free!
The citizens of Whiterun are forever in your debt!
In defeating these Stormcloak traitors, you have proven the hollowness of their cause and the fullness of your hearts.
They already sing of your valor and skill! The halls of Sovngarde are no doubt ringing with your praises!
Revel in your victory here today, even as the gods revel in your honor!
Everyone, on me! The Jarl wishes to speak!
For Whiterun! For the Empire!
Carry on men, my gratitude and blessings go with you!
Lest our honor be lessened should we allow these bloodthirsty beasts to prowl our lands!
And so, we must each one of us, continue to fight this insurrection, lest our fallen brothers have died for naught!
But Ulfric will not stop here. No, he will continue to strike out against any true Nord who remains faithful to the Empire.
He will continue to sow discord and chaos wherever he can.

But no! We are farmers! We are craftsmen! We are sons and daughters of shopkeepers, maid servants and soldiers!  This is the day we send a message to Ulfric Stormcloak and the rebel Jarls who support him.  On this day, our enemy will know the fullness of our determination, the true depth of our anger, and the exalted righteousness of our cause. Ulfric thinks he can hide behind the walls of his castle. But we will fight our way in and drag him out through the rubble to face justice.
We are the sons and daughters of Skyrim!

What we do here today, we do for our country! For all the true Nords of Skyrim! But make no mistake. What we do here today, we do for Skyrim and her people. Fear neither pain, nor darkness. For Sovngarde awaits those who die with weapons in their hands, and courage in their hearts. But they are no match for Legionnaires. You are the best and the brightest warriors in Tamriel. Professional soldiers, fearless and devastating.

By cutting out the disease of this rebellion, we will make this country whole again! The Emperor will be paying close attention to what happens here today. Men who distinguish themselves will be well rewarded.

They say that our cause is false and that we are nothing more than thieves, thugs and murderers! This is an important day for the Empire and for the Legion. And for all of Skyrim. We come to this moment carried by the sacrifices and courage of our fellows. Those who have fallen. And those still bearing the shields to our right. All right. It's time to deliver the final blow to the Stormcloak rebellion.
You have all fought bravely, and sacrificed much to bring us to this point.
And we have come this far because our cause is true. Because we fight as one. And because our hearts are bursting with anger! That message is this.
Any king who denies the Emperor will wake one morning to face the Legion staring down his gates.
And on that day, we will confiscate his city, and restore the rule of law to his lands.

The gods are watching. The spirits of our ancestors are stirring. And men under suns yet to dawn will be transformed by what we do here today. Because this is the end for them, the Stormcloaks will fight like cornered rats. They will be fierce and crafty.
Soon it will be time to replenish our supply of water.
If the river is not frozen to ice, perhaps.
The road takes us past many cold rivers. We can fill our skins there.
Yes, of course you are right. Still, I would give much for even a few grains of moonsugar.
My bones ache for the moonsugar. It has been too long since I tasted it.
Control yourself! Do not frighten away our customers with your fits.
My ears hear the truth in your words, and yet my body shakes with the need.
Put the thought out of your mind, and do not speak of it again.
You know that our supply is limited. It could be a season or more before we get a new shipment from the south.
Not only that, but these Nords have no love for us. They look upon us and see only thieves and smugglers.
I feel the same. I do not think Khajiit were made for the cold.
Hah! I wish that I had your optimism.
It has been a profitable journey, and yet I long for the warm sands of Elsweyr more and more each day.
It is a pity, but it cannot be helped. Perhaps if we continue to show that we can be trusted, they will open their cities to our caravans.
Yes, I know just what you mean. My toes are numb from the cold more often than not.
That is true. Perhaps I should be more grateful for this opportunity. Not many Khajiit can say that they have visited Skyrim.
We have been in this land for so long, I have forgotten what it feels like to walk on warm sand.
In truth, I do not. I have always dreamed of seeing new lands, and it does not hurt that we are making a good profit.
Do you ever find that you regret making this journey?
All this talk of dragons returning to the world makes me more than a little nervous.
As the saying goes, you do not need to be faster than the dragon; you need only be faster than your friends.
I suppose if we do, we will find out just how fast each of us can run.
Moons protect us! I hope we do not encounter one of them on the road.
We are fortunate. We travel lightly, and can escape at a moment's notice. We have no home that a dragon can burn to the ground.
S'rendarr be merciful! What ill fortune that this should happen now, while we are trying to make a living.
And we will lose customers. Let us hope that if there are dragons, there are only a few and they are not too foul-tempered.
I wish I could say that I did not, but in every part of Skyrim, there is talk of dragon sightings. It is no coincidence.
I feel pity for these Nords. When the dragons attack cities and towns, they will lose everything.
Do you believe all this talk of dragons? Can the ancient ones truly have returned?
The soldiers? From which side, the Stormcloaks, or the Imperials?
Hm. I had not thought of it that way.
I wonder if we should offer discounts to the soldiers.
Hah, you have the foresight of a Khajiit in a sandstorm. If we offer a discount to both sides, the winners will persecute us for helping the losers.
Both. One or the other is bound to win the war eventually. Why not curry favor now, so that the victor will look upon us kindly?
And what makes you think that?
Between the war and the return of the dragons, I wonder if we should not leave Skyrim and ply our trade elsewhere.
The war? That is not a reason to leave, it is a reason to stay.
That may be, but what of the war? That is not so easy to escape from.
Because war is good for business, of course.
I admit, the dragons are a concern, but we can avoid them if we do not stay in one place for too long.
Now, you. Get down there.
All right. Open her up.
She wishes to speak to you herself. Please. Place your hands on the altar, and you will hear her voice.
Azura. Mother of Roses. Goddess of Dusk and Dawn. Your chosen champion has returned your Star to you.
These fissures and cracks aren't encouraging. Malyn obviously was growing more desparate once he left the College.
First, I'll need to grab hold of your soul.
Now, take a deep breath.
He did it. He actually managed to trap his own soul inside the Star, but it's falling apart. It needs more and more souls to sustain itself.
The Star is free to purify itself. Don't worry, mortal. I will return you before you are cleansed.
Malyn's enchantments are broken. Hold on. I'm going to pull your soul out of there. Brace yourself.
Yes. He'll do.
We can just sacrifice another disciple. Apprentice Haerlon will be no great waste.
We can't take another villager from the surface so soon. I told you to prepare everything properly!
More souls are needed for the Star. The last one died before he could be harvested.
Another soul for the master!

I desired stealth and secrecy, but you executed the task with as much subtlety as a enrage mammoth.  You have done well, my Champion. You have earned my respect, a feat few manage and live to tell about.
If you can learn to be subtle in rendering death, perhaps I will share more of my power with you.
But my purpose was ultimately gained. My previous champion was erased, and a new one born. I shall write your name upon the Tablet of Absolute Darkness.
She is here, among us.
Shhh! Be still. Beware her anger!
Our Lord! She has come!
(Gasps)
Hear me!
Failure is not an option.
Succeed, and you may keep your title and my armor, and I shall write your name upon the Tablet of Absolute Blackness.
Go to Solitude. Stalk the Jarl and slay her. Remember always this: As you will it, so it shall be.
And now you must perform the task for which I created you. You have already proven to possess the needed skills.
You will need stealth and lies to get past her guards. You will assassinate her swiftly and quietly. And if combat finds you, survive the escape.
I have spread rumors of an assassin. It will make your job harder, but will allow me to place blame where I desire it.
You have earned the right to call yourself my Champion.
You have done well, my Champion. You have earned my respect, a feat few manage and live to tell about it.
Remember always this: You need answer to no authority, neither mortal, nor divine... As you will it, so it shall be.
Now go. I have strings to pull that require my full attention. You may pursue your own course wherever it leads you.
On the other hand, you've weeded out the weak from among those who would deign worship me.
You could be the one I seek... if your will is strong, lure a thrall to my shrine. Convince him to embrace the Pillar of Sacrifice. Then slay him.
Well, well. You've slain my followers. I should destroy you for your impudence!
Do this, and I shall favor you.
I have need of a warrior. Only the most ruthless, cunning, and agile will do.
I have a special task for whichever of you is left standing.
Prove yourselves to me!
But which among you truly exceeds the rest?
You have gathered here night after night, sacrificing fools upon my shrine, and sparring aimlessly with yourselves.
You may keep my Ebony Mail, a token of my appreciation to my new champion. Its gifts will resonate with your talents.
Come in, come in! Shut the door behind you!
I thought you didn't believe I was in danger!
Go. Away. Please!
Look at me ramble... Well, I guess I'll go about my business sulking in here. You can stand over there in the corner watching for assassins.
Bolgeir's loyal, but even he doesn't do what I ask. Case in point, this whole assassin thing. Well at least I have you now.
I'm glad they finally believed me. About the assassin I mean. It's been so hard since my Torygg passed. No one takes me seriously.
So how's this work exactly? Do you just kind of stand there on the look out? That's what Bolgeir does. Well, he sort of looms more than stands.
It doesn't really matter what I believe, now does it? I've brought you someone who can protect you. That's what you want, isn't it?
Well, what are you waiting for?!
Damn it, I lost him!  Protect the Jarl! Damn it, I lost her! Protect the Jarl! Protect the Jarl!
(Sounds of unlocking and unbarring a door)
I've brought a friend. Someone who can help. A bodyguard. To protect you.
Stay where I can see you. You need an escort at all times. Come back here!
I'm not taking any visitors. Please, just go away! Leave - me - a - lone! Go away!
Elisif...
Private quarters are strictly off limits. You have been warned.
Don't worry. I'll make sure he sees the light. I trusted you, now you trust me.
I knew I could trust you!
Yeah, yeah, dog gets master, master gets cosmic axe, everyone's happy. Just get over here, mutt.
Vile! None of that - you made a deal, and the mortal stood by it honestly. Now it's your turn to come through.
Oh, fine. Have my boon and be done with it. I've got more interesting deals to make, anyway.

A lack of ambition like that really ought to be punished. Perhaps by turning you into a worm, or maybe a few decades of... I'll make sure this war ends, all right. Just as soon as the dragons swarm across Skyrim and wipe out all of you puny... You can be a part of a tremendous power - all you have to do is let your soul be absorbed by this axe. I never said it would be your power...
Ah, that feels so much better! You forget how nice supreme power feels until you've been stuck in a cave for a few years.

It's a shame you wished for something so dull as me taking back the mutt. Quite the lack of imagination on your part. Now, as for your wish... An end to the war, was it? Now, as for your wish... Power, was it?
Here you go. Try not to spill anything on them.
What is this... it's... it's just a book?! I can see. The world beyond burns in my mind. It's marvelous....
The crucial nature is pure apparent. Mundane sight traded for another sort.
... and may we one day rejoin them in eternity.
May the spirit of Lavinia and all those who have left this world and its suffering know the beloved serenity of Aetherius...
But he willingly gave up this existence that we might better understand the vagaries of life and death.
The god Arkay was once like us, bound to winding mortality.
It is through the ebb and flow of this cosmic tide that we find renewal and, in the end, peace.
No. I will have no peace until these hunters are dead.
Let's finish this.
...You! Why?
Grrah!
Great Malacath, we beseech you, aid us in our time of need...
What's that?
Very well. You, outsider, come here! I want a word.
Now, we begin the ritual...
So it will be. Malacath has spoken, Yamarz. Your path is clear.
Let's get this over with.
If there's a chance this will save me, then I'm taking it.
You don't deserve to call yourself an Orc! You're weak, you're small, and you're an embarrassment!
What? What is this?
Why are we bothering with this?
I'll lead the way, but you'd better back me up.
You dare summon me, Yamarz?
You pathetic weakling!
You let giants... Giants!... overrun my shrine. Bring me their leader's club as an offering, and I might release you from this curse!
So he has been punished? And what of us? What fate shall we suffer?
You, place that hammer on the shrine. You're the only one who's proven worthy in all of this...
You'll have to prove yourselves, but I'm willing to give you a chance. Gularzob's in charge now. Let's hope he's a better chief.
Yamarz was a coward and a weakling. His deceitful ways have cost you all greatly.
Yamarz was a fool. Always trying to scheme his way out of responsibility.
Now, take Shagrol's hammer back to Largashbur, and we'll see about whipping the rest of them into shape.
Well, the giants took care of him, and you took care of the giants. Two problems solved at once. But, you took care of him and the giants. Two problems solved at once.
Fine, it's your neck.
We cannot carry on this way! You know we are doomed if we do not do something!
Yamarz charged me with keeping outsiders away from Largashbur. You would have me disobey him?
You were charged with keeping us inside the walls. Have faith, Ugor. I only wish the best for our tribe.
Halt! You have no business here, outsider. Leave at once.
Ugor, no! This may be the one we need.
We need nothing from outsiders! Yamarz will provide for us.
It is time, Yamarz.
Grrr. Fine, let's get this over with.
You bring an outsider here, and now insist I call on Malacath for help, when he has clearly forsaken me? You try my patience, Atub.
Doing nothing will not grant our tribe relief from this curse. We must try.
Malacath has heard my pleas! He speaks to us!
Before you go, mortal. One final challenge. Ha ha ha.
You think to betray Mehrunes Dagon? Suffer!
It's not working. Why don't you give it a try? Just put your hands on the altar.
Mehrunes Dagon, the Lord of Change, we have brought your Razor to you. We beg you, please bring the blade's full glory to Tamriel again!
That burned paper is all that remains of the fabled Mysterium Xarxes. The blasphemous book written by Mehrunes Dagon himself.
It's said that Mankar Camoran used the book to open a portal to a Paradise where all his followers would live forever.
Feel free to look around. Come talk to me when you're ready to discuss that job I mentioned.
The Commentaries on the Mysterium Xarxes were written by the Mythic Dawn cult leader, Mankar Camoran.
He promised a paradise awaited his followers when they died, that they would be reborn by Mehrunes Dagon's side.
The tapestries hung here and outside were found in hideouts where members of the Mythic Dawn would meet and plot.
The cult's greatest accomplishment was the assassination of the Septim Dynasty and the opening of the Oblivion Gates.
Those robes were worn during the Mythic Dawn's secret meetings, where they plotted to bring the Daedra Mehrunes Dagon into Tamriel.
Each bolt of yarn used to make the robe was colored with a dye made from sacrificial blood.
Ah, yes. That scabbard. Notice the insignia? An Oblivion Gate. A key symbol of Mehrunes Dagon, the patron Daedra of the Mythic Dawn.
It's the past! Dead oaths on dead lips. Let it stay there.
Your ancestors wouldn't want this, Silus!
The museum is opening, Madena.
Why should I hide from it? This is my family's legacy!
Excellent work.
Now, I trust you're sharp enough to see that the sword doesn't match the description of the Ebony Blade you may know.
It has languished too long outside the winds of alliance and betrayal.
To return to its past glory, it must reacquaint itself with the hatred of this world.
To return to its past glory, it must first drink the blood of deceit.
The blade will feed on the ire of Tamriel. Bathe in your infamy. Feel the weight of their loathing, and my power will course through it once more.
Seek out those closest to you. The final pluck of their misguided heartstrings will accompany my blade in the song of your grandeur.
Your world is admirably seeped in lies and inclinations. My blade is a darling leech that feeds on deceptions, and nourishes its master.
It is time for my splendor to return to Skyrim.
But the token of my truth lies buried in the ruins of my once great temple, now tainted by a profane darkness skittering within.
Can you not hear me? Are your ears full of hate?  A new hand touches the beacon. You have found my beacon. Do you prefer heedlessness to my luminous glory? Go! Fool! He is perverting my Light.
The defiler waxes!  But it is not time for rejoicing. The defiler continues to profane my temple. A Light that could illuminate Skyrim and her people.
Go now, with haste. Take my beacon to Mount Kilkreath. Return to my figure on Mount Kilkreath, and I shall make you the instrument of my cleansing light. Take my beacon to the mount above Kilkreath.
Malkoran has forced the doors shut. But this is my temple, and it responds to my decree.
I will send down a ray of light. Guide this light through my temple and its doors will open.
A new supplicant approaches.
Restore to me my beacon, that I might guide you toward your destiny.
Look at my temple, lying in ruins. So much for the constancy of mortals, their crafts and their hearts.
If they love me not, how can my love reach them?
But first, you must restore to me my beacon.
I shall guide you unto it. Find it and return here. And great shall be your reward.
Return my beacon to Mount Kilkreath.
And I will make you the instrument of my cleansing light.
It is done. The defiler is defeated. Take Dawnbreaker from its pedestal.
Molag Bal. You think you can best Boethiah's faithful? I have won this contest before!
Ah. But I have my own champion this time, Logrolf.
What? You!
No more.... No more.... I submit, Molag Bal. I submit!
Mortal. I give you my mace, in all its rusted spitefulness.
Crush the spirit from Logrolf's bones. Make him bend to me.
So you don't know anything about this house?
Anyone seen entering or leaving? Any strange lights or unusual noises?
No.
It's abandoned and it's always been abandoned.
Yes. Your reward is waiting for you, mortal. Further down.
I don't want to die. I can't die here!
Weak. He's weak. You're strong. Crush him.
No. Kill him. Crush his bones. Tear at his flesh.
Come out! We know you're here!
Fresh food. No wood rot on the furniture. Someone's been here. Recently.
But the people I asked say no one enters or leaves....
You will kill. You will kill, or you will die!
That's it. Something's inside the house. Come on, we're getting to the bottom of this.
Stendarr's Mercy! This isn't an ordinary Daedra. We have to get help.
Get out of my head, Daedra!
You first. Come on. Let's go.
Wait. Did you hear that? I think it came this way.
There's another door. See if you can get it open.
The Daedra has us. It's you or me!
So close. Your prize is waiting.
Yes. Further. Into the bowels.
Yes!
You pledge your soul to me?
Ah ha ha! You mortals and your frail, limp, pathetic bodies. Try it again.
Kill him.
You forsake the weak and pitiful Boethiah?
You're mine now, Logrolf.
You bend to me?
Who... who are you? What's going on?
Priest of Arkay. I'm your friend.
You're my... friend....
He looks so... sweet. Go ahead. Have the first bite.
The shrine of Namira is further inside. Keep going.
Draugr are below. Foul tasting.
The shrine of Namira is beyond that door. Get ready.
The meal is on Namira's table. Go ahead. Carve.
Come with me. Our feast is about to begin.
I need to lay down. I'll just be a minute....
Why don't you lay down and rest, while we get the meal ready?
I've been invited to dinner.... I'm so hungry....
Yes. I'm your friend, and I've invited you to dinner.
I always leave room for the main course, Eola.
Not too full on bread and wine, I hope?
I never miss a good meal.
Thank you for coming to dinner, Hogni.
Thank you, Lisbet. It's been such a joy to dine with you all these years.
This is lovely, as always, Eola.
Do dogs count?
When was your first meal, Banning?
Either way, I came back with meat for the table.
That must have been quite a surprise.
My friend Marex. We were hunting, and I thought he was an elk.
Of course they don't count!
I always preferred the liver myself. My brother had such a juicy liver.
The toes are my favorite part. I hope I get to take a few home with me.
I'm just glad we had this, now. I was almost getting ready to eat my servant and blame it on the Forsworn.
Eola is a fine host. She really keeps the faithful together.
It's so good to have everyone around the table again.
I feel the hunger inside of you. Gnawing at you. You see the dead and your mouth grows wet. Your stomach growls.
Not many would walk blindly into a crypt, smelling of steel and blood, but not fear.
It's all right. I will not shun you for what you are. Stay. I will tell you everything you have forgotten.
That's enough, Thongvor. We're done.
Typical Imperial lies. First you take away Talos, now you're keeping us from seeing our honored dead?
You and the Jarl will answer for any desecration of my ancestors' bodies.
What are you hiding, priest?
I'm not hiding anything. It's closed for a reason.
That should do. Now - Inhale deeply.
Yes, yes. This will create a fine fume.
And another one for me.
I'll start round one. Down the hatch!
Oh, I couldn't. Goes right through me. Besides, I have so many things to do...
You are the best Septim that's ever ruled. Well, except for that Martin fellow, but he turned into a dragon god, and that's hardly sporting...
You are far too hard on yourself, my dear, sweet, homicidally insane Pelagius. What would the people do without you? Dance? Sing? Smile? Grow old?
Yes, yes, as you've said, countless times before...
So many undesirables to contend with. Naysayers. Buffoons. Detractors. Why, my headsman hasn't slept in three days!
Hafrumph! Well then, if you're going to be like that... Perhaps it's best I take my leave. A good day to you sir. I said good day!
More tea, Pelly my dear?
Yes, yes, go. Leave me to my ceaseless responsibilities and burdens...
You take care of yourself, now. And if you ever find yourself in New Sheoth, do look me up. We can share a strawberry torte. Ta ta!
Luggage! Now where did I leave my luggage?
And as for you, my little mortal minion... Feel free to keep the Wabbajack. As a symbol of my... Oh, just take the damn thing.
Pelagius Septim the Third, once the Mad Emperor of Tamriel, now so boringly sane. I always knew he had it in him!
Let's make sure I'm not forgetting anything. Clothes? Check. Beard? Check! Luggage?
Yes, yes, that's quite enough celebration. Let's send you ahead, shall we?
Master! You've taken me back! Does this mean we're going home? Oh, happy times! I can't wait to...
Well, I suppose it's back to the Shivering Isles. The trouble Haskill can get into while I'm gone simply boggles the mind...
You know, I was there for that whole sordid affair. Marvelous time! Butterflies, blood, a Fox, a severed head... Oh, and the cheese! To die for.
The self-loathing enhances Pelagius' anger! Ah, but his confidence will shrink with every hit. You must bring the two into balance.
The attacks he makes on himself can be seen here fully. They are always carried out on the weakest part of his fragile self.
But the deepest, keenest hatred was for himself.
Ah, now this is a sad path. Pelagius hated and feared many things. Assassins, wild dogs, the undead, pumpernickel...
Wonderfully done. Pelagius is finally ready to love himself... and continue hating everyone else.  Don't get too comfortable here, mortal. You may actually earn your way out.
You seem to be having a small problem... or perhaps it's a big problem? Maybe if you shrunk the whole thing down a little first?
With the threat gone Pelagius is under the delusion that he is safe, which means you've helped him... sort of. And we're that much closer to home.
Oho! I thought you'd never figure it out. The butler did it! Or is it the advisor? Whoever that man behind the throne was.
The objective here is simple, you simpleton!  Use your Wabbajack to defeat the enemy, while they do the same!
Oh, but she taught her son well. Pelagius learned at a very early age that danger could come from anywhere. At any time. Delivered... by anyone.
That woman wielded fear like a cleaver. Or did she wield a cleaver and make people afraid? I never get that part right...
You see, Pelagius' mother was... well... let us say "unique." Although, I suppose in the grand scheme of things, she was fairly average for a Septim.
Oh, good choice. Well, good for me. I find everyone being out to get you so terribly entertaining. You might find it... less so.
Hmm... Your creature doesn't appear to be fairing any better than before. Methinks your aim is off.
All you need to do is find something to wake our poor Pelagius up. You'll find his terrors easy to repel... but persistent.

You've headed down the path of dreams. Unfortunately for you, Pelagius suffered night terrors from a young age. He would lie in bed, paralyzed with fear, imagining his own nightmares coming to life. Ooohhh... Scary.
Well now, that's something to crow about. With Pelagius up and about you're moving right along. We'll both be home in no time.
Still can't wake him up? Perhaps you're barking up the wrong tree?
Irgnir, get a hold of yourself. They're just dreams. Please tell her, Erandur.
It's the same dream over and over again. You think that's normal? It's evil I tell you!
Erandur, she has a point. You keep telling us no harm will follow these dreams, but they must be an omen.
I... I will. Thank you...
It's a curse! It has to be! I've got to get out of this town.
Give me just a moment, and I'll have this open.
We must reach the inner sanctum and destroy it. Come, there's no time to lose.
Behold the Skull of Corruption, the source of Dawnstar's woes.
Now I can show you the source of the nightmares. Over here.
Be careful... we're certain to find more of the awakened within.
It's just up here.
Give him a chance to speak. He's trying to help us.
This library used to be filled with arcane volumes. Now look at it; almost everything's been burned.
I hope the tome we need is still intact.
Veren... Thorek... you're alive!
Then you leave me no choice!
Wait...
I can't allow you to destroy the Skull, Priest of Mara.
Enough of your lies!
No. I... I was scared. I wasn't ready to sleep.
You're a traitor. You left us to die and then ran before the Miasma took you.
I no longer use that name. I'm Erandur, Priest of Mara.
No thanks to you, Casimir.
First, an incantation to remove the barrier.
Listen to your friend, Fruki. They are just dreams, my dear. I assure you that it is quite normal.
Everyone, please. I'm doing what I can to end these nightmares.
In the meantime all I ask is you remain strong and put your trust in Lady Mara.
I call upon you, Lady Mara!
The Skull hungers. It yearns for memories and leaves nightmares in its wake.
Grant me the power to break through this barrier and to send the Skull to the depths of Oblivion!
It feels good to finally have a chance to help these people. Helplessly watching them suffer's been difficult.
Follow me, it's this way.
Perhaps my prayers were answered and your reason for stumbling across Dawnstar is more than a mere coincidence.
There's a small shrine to Mara I established inside the tower's entry hall. I was hoping to seek spiritual guidance from Her.
The temple's been abandoned for decades now. Ironic isn't it... a ruin within a ruin?
Prepare yourself.
When the temple was active the priests would rarely be seen in Dawnstar. They preferred to live a solitary existence.
Beyond these doors is the inner sanctum and the Skull of Corruption.
I'm not familiar with the tower's history, but it was deserted for quite a long time before Nightcaller Temple was established inside.
The tower on that hill is our destination. People around here call it the Tower of the Dawn.
Release the Miasma! Release it now! Hurry, Casimir, hurry!
We can't hold them! Go, Casimir! Run!
We can't hold them back! Go! Get to the Barrier! Release the Miasma!
Keep going, Casimir! Release the Miasma!
Quickly! Kill him now. Kill him and claim the Skull for your own! Vaermina commands you!
When the ritual's complete, the Skull will be free and then Erandur will turn on you.
He's deceiving you.
Yay!
Aventus really did it! He got the Dark Brotherhood to kill old Grelod! Ha ha ha ha ha!
Ha ha ha ha ha! Hooray!
Grelod is dead! Aventus did it! Ha ha ha ha ha!
Hooray! Grelod the Kind is dead at last! We're saved!
Someone has killed Grelod! Ha ha ha ha ha!
Hurrah! Hurrah!
We love you, Dark Brotherhood! Ha ha ha ha ha!

Sweet Mother, sweet Mother, send your child unto me, for the sins of the unworthy must be baptized in blood and fear. Please... How long must I do this? I keep praying, Night Mother. Why won't you answer me? So... very tired... Grelod, you old crone. You'll get what you deserve. The Dark Brotherhood will see to that... Die, Grelod! Die!
It's Grelod!
Wh... What? A crime? Me? Preposterous! Poor Cicero is just standing here! Cicero loves order. Oh yes! He would never disrespect the law!
Damn that Loreius. Oh, how he will pay for this treachery...
You there! Fool! Hold fast. You've been accused of a crime against the laws of this land. What say you in your defense?
You look like a crazy man to me. And what's in that coffin, hmm? Maybe some time in a cell will help loosen that lying tongue.
You just keep quiet and stay where you are. Soon as my relief arrives, we'll all take a nice little trip.
Oh, but I will speak. I will speak to you. For you are the one.
Yes, you. You, who shares my iron tomb, who warms my ancient bones. I give you this task - journey to Volunruud. Speak with Amaund Motierre.
Oh, but how can I defend you? How can I exert your will? If you will not speak? To anyone!
Are you all right? I heard the commotion. Who was Cicero talking to? Where's the accomplice? Reveal yourself, traitor!
What? The Listener? What are you going on about? What is this lunacy?
It's true, it's true! The Night Mother has spoken! The silence has been broken! The Listener has been chosen!
By Sithis, this ends now! Back away, fool! Whatever you've been planning is over!

I spoke only to the Night Mother! I spoke to the Night Mother, but she didn't speak to me. Oh no. She spoke only to him! To the Listener! I spoke only to the Night Mother! I spoke to the Night Mother, but she didn't speak to me. Oh no. She spoke only to her! To the Listener!
What about you? Have you... have you spoken to anyone? No.... No, of course not. I do the talking, the stalking, the seeing and saying!
...sweet Night Mother.
Are we alone? Yes... yes... alone. Sweet solitude. No one will hear us, disturb us. Everything is going according to plan.
The others... I've spoken to them. And they're coming around, I know it. The wizard, Festus Krex... perhaps even the Argonian, and the un-child...
And what do you do? Nothing! Not... not that I'm angry! No, never! Cicero understands. Heh. Cicero always understands! And obeys!
You will talk when you're ready, won't you? Won't you...
Tell Cicero the time has come. Tell him the words he has been waiting for, all these years: "Darkness rises when silence dies."
What? What treachery! Defiler! Debaser and defiler! You have violated the sanctity of the Night Mother's tomb! Explain yourself!
Poor Cicero has failed you. Poor Cicero is sorry, sweet mother. I've tried, so very hard. But I just can't find the Listener.
Poor Cicero. Dear Cicero. Such a humble servant. But he will never hear my voice. For he is not the Listener.
The sealed letter will explain everything that needs to be done. The amulet is quite valuable - you can use it to pay for any and all expenses.
Rexus. The items.
And when the elves marched into your beloved Cyrodiil, and everyone took up arms against them, wasn't that treason? Against the Dominion? Huh?
Oh, I know enough. I know those trouble-making Stormcloaks refuse to submit to Imperial authority. Such seditious behavior. Why it's treason!
Why that's not the same thing at all. The Dominion were invaders. Conquerors. We had to fight them, to preserve our own way of life.
Typical Imperial rot. You speak of Skyrim like you know the land, know its people. You're from Cyrodiil! You know nothing about us! Nothing!
My point exactly.

Today, the problems of Skyrim are not my problems. Nor are they yours. Today we are joined in peace and happiness. So please, enjoy yourselves. These days, it seems there is dread everywhere, whether it be war or dragon. But I beg you - here, today, put such fears aside. Enjoy yourselves! In this courtyard, there are no Stormcloaks. There are no Imperials. There are only people, come to celebrate a union of two souls. So make merry!

I thank you all again for making this the best wedding a woman could ask for. You have all helped make this a truly extraordinary wedding. All of my dreams have come true. So thank you. Thank you all. May you all be as happy in your lives as I know I will be in mine. Thank you again for everything.
Honored guests. Good people of Solitude. Good friends and neighbors.

I just wanted to take this time to thank you all for being here. To thank you for sharing this wonderfully happy day with myself, and my new husband. Are you all enjoying yourselves? Please, eat, drink, and make merry on this most happy of days. My husband Aesgir and I thank you for coming to our reception. We thank you for sharing the love we have for each other.
Aaaaiiiiieeee!
What treachery?
The bride has been murdered! Somebody help!
Vittoria! No!
No! Noooooooo!

La la la, la la la, la la la, la la la la. La la la, la la la la la laaaaaahhhh... La la la, do do do do do, dum de dum dum...  Dum, di di dum, dum di dum, dum di di di di dum da da dum. Ba ba ba, bum ba, ba ba ba, bum ba, ba da da da, dum da da...
I understand. But you're being paranoid. I'm inspecting security, not charging off into battle. There's not a lot that can go wrong.
Son, when the Emperor's safety is concerned, anything could go wrong. Off with you, now. And good travels.
Farewell, father. I'll return as soon as I'm able.
Well, this is it, then. Look after yourself, Gaius. You're doing your duty, and I'm proud of you. But you'd better come back to me. You hear?
Oh, Faida. I may travel alone, but you know I carry you always in my heart. I'll see you soon.
Father, you worry too much. I'll be fine.
I know you will. But all the same, remember everything I said. Stay alert, and when you get to the cities, make your observations and move on.
All right, so Cicero attacked that harlot, Astrid! But what's a fool to do, when his mother is slandered and mocked? Surely the Listener understands!
If it's any comfort, I do feel slightly bad about Veezara. Stupid lizard got in my way! But please tell me that hulking sheepdog has bled to death.
Cicero admits, he thought the Listener would be dead by now. Heh. Maybe we could just forget all this? Hmm? Let bygones be bygones? What do you say?
And now we come to the end of our play. The grand finale.
Oh, but this isn't at all what Mother would want. You kill the Keeper or I kill the Listener? Now that's madness.
Listener! Is that you? Oh, I knew you'd come. Send the best to defeat the best. Astrid knew her stupid wolf couldn't slay sly Cicero.
Brrr! Chilly! You'll enjoy this. Not an original part of the Sanctuary, per se. Let's call it a "forced addition." Forced by what? Oh, come and see!
You're... still alive. Cicero respects the Listener's abilities, of course, but could you at least slow down a bit? I'm not what I used to be. Heh.
Ouch! Pointy pointy! My home is well defended. I always have been a stickler for details. Get it? "Stick-ler." Ha ha ha ha ha ha ha! Oh, I slay me!
Oh... Oh how marvelous. Just delicious. It is everything I had hoped it would be. It.... I....
Oh... Oh how marvelous. Just delicious. It is everything I had hoped it would be. Please, everyone. Enjoy.
I think something's... wrong... I...
I suppose. But what about the old man? Son killed, family name ruined... and he acts as if nothing even happened. Think he's even fit for duty?
I'm going to pretend I didn't hear that. Commander Maro is the best the Penitus Oculatus has ever produced. You should be half the man he is.
You misunderstand. It's just... I feel for him, is all. To carry a weight like that. It's got to take its toll. That happened to me, I'd be a wreck.
