What are you doing? We need to get out of Helgen. Now!
I just need to gather some more potions.
Grab everything important and let's move! Dragon's burning everything to the ground!
I'm not waiting to be killed by a dragon! We need to fall back!
Orders are to wait until General Tullius arrives.
Just give me a minute. Let me think.
Where in Oblivion are we supposed to go? Where's the way out?
Just give the General some time!
Look at him, General Tullius the Military Governor.
No, this can't be happening. This isn't happening.
General Tullius, sir! The headsman is waiting!
And it looks like the Thalmor are with him. Damn elves. I bet they had something to do with this.
By your orders, Captain.
You're not going to kill me!
Archers!
Get these prisoners out of the carts. Move it!

I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Black Marsh. I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to High Rock. I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Morrowind. I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to the Summerset Isle. I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Cyrodiil. I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Elsweyr. I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Orsinium. I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Hammerfell. I'm sorry. We'll make sure your remains are returned to Valenwood. I'm sorry. At least you'll die here, in your homeland.
Dragon!
You better get some gear. See if one of these chests has some armor for you. Got to be a sword or two in one of these chests. Look around.

Grab Gunjar's gear. No shame in borrowing a friend's axe. Gunjar isn't coming back from the dead. Take his armor and anything else on him. That armor on Gunjar isn't doing him any good. Go ahead. Take it.
This way. Come on! There's a way out through here! We have to keep moving.
I'll stay here and wait for General Tullius. Good luck you two.
We're all brothers and sisters in binds now, thief.
You there. You and me - we shouldn't be here. It's these Stormcloaks the Empire wants.
If they hadn't been looking for you, I could've stolen that horse and be halfway to Hammerfell.
Damn you Stormcloaks. Skyrim was fine until you came along. Empire was nice and lazy.
Shor, Mara, Dibella, Kynareth, Akatosh. Divines, please help me.
You were trying to cross the border, right? Walked right into that Imperial ambush, same as us, and that thief over there.
Hey, you. You're finally awake.
(muffled grunts)
You started this war, plunged Skyrim into chaos, and now the Empire is going to put you down, and restore the peace.
Let's see here....
Come on, soldier. Keep moving!
All right, get that armor on and give that axe a few swings.
It's locked. See if you can get it open with some picks. We might need that gold once we get out.
Sure, take all my things. Please.
You better get that armor on. Give that sword a few swings, too.
Grab anything useful and let's go.
Or if you're feeling lucky, you can take this bow. Might take her by surprise.
Funny, when I was a boy, Imperial walls and towers used to make me feel so safe.
Rorikstead. I'm... I'm from Rorikstead.
A Nord's last thoughts should be of home.
Why do you care?
Hey, what village are you from horse thief?
Give them their last rites.
Yes, General Tullius.
As you wish.
Let's cut you loose. Come on, you need your hands free. Those binds aren't going to cut themselves.
You Imperial bastards!
Death to the Stormcloaks!
Justice!
Don't bother with that. Lost the key ages ago. Poor fellow screamed for weeks.
See if you can get it open with some picks. We'll need everything we can get.
Shut up back there!
As fearless in death as he was in life.
It has been an honor, Jarl Ulfric!
Halt!
It's in the clouds!
Good. Let's get this over with.
Quick, I can cut you loose inside the keep. Come on! We need to get inside! Where are you going? The barracks is through here! We've got to get inside. Now!
Jump! Come on! Get going! Through the inn! Now! You still here? Go!
Go! Now! Get moving! Go!
We need to move. Now!
Up the stairs! Quickly! Move! Up the tower! Come on! Before the dragon brings down the whole tower! What are you waiting for? Up the stairs! Now!
Gunnar, take care of the boy. I have to find General Tullius and join the defense.
Quickly, follow me!
Still alive, prisoner? Keep close to me if you want to stay that way.
Stay close to the wall!
That a boy. You're doing great.
Haming, you need to get over here. Now!
That's it, son. Make me proud.
Gods guide you, Hadvar.
Get up, papa! Get up!
I'm done for, little cub. Go. Run for it!

Hey, kinsman. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! Hey, dark elf. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! Hey, Breton. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! Hey, Khajiit. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! Hey, Argonian. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! Hey, high elf. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! Hey, wood elf. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! Hey, Redguard. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! Hey, Orc. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance! Hey, you. Get up! Come on, the gods won't give us another chance!
Come on. Give me your hand, I'm getting you out of here.
Tell my family I fought bravely.
Torolf!
Gods... Everyone get back!
It's too late for that. Leave me. Save yourself.
The wounds are deep, Vilod! I can't stop the blood.
See the inn on the other side? Jump through the roof and keep going!
It's you and me, prisoner. Stay close!
Get back!
Go! We'll follow when we can!
General Tullius, over here!
In here! This way! Come on! Over here!

Run, you idiot! To the keep! Move! What? Do you want to be that thing's next meal? Into the keep, already! Thought I told you to run for it! Go! Soldiers, townspeople, and dregs into the keep! Everyone to the keep!
This way!
Has everyone here forgotten their training? Kill that thing! I want every arrow in the sky! Keep firing! Lead with those arrows, dammit! Damn you mages! Aren't you good for anything?
Up through the tower, let's go!
Jarl Ulfric! What is that thing? Could the legends be true?
Haming, get over here! Just walk towards me, come on! Don't look up. Just focus on me. You can do it!
Legends don't burn down villages.
What are you doing? Get off the road! Get off the road, boy!
Come on, this way! Through here. Let's go! I can cut you loose inside. Come on!
Ralof! You damned traitor. Out of my way!
You! Come on, into the keep!
Fine. I hope that dragon takes you all to Sovngarde.
We're escaping, Hadvar. You're not stopping us this time.
With me, prisoner. Let's go!
We just need to move some of these rocks to clear the way!
Let's go! With me, up the tower! This way, friend! Move!
Hadvar! Into the keep, soldier, we're leaving!
Who's this, then?
It's all right, Irileth. I want to hear what he has to say. It's all right, Irileth. I want to hear what she has to say.
My lord. Please. You have to listen. I only counsel caution. We cannot afford to act rashly in times like these. If the news from Helgen is true... well, there's no telling what it means.
My lord. Please. This is no time for rash action. I just think we need more information before we act.
What would you have me do, then? Nothing?
I just...
We should not...
Irileth, send a detachment to Riverwood at once.
Enough!
The Jarl of Falkreath will view that as a provocation! He'll assume we're preparing to join Ulfric's side and attack him.
It's in the most immediate danger, if that dragon is lurking in the mountains...
My lord, we should send troops to Riverwood at once.
What do you say now, Proventus? Shall we continue to trust in the strength of our walls? Against a dragon?
That would be best.
If you'll excuse me, I'll return to my duties.
I'll not stand idly by while a dragon burns my hold and slaughters my people!
Yes, my Jarl.
Shor's bones, what happened to you, boy?
Okay, okay. Come inside, then. Sigrid will get you something to eat and you can tell me all about it. Come on inside. Sigrid will get you something to eat and you can tell us what happened.
What's going on? And who's this?
Uncle Alvor! Hello!
Are you in some kind of trouble?
He's a friend. Saved my life in fact. Come on, I'll explain everything, but we need to go inside. She's a friend. Saved my life in fact. Come on, I'll explain everything, but we need to go inside.
Hadvar? What are you doing here? Are you on leave from... Hadvar, thank Talos! Your friend told me about Helgen...
Shh.. Uncle, please. Keep your voice down. I'm fine. But we should go inside to talk.
A dragon? That's... ridiculous. You aren't drunk, are you boy? When your friend told me, I didn't believe it at first either.
Hadvar, did you really see a dragon? What did it look like? Did it have big teeth?
Sigrid! We have company!
I don't know if anyone else got out alive. I doubt I'd have made it out myself if not for my friend here.
I need to get back to Solitude and let them know what's happened.
I thought you could help us out. Food, supplies, a place to stay.
Not much more to tell. This dragon flew over and just wrecked the whole place. Mass confusion.
I don't know where to start. You know I was assigned to General Tullius's guard.
We were stopped in Helgen when we were attacked... by a dragon.
Hadvar! We've been so worried about you! Come, you two must be hungry. Sit down and I'll get you something to eat.
Of course! Any friend of Hadvar's is a friend of mine. I'm glad to help however I can.
Hush, child. Don't pester your cousin.
Husband. Let him tell his story. Mara's mercy! A dragon... in Helgen? Why, it could be here at any moment!
Now, then, boy. What's the big mystery? What are you doing here, looking like you lost an argument with a cave bear? Now, then, boy. Helgen was destroyed? How did you get away?
Things look quiet enough here. Come on. There's my uncle.
Wait!
Looks like he's gone for good this time. But I don't think we should stick around to see if he comes back.
Draugr creeping down the mountain to climb through my window at night, that kind of thing. I admit, I still don't much like the look of it.
Well, I'd better get back to work. You two make yourselves at home. Well, I'd better get some sleep. Don't mind me, though. You two make yourselves at home.
See that ruin up there? Bleak Falls Barrow. When I was a boy, that place always used to give me nightmares.
I'm glad you decided to come with me. We're almost to Riverwood. You sure you won't change your mind? Riverwood isn't far. I'm sure my uncle will be glad to help you out.
Listen, as far as I'm concerned you've already earned your pardon.
But until we get that confirmed by General Tullius, just stay clear of other Imperial soldiers and avoid any complications, all right?
Go on, Hadvar. Let's hear the rest of it.
I'm sure Riverwood will be all right, dear. When the Jarl learns what's happened, he's sure to send soldiers.

Mage, eh? Well, to each his own. It's not for me to judge. Thief, eh? It's never too late to take charge of your own fate, you know. Warrior, good! I knew you shouldn't have been on that cart the minute I laid eyes on you.
Go ahead, see for yourself.
These are the Guardian Stones, three of the thirteen ancient standing stones that dot Skyrim's landscape.
Brother! Mara's mercy, it's good to see you! Brother! Mara's mercy, you're safe! Your friend told me about Helgen...
Hod! Come here a minute. I need your help with something.
And who's this? One of your comrades?
Gerdur...
Is there somewhere we can talk? There's no telling when the news from Helgen will reach the Imperials...
But is it safe for you to be here? We heard that Ulfric had been captured... But is it safe for you to be here? Won't the Imperials be looking for you?
Ralof! What are you doing here? Ah... I'll be right down.
Gerdur!
Not a comrade yet, but a friend. I owe him my life, in fact. Not a comrade yet, but a friend. I owe her my life, in fact.
Looks like nobody here knows what's happened yet. Come on. Gerdur's probably working in her lumber mill.
You're right. Follow me.
Gerdur, I'm fine. At least now I am.
Are you hurt? What's happened?
They wouldn't dare give Ulfric a fair trial. Treason, for fighting for your own people! All of Skyrim would have seen the truth then.
Any friend of Ralof's is a friend of mine.
I can hardly believe it myself, and I was there.
I can't remember when I last slept...
But then... out of nowhere... a dragon attacked...
Nonsense. You and your friend are welcome to stay here as long as you need to.
Let me worry about the Imperials.
Thanks, sister. I knew we could count on you.
Go and watch the south road. Come find us if you see any Imperial soldiers coming.
We stopped in Helgen this morning, and I thought it was all over. Had us lined up to the headsman's block and ready to start chopping.
Like they knew exactly where we'd be. That was... two days ago, now.
Where to start? Well, the news you heard about Ulfric was true. The Imperials ambushed us outside Darkwater Crossing.
You don't mean, a real, live... When your friend told me, I didn't believe it at first either.
I ought to get back to work before I'm missed, but... did anyone else escape? Did Ulfric...
Don't worry. I'm sure he made it out. It'll take more than a dragon to stop Ulfric Stormcloak.
Mind your mother, boy!
I'll let them into the house and, you know, show them where everything is...
Hmph. Help them drink up our mead, you mean.
Uncle Ralof! Can I see your axe? How many Imperials have you killed? Do you really know Ulfric Stormcloak?
The cowards!
As strange as it sounds, we'd be dead if not for that dragon. In the confusion, we managed to slip away.
Are we really the first to make it to Riverwood?
Nobody else has come up the south road today, as far as I know.
Good luck, brother. I'll see you later.
Look at you, almost a grown man! Won't be long before you'll be joining the fight yourself.
Now, Ralof, what's going on? You two look pretty well done in.
Good. Maybe we can lay up for a while. I hate to put your family in danger, Gerdur, but...
Wait!
There he goes. Looks like he's gone for good this time.
I guess you get used to it.
That's right! Don't worry, Uncle Ralof, I won't let those soldiers sneak up on you.
Don't worry about me. I know how to lay low.
Helgen? Has something happened...?
What is it, woman? Sven drunk on the job again?
Hod. Just come here.
Hush, Frodnar. This is no time for your games.
Aw, mama, I want to stay and talk with Uncle Ralof!
Remember, this isn't Stormcloak territory. If we're ahead of the news from Helgen we should be fine as long as we don't do anything stupid.
If we run into any Imperials, just let me do the talking, all right?
I'm glad you decided to come with me. We're almost to Riverwood. You sure you won't change your mind? Riverwood isn't far. I'm sure my sister will be glad to help you out.
See that ruin up there? Bleak Falls Barrow. I never understood how my sister could stand living in the shadow of that place.
No way to know if anyone else made it out alive. But this place is going to be swarming with Imperials soon enough. We'd better clear out of here.
Mage, eh? Well, to each his own. It's not for me to judge. Thief, eh? It's never too late to take charge of your own fate, you know. Warrior, good! Those stars will guide you to honor and glory.
Go ahead, see for yourself.
These are the Guardian Stones, three of the thirteen ancient standing stones that dot Skyrim's landscape.
Succeed at this, and you'll be rewarded. Whiterun will be in your debt.
I'm sure he will prove most useful. I'm sure she will prove most useful.
Of course, Jarl Balgruuf. You seem to have found me an able assistant.
This is a priority now. Anything we can use to fight this dragon, or dragons. We need it, quickly. Before it's too late.
Go ahead and fill him in with all the details. Go ahead and fill her in with all the details.
I'm sure you two will get along famously.
Farengar, I see you've already met my new friend here. Farengar, I think I've found someone who can help you with your dragon project.
It's just us against a dragon, is that it?
Your main job will be to keep an eye out and get the people to safety if the town is attacked.
Yes, Housecarl. We'll leave immediately.
I can't afford to send anyone else. And we don't know where the dragon is.
The Jarl has finally agreed to send you back to Riverwood.
Let's move out. Time's a wasting.
Of course. We'll keep Riverwood safe. You can count on it.
I don't expect the three of you to fight off a dragon by yourselves. But I do expect you to do your duty.
Perhaps dating to just after the Dragon War. If so, I could use this to cross-reference the names with other later texts.
You see? The terminology is clearly First Era or even earlier. I'm convinced this is a copy of a much older text.
Time is running, Farengar, don't forget. This isn't some theoretical question. Dragons have come back.
Yes, yes. Don't worry. Although the chance to see a living dragon up close would be tremendously valuable...
Oh, have no fear. The Jarl himself has finally taken an interest, so I'm now able to devote most of my time to this research.
Good. I'm glad you're making progress. My employers are anxious to have some tangible answers.
Now, let me show you something else I found... very intriguing... I think your employers may be interested as well...
Hmm? Ah, yes, the Jarl's protege! Back from Bleak Falls Barrow? You didn't die, it seems.
You have a visitor.
Yeah!
A dragon is attacking the Western Watchtower.
Now what do you say? Shall we go kill us a dragon?
That's a fair question. None of us have ever seen a dragon before, or expected to face one in battle.
But we are honorbound to fight it, even if we fail. This dragon is threatening our homes... our families.
But Housecarl... how can we fight a dragon?
You heard right! I said a dragon!
Here's the situation.
Damn right!
I don't much care where it came from or who sent it. What I do know is that it's made the mistake of attacking Whiterun!
No, my lord. It was just circling overhead when I left. I never ran so fast in my life... I thought it would come after me for sure.
I've already ordered my men to muster near the main gate.
One last thing, Irileth. This isn't a death or glory mission. I need to know what we're dealing with.
Irileth, you'd better gather some guardsmen and get down there.
Good. Don't fail me.
Good work, son. We'll take it from here. Head down to the barracks for some food and rest. You've earned it.
Yes, my lord.
The Greybeards...
You heard the summons. What else could it mean?
This hasn't happened in ... centuries, at least. Not since Tiber Septim himself was summoned when he was still Talos of Atmora!
That was the voice of the Greybeards, summoning you to High Hrothgar!
Didn't you hear the thundering sound as you returned to Whiterun?
I don't know!
Guardsman! What happened here? Where's this dragon? Quickly now!
No! Get back! It's still here somewhere! Hroki and Tor just got grabbed when they tried to make a run for it!
Kynareth save us, here he comes again...
No signs of any dragon right now, but it sure looks like he's been here.
Spread out and look for survivors. We need to know what we're dealing with.
What's happening?!
There weren't any dragons then, idiot. They're just coming back now for the first time in... forever.
Damned good shooting, boys!
Look at that!
But the old tales tell of the Dragonborn who could kill dragons and steal their power. You must be one!
I thought we were all dead for sure!
We killed it! I can't believe it!
Dragonborn? What are you talking about?
Is it really dead?
Let's make sure that overgrown lizard is really dead.
Everybody get back!
I never heard of Tiber Septim killing any dragons.
That's right! My grandfather used to tell stories about the Dragonborn.
We're with you!
No!
No, Housecarl!
Shut up.
Now we're in for it.
Let's move out.
What?
A dragon?
We're so dead...
Hmph. Some of you would be better off keeping quiet than flapping your gums on matters you don't know anything about.
Come on, Irileth, tell us, do you believe in this Dragonborn business?
What do you say, Irileth? You're being awfully quiet.

If you really are Dragonborn, like out of the old tales, you ought to be able to Shout. Can you? Have you tried? Go ahead... try to Shout. Have you tried to Shout? They say the Dragonborn can Shout without any training. Like Talos himself...
Those born with the Dragon Blood in 'em. Like old Tiber Septim himself.
Here's a dead dragon, and that's something I definitely understand. Now we know we can kill them.
That was Shouting, what you just did! Must be. You really are Dragonborn, then...
You... must be Dragonborn!
No matter. Go to High Hrothgar. Learn what the Greybeards can teach you.
Back to business, Proventus. We still have a city to defend.
High Hrothgar is a very peaceful place. Very... disconnected from the troubles of this world.
I wonder that the Greybeards even notice what's going on down here. They haven't seemed to care before.
I envy you, you know. To climb the 7,000 Steps again... I made the pilgrimage once, did you know that?
I know it looks bad, but we've got to figure out what happened. And if that dragon is still skulking around somewhere.
I should come along. I would very much like to see this dragon.
Don't worry, my lord. I'm the very soul of caution.
Tell him what you told me. About the dragon.
So, Irileth tells me you came from the western watchtower?
I'd take this a bit more seriously if I were you. If a dragon decides to attack Whiterun I don't know if we can stop it.
A dragon! How exciting! Where was it seen? What was it doing?
You should come, too.
Farengar, you need to come at once. A dragon's been sighted nearby.
As you command.
Farengar!
No. I can't afford to risk both of you. I need you here working on ways to defend the city against these dragons.
What did it do? Is it attacking the watchtower?
Uh... that's right. We saw it coming from the south. It was fast... faster than anything I've ever seen.
Let's go.
The glory of killing it is ours, if you're with me!
Could you call yourselves Nords if you ran from this monster? Are you going to let me face this thing alone?
But it's more than our honor at stake here. Think of it - the first dragon seen in Skyrim since the last age.
Wait for me.
You wouldn't understand, Housecarl. You ain't a Nord.
Just send me a copy when you've deciphered it.
You went into Bleak Falls Barrow and got that? Nice work.
Here he comes! Find cover and make every arrow count!
So your information was correct after all. And we have our friend here to thank for recovering it for us.
I'd advise you all to trust in the strength of your sword arm over tales and legends.
But I don't need some mythical Dragonborn. Someone who can put down a dragon is more than enough for me.
I've been all across Tamriel. I've seen plenty of things just as outlandish as this.
Nord nonsense?! Why you puffed-up ignorant... these are our sacred traditions that go back to the founding of the First Empire!
Capable as he may be, I don't see any signs of him being this, what, "Dragonborn." Capable as she may be, I don't see any signs of her being this, what, "Dragonborn."
Hrongar. Don't be so hard on Avenicci.
Whatever happened when you killed that dragon, it revealed something in you, and the Greybeards heard it.
If they think you're Dragonborn, who are we to argue?
You'd better get up to High Hrothgar immediately. There's no refusing the summons of the Greybeards. It's a tremendous honor.
Hrongar, calm yourself. What does any of this Nord nonsense have to do with our friend here?
Good. You're finally here. The Jarl's been waiting for you.
That's the Greybeards' business, not ours.
It's just that... what do these Greybeards want with him? It's just that... what do these Greybeards want with her?
I meant no disrespect, of course.

Impressive. Your Thu'um is precise. You show great promise, Dragonborn. You show promise. Remain focused, and you will fulfill your potential. You have the ability, but you need to learn discpline if you wish to fulfill your potential.
Master Einarth will now teach you "Ro," the second Word in Unrelenting Force.
Without training, you have already taken the first steps towards projecting your Voice into a Thu'um, a Shout.
Now let us see if you are willing and able to learn.
We will perform your next trial in the courtyard. Follow Master Borri.
Try it again. Breath and focus. Is this your best effort? Again. Come, Dragonborn. Attend to Master Borri.
Now we will see how quickly you can master a new Shout. Now we will see how quickly you can master a new Word.
Stand next to me. Master Borri will open the gate. Use your Whirlwind Sprint to pass through before it closes.
You learn a new word like a master... you truly do have the gift.
Dragonborn. It is you. Welcome to High Hrothgar.
As part of your initiation, Master Einarth will allow you to tap into his understanding of "Ro."
Well, that is how the rest of us learn Shouts. As Dragonborn, you can absorb a slain dragon's life force and knowledge directly.
But learning a Word of Power is only the first step... you must unlock its meaning through constant practice in order to use it in a Shout.
All Shouts are made up of three Words of Power. As you master each Word, your Shout will become progressively stronger.
Ro means "Balance" in the dragon tongue. Combine it with Fus - "Force" - to focus your Thu'um more sharply.
Use your Unrelenting Force shout to strike the targets as they appear.
When you Shout, you speak in the language of dragons. Thus, your Dragon Blood gives you an inborn ability to learn Words of Power.

Approach Master Borri and he will gift you his knowledge of "Wuld." Approach Master Borri and he will gift you his knowledge of "Nah." Approach Master Borri and he will gift you his knowledge of "Kest."
Master Wulfgar will now gift you with his knowledge of "Dah."
With all three words together, this Shout is much more powerful. Use it wisely.
You are ready to learn the final word of Unrelenting Force, "Dah," which means "Push."
We will now see how you learn a completely new Shout. I see that you have already begun to learn the Whirlwind Sprint Shout.

Master Borri will teach you "Wuld," which means "Whirlwind." Master Borri will teach you "Nah" - "Fury" - the second word of Whirlwind Sprint. Master Borri will teach you "Kest" - "Tempest"- the third word of Whirlwind Sprint.
Dovahkiin. You have tasted the Voice of the Greybeards, and passed through unscathed. High Hrothgar is open to you.
Do not be afraid. Your Shout will not harm us. Shout at us, and let us taste of your Voice. Strike us with the power of your Voice.
Now let us see how quickly you can master your new Thu'um.
Ro...
Master Wulfgar will demonstrate Whirlwind Sprint. Then it will be your turn.
You must hear the Word within yourself before you can project it into a Thu'um.
Wuld... Nah... Kest...
Now it is your turn.
Master Borri.
Lingrah krosis saraan Strundu'ul, voth nid balaan klov praan nau.
Stand between us, and prepare yourself. Few can withstand the unbridled Voice of the Greybeards. But you are ready.
You have completed your training, Dragonborn. We would Speak to you.
Dah...
Naal Thu'umu, mu ofan nii nu, Dovahkiin, naal suleyk do Kaan, naal suleyk do Shor, ahrk naal suleyk do Atmorasewuth.
Meyz nu Ysmir, Dovahsebrom. Dahmaan daar rok.
Now we can talk.
Close the door. Come on, close the door. You're not afraid of me, are you? Just close the door, will you?
Follow me.
Lorkhan's eyes! Look at that big bastard! Keep your head down, let's see what it does.
Alduin, thuri! Boaan tiid vokriiha suleyksejun kruziik?
Geh, Sahloknir, kaali mir.
I'll be damned, you did it!
This is worse than I thought...
So you really are...
Steady. I don't know what's happening. Let's watch and wait.
Wait. Something's happening... gods above!
Right. Happy trails.
Orgnar. I'm travelling. You've got the inn 'til I get back.
Kynesgrove is this way. We can travel together or split up and meet there, your choice.
That's better. Let's get on the road to Kynesgrove.
We need to talk.
Come on. Hurry. We might be too late.
Wait. Something's wrong.
Sahloknir! Ziil gro dovah ulse!
Ful, losei Dovahkiin? Zu'u koraav nid nol dov do hi.
Sahloknir, krii daar joorre.
You do not even know our tongue, do you? Such arrogance, to dare take for yourself the name of Dovah.
Just stay close and let me do any talking, got it? Follow me.
So far so good. Let's hope nobody saw us slip out.
We need to pass through the kitchen. Your gear is hidden in the larder.
Tss! Get out of here, I saw nothing.
Rules, is it, Tsavani? I didn't realize that eating Moon Sugar was permitted.
Your gear is in that chest. I'll lock the door behind you. Don't screw this up.
Who comes, Malborn? You know I don't like strange smells in my kitchen.
A guest, feeling ill. Leave the poor wretch be.
Perhaps I should ask the Ambassador...
A guest? In the kitchens? You know this is against the rules...
Hurry it up. I've got to get back before I'm missed. Come on. If someone misses me at the party, we're both dead. I need to lock the door behind you or the patrols might notice something's wrong.
No, no. I'll... I'll wait outside.
But, I need that money! I earned it.
Silence!
Do not presume, Gissur. You are most useful, but do not presume. We have other informants who are less... offensive.
Now, I have work to do. Leave me to it, if you ever want to see the rest of your payment.
Everyone talks, in the end.
That would probably be best.
Now get out!
You'd like to come downstairs with me, is that it, Gissur?
Shall we loose his bonds and put you in a cell together? You can ask him anything you like, and see how he answers.
I have my own expenses you know...
Can I... I could help you. He'd talk to me. He trusts me.
You'll get the rest of your money when we confirm his story. As agreed.
So he has talked! I knew it!
But no one else has brought you such valuable information, have they?
Etienne, he's talked, hasn't he? He knows where that old man is you're looking for, he told me himself.

He can't treat me like that. He needs me. Rulindil, pah! One day, the shoe will be on the other foot. I knew he was telling the truth. I always can tell. They're scared of the dragons, too, aren't they? Paying too well. They don't know anything. Etienne must know something related to the dragons... who else might know? Greasy Thom... no, they'd see right through him...
I don't think you were followed. Come on. I have a plan.
Now then. Here's my invitation, I don't have a poisoned dagger strapped to my thigh, et cetera, et cetera.
Ah! A fellow latecomer to Elenwen's little soiree.

I prefer to arrive early. Often the day before the party. So as not to miss out on any of the drinking. There's not enough drinking in the world today, wouldn't you agree? I will just... rest here a moment. Although it is damnably cold out here. I don't look forward to the trip back down... Perhaps we might share a carriage after the party? Please. Take your time. Don't mind me. I'm perfectly insensible to the cold. I'll go after you. Although these fellows know me. I never miss one of Elenwen's parties, you see.
I know, I know - we've just met. But think, by the time the party is over we'll no doubt be fast friends. I look forward to it.
Yes, yes. Now to find myself a drink.
My lateness is due more to getting lost on the way up this gods-forsaken mountain than to any desire to actually arrive late.
Everything's in order. Welcome back, sir.
And arriving by carriage, no less! I salute you, sir! And arriving by carriage, no less! I salute you, my good lady!
I'm just doing my duty, sir.
And his name is...?
No, wait! I was just... catching my breath... why wouldn't I tell you again? I don't even know anything...
Silence, prisoner!
There's an old man. He lives in Riften.
He could be this Esbern you're looking for, but I don't know. He's old and seemed kind of crazy. That's all I know.
No... for pity's sake... I've already told you everything...
I don't know his name. Like I've told already a hundred-
Ahhhh!
You know the rules.
You know the rules. Just answer the questions.
Noooooo!!!
And where can we find this nameless old man?
Stop. Please. I don't know anything else. Don't you think I'd have told you already?
Start at the beginning, as usual.
Like I said, I don't know! I've seen him down in the Ratway. Maybe he lives down there, but I don't know for sure.
That will be all for now. I must say I continue to be disappointed in your lack of cooperation. I hope next time you will do better.
What else do you want from me? I've already told you everything. Listen, if you let me go I can take you to Riften, show you where-
If you persist in this stubbornness I'll have...
Silence. You know the rules. Do not speak unless spoken to. Master Rulindil will ask the questions.
Gaaaaah!!!
Let's begin again.
Silence, traitor! Move. Slowly.
Surrender immediately or you both die.
Listen up, spy! You're trapped in here, and we have your accomplice.
He's got to be here somewhere.
Good luck. You're on your own now.
Never mind, I'm dead already-
Yes, Madame Ambassador.
Of course. I've told you before not to bother me with such trifles.
Do I have your permission to uncork the Arenthia red...
It's just that we've run out of the Alto wine.
What is it, Malborn?
Madame Ambassador, I'm so sorry to interrupt...
My apologies. We'll have to get better acquainted later. Please, enjoy yourself.
Razelan. What are you doing?
Someone bring me a drink, quick!
Fine, fine. Get your hands off me. I'll be a good boy now.
Wouldn't want to offend our Thalmor overlords, would we?
Attention, everyone! Could I have your attention, please! I have an announcement to make!
I propose a toast to Elenwen! Our mistress!
I speak figuratively, of course. Nothing could be more unlikely than that someone would actually want her in their bed.
Although... most of you are already in bed with her! But again... I speak figuratively, of course!

I protest! This is an insult to the dignity of my person! This time I'm completely innocent! This is preposterous. Disrespect... insulting! I am tired of being hounded from all sides! Madame Ambassador, you know that I would never have behaved... that is to say... well I swear I'm innocent this time!
I'm sure he'll behave himself for the rest of the evening, won't you dear? I apologize for the disruption to such a festive occasion. I'm sure he's learned his lesson. Let's try to enjoy ourselves.

Oh, Ambassador Elenwen, that won't be necessary. It is just Razelan, after all. Well, now. There's no need to ruin the party on my account. I don't think he'll be bothering me again. Forgive me, Ambassador. I allowed this... fool to provoke me. The fault is mine. There is no need for further disruption on my account. I'm sorry, Ambassador. I didn't mean to cause such a commotion. There's no need to have him thrown out on my account. Tell your men to stand down. I don't need any help dealing with this kind of fool. He isn't worth the trouble. Dear me. All this trouble over me? I think I was confused. There's no harm in him. Please, let him go. Oh... I'm afraid I may have overreacted. Please, I've already forgotten whatever it was he said to me.

Absolutely not! I protest... uh, that is, yes, of course. I still don't understand what just... oh never mind. That is absolutely untrue! Uh, that is, yes, of course. What... I don't understand why everyone... never mind.

The head office will hear of this, Razelan! You're a disgrace to the East Empire Company, and to the Empire itself! You take it back then? You retract your statement? Well? Your insults and provocations have gone far enough! I know you're drunk as usual, but that's no excuse for insulting our hostess. Begone, serpent! Begone from this house and trouble it no more! There's no excuse for your behavior! You're a disgrace to the Empire. To think that you're actually the representative of the East Empire Company.

How dare you! You disgusting pig! Right here! I see it in your face! The snakes writhe behind your eyes! Get away, get away from me! How dare you speak of the Thalmor in such a disgusting manner! Well, I don't think you should stay things like that about the Ambassador! Ulfric Stormcloak? The rightful High King? That's bordering on treason, man! Stand up. Stand up, I say! What...! Do you know who I am? I should have you taken up and flogged! You've got a lot of nerve, suggesting something like that, to me of all people! If this was Riften, I'd have you thrown in the dungeon!
Just play along. No harm is meant to you, happy fool. Hey, Razelan, remember when you told me I'd never amount to anything? It's all for a good cause, old chap.
Razelan. And you promised to behave yourself this time. Razelan. What is it this time?
Remove him. He's disturbing the other guests.

What? I didn't... hmm? No, listen, you must have misunderstood... I don't mean to say I wouldn't be interested... what I mean is... What? I didn't... hmm? No, listen, you must have misunderstood... I would never openly insult your... that is to say... I don't understand... did you say Ulfric Stormcloak? Fine fellow, although a bit too fond of... I mean, no, of course, I condemn him in the most... Hmm? Did you say snakes? Where? I hate them, always slithering they way they do... what? Are they on me? What? Of course I know who you are... I didn't mean to suggest, that is, I don't remember even saying that...

I'd kill you where you stand if I wasn't bound by my oath as an officer of the Aldmeri Dominion. I don't think anyone deserves that kind of abuse! I've known plenty of elves who were perfectly decent people. Beware of the serpent in your midst! Beware, oh people of Skyrim! You behave like you're carousing in a house of ill repute, not the residence of the Thalmor Ambassador! When people talk about the decadent, tottering Empire, it's people like you they have in mind!
Don't you dare walk away from me, you slut! Do you know who I am?
There's a likely-looking filly. Even if she is an elf.
Please, sir, leave me alone!
Um, thank you. Sir. Was there anything else I can do for you?
You there! Serving girl! What's your name, dear?
Oh... not at the moment. Maybe later. Don't go far.
Uh, Brelas, sir. Did you need a drink? Something to eat?
So. You think you can toy with me, is that it? No, my dear. I have my heart set on you, and I always get what I want. Hello, my dear. I got your message. Where shall we go?
What? I'm sorry, sir, but you must have misunderstood. I'm not permitted to leave the party. I'm sorry, sir. I didn't mean to give you the wrong impression earlier. I meant no disrespect.
Yes, sir.

Oh, I don't think so. I think I understand perfectly. Don't worry, my dear, I will make any necessary excuses to your employer. Oh, don't worry. I'll let you make it up to me. Now, where can we go for a little privacy, hmm?
No, I'm sorry, but I can't go anywhere with you. I won't. Please, I must get back to my duties.
And believe me, I don't say that to everyone. I'm very discriminating when it comes to the female form.
I just wanted to get a better look at you. I like what I see, my dear.
No, no, that's not what I'm interested in right now.
Mistress Elenwen, it's not true! I did nothing!
I demand that you have this wench removed from my presence at once!
Well, I'm glad that little unpleasantness is over.
Sir, you must tell her! You don't know what they'll do to me! Please!
No!
Now you're going to be sorry you crossed me.
Is that so, Erikur? And you with such delicate sensibilities. It must have been most upsetting.
Elenwen! This servant girl has been throwing herself at me in a most disgusting manner.
Well. Whatever the truth of it, I'm sure a few words with Master Rulindil will have a salutary effect. Take her downstairs.
It's very nice to meet you. You'll have to excuse Orthus here. He so rarely gets back to civilization. Stuck in Windhelm, poor fellow.
Don't worry, Orthus. I'm doing my best to get you reassigned to Solitude.
Vittoria! There's someone I'd like you to meet.
Oh, don't worry about me. I relish the challenge.
An old woman can get away with almost anything. Watch this.
As much as can be expected, yes. I have no complaints. I suppose so, yes. Everything is splendid, thank you. Very much so, and thank you for asking.
Are you enjoying the party? Is the food and drink to your liking? Is my staff seeing to your needs?
Splendid. Call if you have need of me. It pleases me to hear you say so. Excellent. I'll leave you to it, then.
With any luck, a worthy hero will step forward and solve our problems, just like in the tales of old. We must keep faith in ourselves and the Divines. These are troubling times, indeed.

We've got our hands full dealing with the Stormcloaks. What about you? Are the dragons frightening your people as much as they're frightening mine? Have you found it difficult to get provisions lately? I can scarcely feed the staff in my palace. Between the dragons and the Stormcloaks, my coffers are running dry.
We've had the same troubles. I've spent many hours in council meetings lately grappling with that problem.

Yes, I agree with you. Have you heard any news from the other parts of Skyrim? You speak truly. Have you heard any interesting rumors of late? I'll not argue that. Heard any interesting gossip lately? I couldn't agree more. By the way, have you heard any interesting rumors lately? I couldn't have said it better myself. It's been some time since I've had news from elsewhere in Skyrim. What have you heard? I know just what you mean. Heard anything interesting lately? Any news or gossip?

I heard Elenwen say she's going open a bottle of her best Firebrand Wine later. I can hardly wait. These Stormcloaks are nothing more than an armed mob. This war won't last much longer. I hope they'll serve the roast venison with bittergreen sauce that we had at the last party. This war has taken a toll on the merchants of Skyrim. Let's hope that it ends soon, for their sake. I look forward to the day when this rebellion is put down, and we once again have peace. The Gray Quarter in Windhelm is little better than a slum. It's shameful that the dark elves are made to live that way. With the soldiers all fighting in the war, there's nobody to hunt down the bandits. Travel has become dangerous of late. It's been a brutal winter. I can't remember the last time it was this cold, and for this long.
That was delicious.

Well, I did hear that the Argonians have been banned from living inside the walls of Windhelm. Have you visited Rorikstead lately? No matter how harsh the winter, the crops that grow there never falter. Now that I think on it, I did hear something rather interesting the other day. Well, there might be nothing to it, but I've heard that the feud between the Gray-Manes and the Battle-Borns in Whiterun has grown ugly. I'm not sure that it's news, but lately it seems like every blacksmith in Skyrim is out to prove that he's the equal of Eorlund Gray-Mane. Well, I did see something interesting not long ago. I heard those mages up in Winterhold have been trying to figure out how many dragons there are in Skyrim. Well, I did hear that Ulfric Stormcloak was slain while defending Windhelm against a dragon, but it sounds too good to be true.

They're only allowed on the city docks now. Most of them sleep together in one building, and they're as poor as wretches. Even when every other farm in the hold is barely scraping by, the harvest at Rorikstead is always bountiful. Apparently, the Red Wave has been docked in Solitude for well over a month, and with no sign of shipping out any time soon. Fralia Gray-Mane is convinced that the Battle-Borns have abducted one of her sons. It's not really a fair comparison, if you ask me. There were several Khajiit camped outside the walls of Whiterun. Seems they've been traveling around the whole of Skyrim peddling their wares. They seem to think it's at least a dozen, but I'm sure they're exaggerating. I'll wager it was Ulfric himself that started the rumor. Maybe he thought it would bolster recruitment.

Is it good fortune? The blessings of the Divines? Who knows? Some say the ship suffered damage to her hull when she struck an iceberg, and Captain Safia can't afford the repairs.  After all, Eorlund works the Skyforge. How is any smith going to compete with that? You've got to admire their courage, doing something like that with dragons on the loose and a war going on. They're probably trying to scare us into giving them more money and influence, so they can save us from the dragons threat.
Of course, she would never admit such a thing. Captain Safia is far too proud a woman for that.
Ha. I'd like to see those arrogant bastards taken down a notch. Always looking down their noses at us lowly footsloggers.
If a dragon does show up, maybe we'll get lucky and it will eat the mages first. Might give us enough time to kill it.
Ah, good. I've been wondering how we were supposed to defend this place from a dragon.
No. They're high mages, just in from Alinor. I guess Herself is finally getting worried about all the dragon attacks.
Did you see those robes march in this morning? Who're they with? More of the Emissary's treaty enforcers?
Well, we'd better get back to our rounds.
Come in, come in! Make yourself at home! Please. Come in. Musn't talk in the Ratway. Come in, come in. Too many ears out there. Come in. Quickly now.
This'll just take a moment...
Only a couple more.
This one always sticks... there we go.
There we are!
But, give me... just a moment... I must gather a few things...
One moment, I know, time is of the essence, but mustn't leave secrets for the Thalmor... there's one more I must bring...
I'll need this... No, no, useless trash... where'd I put my annotated Anuad?
Well, I guess that's good enough... let's be off...
You're sure?
Of course I'm sure! He was asking about Esbern. Of course I'm sure! She was asking about Esbern.
Doesn't matter. We'll kill them either way.
He's in the Flagon right now. Get ready. She's in the Flagon right now. Get ready.
That one right there, walking out the door. He was one of them asking about that old man you're looking for.
That's better. Now we can talk.
You'd better clear out before someone gets hurt.
The answer ain't gonna be any different the next time. Arrogant elven bastard.
Where is he? The one who was asking about the fugitive hiding in the Ratway?
No. Not yet.
Your lack of cooperation has been noted. We'll be back if we require further information. You won't get a second chance.
You're in the wrong place to be asking those kind of questions, pal.
That's done it! Look, it's coming to life!
You did it. There's the entrance!
There's no telling what we might find inside!
Ah... here's the "blood seal." Another of the lost Akaviri arts. No doubt triggered by... well, blood.
Your blood, Dragonborn.
Wonderful! Remarkably well-preserved, too.
After you, Dragonborn. You should have the honor of being the first to set foot in Sky Haven Temple.
Esbern's probably right. Try using your blood on the carved seal on the floor. If you need help drawing some blood, let me know. Try dripping blood onto the carving on the floor.

Look here! You see how the ancient Blades revered Reman Cyrodiil. This whole place appears to be a shrine to Reman. He ended the Akaviri invasion under mysterious circumstances, you recall. After the so-called "battle" of Pale Pass, the Akaviri went into his service. This was the foundation stone of the Second Empire. Gods above, what are you waiting for?
Shor's bones! Here it is! Alduin's Wall... so well preserved... I've never seen a finer example of early second era Akaviri sculptural relief...
You see, here he is falling from the sky. The Nord Tongues -- masters of the Voice -- are arrayed against him.
Alduin's defeat is the centerpiece of the Wall.
Yes, yes. Let's see what we have...
Here, the humans rebel against their dragon overlords -- the legendary Dragon War.
So we're looking for a Shout, then. Damn it.
Are you paying attention, Delphine? You might learn something of our own history.
But... there's no way to know what Shout is meant.
Yes, yes. This here, coming from the mouths of the Nord heroes -- this is the Akaviri symbol for "Shout."
Look, here. In the third panel.
The prophecy which brought the Akaviri to Tamriel in the first place, in search of the Dragonborn.
Esbern. We need information, not a lecture on art history.
"When the thrice-blessed fail and the Red Tower trembles"
"When the Dragonborn Ruler loses his throne, and the White Tower falls"
"When the Brass Tower walks and Time is reshaped"
"When the Snow Tower lies sundered, kingless, bleeding"
"The World-Eater wakes, and the Wheel turns upon the Last Dragonborn."
"When misrule takes its place at the eight corners of the world"
Look, here is Alduin! This panel goes back to the beginning of time, when Alduin and the Dragon Cult ruled over Skyrim.
Patience, my dear. The Akaviri were not a straightforward people. Everything is couched in allegory and mythic symbolism.
So, does it show how they defeated him? Isn't that why we're here?
Orgnar, hold down the bar for a minute, will you?
This way.
You see, right here. Sky Haven Temple, constructed around one of the main Akaviri military camps in the Reach, during their conquest of Skyrim.
This changes everything, of course. There's no time to lose. We must locate...  let me show you. I know I had it here, somewhere...
Shh!
Esbern. What are you getting at?
Delphine! I... it's good to see you. It's been... a long time.
Oh yes! Dragonborn! Indeed, yes.
A hedge against the forgetfulness of centuries.
This is where they built Alduin's Wall, to set down in stone all their accumulated dragonlore.
Esbern, what...
Well, then. You made it, safe and sound. Good. Come on, I have a place we can talk.
Let's pretend we haven't. What's Alduin's Wall and what does it have to do with stopping the dragons?
Either of you?
Yeah, sure.
Now then. I assume you know about...
Alduin's Wall was where the ancient Blades recorded all they knew of Alduin and his return. Part history, part prophecy.
Its location has been lost for centuries, but I've found it again. Not lost, you see, just forgotten.
The Blades archives held so many secrets... I was only able to save a few scraps...
Do you know what he's talking about?
Give me... just a moment...
A wise and foresighted policy, in the event.
Despite the far-reaching fame of Alduin's Wall at the time - one of the wonders of the ancient world - its location was lost.
Ah! Here it is. Come, let me show you.
It's good to see you, too, Esbern. It's been too long, old friend. Too long.
You mean... you don't mean to say you haven't heard of Alduin's Wall?
We're here for Alduin's Wall, right, Esbern?
Yes, of course. We'll have more time to look around later, I suppose. Let's see what's up ahead.
Fascinating! Original Akaviri bas-reliefs... almost entirely intact!
Amazing... you can see how the Akaviri craftsmen were beginning to embrace the more flowing Nordic style...
Yes... yes, that's an excellent idea. Who knows what other lost treasures we might discover?
Well, I'm going to look around some more. See what the old Blades left for us.
I know the prophecy by heart. Once all Blades knew it.
Now they kneel, their ancient mission fulfilled, as the Last Dragonborn contends with Alduin at the end of time.
Here are the Akaviri - the Blades - you see their distinctive longswords.
Hmm, Esbern's right. Look like pressure plates.
And of course the symbol for "Dragonborn." That's the one that appears to have a sort of arrow shape pointing downward at the bottom.
We should be careful here. See these symbols on the floor?
Let's see... you have the symbol for "King"... and "Warrior"...
Why are you stopping?
Yes. These are Akaviri symbols.
Esbern, look out!
Wait.
These pillars must have something to do with it.
Yes, yes! I think we must be close to the entrance.
We've got to get this bridge down.
Looks safe now. Let's move.
Whatever you did, it worked. Let's see what else those old Blades left in our way.
Yes. Definitely early Akaviri stonework here.
Given that Sky Haven Temple was sealed against the return of the Dragonborn, I would try turning all the pillars to that symbol.
This looks promising.
I would suggest staying on the plates with the Dragonborn symbol. Be careful. There should be a way to turn this off. We'll cross once it's safe.
Yes, that's it. The symbol on the pillar on the left. Yes, that's it. The symbol on the middle pillar. Yes, that's it. The symbol on the pillar on the right.
Orgnar, this is it. The inn is yours. I'm probably never coming back here.
You mean they used a Shout to defeat Alduin? You're sure?
Remember, this is where they recorded all they knew of Alduin and his return.
Sky Haven Temple it is, then. I knew you'd have something for us, Esbern.
Yeah... sure. You, too, Delphine. You be safe.
Well, yes, but... there's no guarantee, of course.
Take care of yourself, Orgnar. Goodbye.
So you think that Alduin's Wall will tell us how to defeat Alduin?
Well, now. That's something to think about.
Hmm? Oh, yes. Presumably something rather specific to dragons, or even Alduin himself.
Ah! Here it is.
The path to Paarthurnax lies through this gate. I will show you how to open the way.
Keep moving, stay focused on your goal, and you will reach the summit.
Aaah... yes! Sossedov los mul. The dragonblood runs strong in you. It is long since I had the pleasure of speech with one of my own kind.
By long tradition, the elder speaks first.

Now, show me what you can do. Greet me not as mortal, but as dovah! Come, Dovahkiin. Nin Yol. Strike me with the fire of your Thu'um. Why do you delay? Are you Dovahkiin or not? Do not be afraid. Faasnu. Let me feel the power of your Thu'um. Now, show me what you can do. Greet me not as elf, but as dovah! Now, show me what you can do. Greet me not as orc, but as dovah! Now, show me what you can do. Greet me not as khajiit, but as dovah! Now, show me what you can do. Greet me not as Argonian, but as dovah!
Lok...
I will grant you my understanding of Clear Skies. This is your final gift from us, Dragonborn. Use it well.
Koor...
Dragonborn... wait.
Vah...
Arngeir. Rok los Dovahkiin, Strundu'ul. Rok fen tinvaak Paarthurnax. Arngeir. Rek los Dovahkiin, Strundu'ul. Rek fen tinvaak Paarthurnax.
The path to Paarthurnax is perilous, not to be embarked upon lightly.
Clear Skies will blow away the mist, but only for a time.
Hear my Thu'um! Feel it in your bones. Match it, if you are Dovahkiin!
A gift, Dovahkiin. Yol. Understand Fire as the dov do. A gift, Dovahkiin. Toor. Understand Inferno as the dov do. A gift, Dovahkiin. Shul. Understand Sun as the dov do.
The Word calls you. Go to it. Why do you intrude here, if not for tinvaak? I have spoken. The Rotmulaag waits.
Let those that watch from Sovngarde envy us this day!
Skyrim will be free!
Hold, Alduin on the Wing! Sister Hawk, grant us your sacred breath to make this contract heard!
It worked... you did it...
He will come. He cannot ignore our defiance. And why should he fear us, even now?
We shall see soon enough. Alduin approaches!
We've bloodied him well. Four of his kin have fallen to my blade alone this day.
So be it.
But none have yet stood against Alduin himself. Galthor, Sorri, Birkir...
No. We will deal with Alduin ourselves, here and now.
You do not understand. Alduin cannot be slain like a lesser dragon. He is beyond our strength.
It's no use! Use the Scroll, Felldir! Now!
Yes, the World-Eater is gone... may the spirits have mercy on our souls.
They did not have Dragonrend. Once we bring him down, I promise I will have his head.
Felldir! We agreed not to use it!
I never agreed. And if you are right, I will not need it.
Why does Alduin hang back? We've staked everything on this plan of yours, old man.
Suleyki mulaag, Paarthurnax. My power has waxed, while yours has waned.
Dovahkiin! Use Dragonrend, if you know it!
Lost funt. You are too late, Alduin!
You may have picked up the weapons of my ancient foes, but you are not their equal!
Unslaad hokoron! Never again!
Die now and await your fate in Sovngarde!
Bahloki nahkip sillesejoor. My belly is full of the souls of your fellow mortals, Dovahkiin.
Meyz mul, Dovahkiin. You have become strong.
But I am Al-du-in, Firstborn of Akatosh! Mulaagi zok lot! I cannot be slain here, by you or anyone else!
Have you no thought beyond the blooding of your blade?
What else is there?
You worry too much, brother. Victory will be ours.
Hakon! A glorious day, is it not!
The battle below goes ill. If Alduin does not rise to our challenge, I fear all may be lost.
For Skyrim!
Daar sul thur se Alduin vokrii. Today Alduin's lordship will be restored.
But I honor your courage. Krif voth ahkrin. Die now, in vain.
Nivahriin joorre! What have you done? What twisted Words have you created?! Tahrodiis Paarthurnax! My teeth to his neck!
To feed my power when I come for you in Sovngarde!

Use Dragonrend! It is the only chance to defeat him! He is too strong on the wing! Bring him to gol with Dragonrend! Use Dragonrend, Dovahkiin! Dovahkiin, vosaraan! Use Dragonrend before Alduin consumes you!
Ruth wah nivahriin joor!
Aav uv dir. Join me or perish with your mortal friends.
Now, Dovahkiin! Now he is vulnerable! This is your chance, Dovahkiin! Strike with all your force! Hurt him while he is grounded!
You cannot prevail against me. I will outlast you... mortal!
Faal Kel...?! Nikriinne...
Meyye! Tahrodiis aanne! Him hinde pah liiv! Zu'u hin daan!
You are banished!
No, damn you!
Which is why I brought the Elder Scroll.
You feel fear for the first time, worm. I see it in your eyes.
You are banished! Alduin, we shout you out from all our endings unto the last!
Begone, World-Eater! By words with older bones than your own we break your perch on this age and send you out!
If I die today, it will not be in terror.
Gormlaith! We're running out of time! The battle...
You will die in terror, knowing your final fate...
But first... dir ko maar.
Hyah!
Know that Gormlaith sent you down to death!
That's it! Now, wait until he's well inside!
Hear that?
You better know what you're doing!
Steady! Steady, now! Keep under cover until it's down!
Now! Quickly!
Shor's bones, here he comes!
Horvutah med kodaav. Caught like a bear in a trap...
Got him!
I think it's holding!
Ah. I forget. You do not have the dovah speech.
Zok frini grind ko grah drun viiki, Dovahkiin.
My... eagerness to meet you in battle was my... undoing, Dovahkiin. I salute your, hmm, low cunning in devising such a grahmindol - strategem.
Nid! No!
We're ready when you are. You do have a plan for luring a dragon here, yeah? Go ahead and call this dragon of yours. We're ready. What are you waiting for? Let's get this over with.
Take cover!
Get back! Get back! We need to trap it, not kill it!
Do vah kiin!
You see what talking to them gets us? Shor's bones, where will these demands end? Damn Imperial arrogance!
Legate. We represent the Emperor here.
Enough!
What would the Empire want in return?
Ulfric, you can't seriously expect us to give up Markarth at the negotiating table.
You're lucky I respect the Greybeards' council, Galmar!
Wait. General, you don't intend to just hand over Markarth to that... traitor!
You know exactly... no. Not this time.
Ha! Skyrim will never bow to the Thalmor!
She's supposed to be on our side?
You lost the trust of the people of Skyrim, Elisif. You had your chance to make the right choice when the war started.
You hope to gain in council what you've been unable to take in battle, is that it?
No. We'll stay. Out of respect for the Dragonborn and our Greybeard hosts.
But she is to observe, nothing more. We are not negotiating with her, is that clear?
Yes, that'd be entirely out of character.
Very well, Ulfric. Enjoy your petty victory.
I'm sure Jarl Ulfric does not expect something for nothing.
We walk, then.
We've taken it before. I'm only asking for what will be ours soon enough anyway.
Yes, let's get down to it.
Unlike your Imperial friends here.
Sorry, sir. It won't happen again.
You are a traitor to the Empire, and deserve a traitor's death.
First, let's be clear. This council wasn't my idea. I think it's a waste of time.
Ulfric, why so hostile? After all, it's not the Thalmor that's burning your farms and killing your sons.
He is with me.
I don't know about the end of the world, but this dragon situation has gotten out of hand.
If this truce will help the Dragonborn here put an end to that menace, we both gain. Remember that, Ulfric.
If he's right about Alduin... we both have just as much to lose here, Tullius, remember that.
He grows more powerful with every soldier slain in your pointless war!
Stop! Are you so blind to our danger that you can't see past your petty disagreements?
Alduin has returned! The World-Eater! Even now, he devours the souls of your fallen comrades!
A very pretty speech, but what does it have to do with...
You don't really expect compensation every time a farm gets burned in a war that you started, do you Ulfric?
That's enough out of you.
Shut up.
And I advise you both to listen to what he has to say, before you do anything rash.
Is he with you, Delphine? If so, I advise you to tell him to watch his tongue.
Don't you understand the danger? Don't you understand what the return of the dragons means?
You always were a fool, Ulfric. You'll never get a better chance to salvage something from the ruins of your ambition.
That's a lie! My legionnaires are disciplined, unlike your...
You slaughtered them - the women, the children! You butchers!
Can you not put aside your hatred for even one moment in the face of this mortal danger?
Here you sit arguing about... nothing! While the fate of the land hangs in the balance!

Markarth is off the table. Your rabble is on the verge of defeat. We have no need of a truce at such a price. We've made you a fair offer. Are you serious about these talks, or are you just here to posture?
General Tullius...
So that's why you're here, Ulfric? You dare to insult the Greybeards by using this council to advance your own position?
You both agree to this?
I'm willing to let the Dragonborn be the judge of the fairness of my request. It seems I have no choice but to let the Dragonborn decide. Although I'm starting to doubt your fairness.

Markarth remains allied to the Empire, under the authority of Jarl Igmund. Riften remains allied to the Stormcloak cause, under the authority of Jarl Laila Law-Giver. Markarth will be handed over to Ulfric's forces. Jarl Igmund will step down, and Thongvor Silver-Blood will become the Jarl of Markarth. Riften will be handed over to Imperial control. Jarl Laila Law-Giver will step down, and Maven Black-Briar will become the Jarl of Riften.
Do you hear that, Tullius? The blood of the innocent cries out for weregild. And so the Empire runs roughshod over Skyrim, as usual.
These are the terms currently on the table.
Elisif! I said I'd handle it.
Jarl Elisif, I'll handle this.

The Stormcloaks will withdraw from the Reach, allowing Jarl Igmund to return to Markarth. The Stormcloaks will withdraw from the Rift, allowing Imperial troops unhindered access. The Empire will withdraw its troops from the Reach, allowing Ulfric's forces unhindered access to Markarth. The Empire will withdraw its troops from the Rift, allowing the return of Jarl Laila Law-Giver.
Jarl Laila Law-Giver will step down, and Maven Black-Briar will become the Jarl of Riften. Jarl Igmund will go into exile, with Thongvor Silver-Blood taking his place as Jarl of Markarth.

Ulfric will withdraw his forces from Hjaalmarch, allowing Jarl Idgrod Ravencrone to return to Morthal. Ulfric will withdraw his forces from Falkreath, allowing Jarl Siddgeir to return. Ulfric will allow Imperial forces into the Pale. Skald the Elder will go into exile, and Brina Merilis will assume the Jarlship. Ulfric will allow Imperial troops to enter Winterhold. Korir will replace Kraldar as Jarl. The Empire will allow Ulfric's forces to enter Hjaalmarch. Idgrod Ravencrone will go into exile, with Sorli the Builder replacing her as Jarl. The Empire will allow Ulfric's forces to enter Falkreath. Jarl Siddgeir will step down, and Dengeir of Stuhn will take his place as Jarl. The Empire will withdraw its troops from the Pale, allowing Jarl Skald the Elder to return from exile. The Empire will withdraw its troops from Winterhold, allowing Jarl Korir to return from exile.
I'm listening. Let's hear it. I'm sure you have something in mind.
But once Alduin is defeated - then it will be the Empire's turn. Remember - "Evgir Unslaad."

I shouldn't agree to terms that so blatantly favor the Empire. I have no choice, though, under the circumstances. The sons of Skyrim will live up to their agreements. As long as the Imperials hold to theirs.
Jarl Ulfric...
General, this is outrageous! You can't be taking this demand seriously! I thought we were here to discuss a truce!
But the Empire will accept them, until the dragon menace is dealt with.
These terms blatantly favor the rebels. Everyone here knows that. The Empire can live with these terms, yes. For a temporary truce, until the dragon menace is dealt with.
What makes you think I'll give that to you, if I wouldn't give you Markarth? Where do these demands stop, Ulfric? Do you expect me to surrender all of Skyrim?

We want compensation for the massacre at Shor's Stone. You surrender Hjaalmarch to us, and take Idgrod Ravencrone with you. Sorli the Builder will take over as Jarl of Morthal. You surrender Falkreath to us. Siddgeir steps down, and Dengeir of Stuhn resumes the Jarlship. You withdraw from the Pale, and allow Jarl Skald the Elder to return to Dawnstar. We want Imperial forces to withdraw from Winterhold, and allow Jarl Kraldar to return from exile. Bah! This is a waste of time. I can see that we won't get better terms from this council. We want compensation for the massacre at Barleydark Farm. We want compensation for the massacre at Riverwood. We want compensation for the massacre at Rorikstead. We want compensation for the massacre at Karthwasten. We want compensation for the massacre at Old Hroldan. We want compensation for the massacre at Kolskeggr Mine. We want compensation for the massacre at Stonehills. We want compensation for the massacre at Frost River Farm. We want compensation for the massacre at Granite Hill. We want compensation for the massacre at Half-moon Mill. We want compensation for the massacre at Heljarchen. We want compensation for the massacre at Anga's Mill. We want compensation for the massacre at Loreius Farm. We want compensation for the massacre at Whistling Mine. We want compensation for the massacre at Ivarstead. We want compensation for the massacre at Heartwood Mill. We want compensation for the massacre at Sarethi Farm.
So be it. The sons of Skyrim at least put the greater good above our own interests.

Hjaalmarch will be turned over to Ulfric, with Sorli the Builder assuming the Jarlship. Falkreath will be turned over to Ulfric, and Dengeir of Stuhn will return as Jarl. Imperial forces will withdraw from The Pale, and Jarl Skald the Elder will be allowed to return to Dawnstar. Imperial troops will withdraw from Winterhold, and Kraldar will return as Jarl.

The Stormcloaks will withdraw from Hjaalmarch, and Idgrod Ravencrone will resume the Jarlship. Falkreath will be returned to Imperial control, under the authority of Jarl Siddgeir. The Pale will be turned over to the Empire. Brina Merilis will assume the Jarlship in Dawnstar. Winterhold will be turned over to the Empire, although the College itself will retain its traditional neutrality.
But I at least will negotiate in good faith.

If we're not going to get Markarth, we need you to give us something. You know as well as I do that that we can't hand over Riften on these terms. These terms are not acceptable. You know that. Don't hand me a mug of sheep's piss and call it mead. These terms are still not acceptable. Come on, Tullius. You have to give a little ground here. The dragons are a threat to us both.
Now, back to the matter at hand. I suppose that's the fairest deal we're likely to get.
Pay no attention to him. A ponderous windbag, like most Imperial generals.
The Dragonborn has spoken, Tullius. Markarth will be ours.
Legate, with me. We have a lot of work to do.
Now we'll see if there's anything behind your talk of good faith.
I know you, Ulfric. If I hand over Markarth, you'll be ready with a new demand.
You're losing this war, and you know it. You'll never defeat the Empire, and you know it. But you're willing to sacrifice thousands for your own selfish ambition.
By Talos, that's an excellent question. I hope you haven't forgotten that little detail?
Jarl Vignar, I assume you are familiar with the Dragonborn's plan?
I'm sorry. Good luck.
This is quite an achievement, Dragonborn. And Jarl Ulfric. Markarth is ours! Giving up Riften is a heavy price to pay for this truce, Dragonborn. I hope it was worth it.
I admit, I really didn't expect these talks to succeed. Getting the Empire to agree to anything at all is quite an achievement.
Yes, I'm ready to do my part.
Just say the word, and my men will help you spring this trap.
You were not invited here. You are not welcome here.
One moment.
Fine. Let's get this over with.
We're here to arrange a temporary truce to allow the Dragonborn here to deal with the dragons. Nothing more.
I just want to make clear that the only reason I agreed to attend this council was to deal with the dragon menace.
We have as much right to be at this council as all of you. More, actually, since we were the ones that put the Dragonborn on this path.
Here we go.

We have no need to negotiate when the rebels are so clearly losing the war. I have no authority to negotiate a permanent settlement, unless Ulfric is ready to sue for peace and turn himself over to Imperial justice.
So. Arngeir, is it? You know why we're here. Are you going to let us in or not?
Delphine, we're not here to rehearse old grudges.
Very well. You may enter.
Don't play dumb, Tullius! Damn right we do. Tell him, Ulfric.
Enough posturing, Tullius. If you came to talk, let's get on with it.

She did what had to be done. It was long overdue. My only regret is that I wasn't able to kill him myself. He did what had to be done. It was long overdue. My only regret is that I wasn't able to kill him myself. For now. The Blades' memory is long, as you know. If it were up to you, the Dragonborn would sit dreaming on this mountain doing nothing!
We know a great deal about the situation and the threat that Alduin poses to us all. You need us here if you want this council to succeed.
The matter at hand is urgent. Alduin must be stopped. You wouldn't have called this council if you didn't agree.

I know what path you set her on. And now Paarthurnax's wisdom is lost to us, just when we need it most. I know what path you set him on. And now Paarthurnax's wisdom is lost to us, just when we need it most. We know what path you've set her on. But she has made a different choice. Paarthurnax is still safe from your malice. We know what path you've set him on. But he has made a different choice. Paarthurnax is still safe from your malice. Were you? The hubris of the Blades truly knows no bounds.
Enough, Galmar.
We want control of Markarth. That's our price for agreeing to a truce.
Besides, Jarl Laila will never agree to...
Galmar. We will do whatever I decide is in the best interests of Skyrim. Are we clear? Vignar. We will do whatever I decide is in the best interests of Skyrim. Are we clear?
Yes, my lord.
You should be glad enough of a chance to lick your wounds at this point in the war. We consider even sitting down to talk with these rebels more than generous.
You haven't been able to take it back yet. Why should we give it up now?
I'm sure General Tullius does not expect something for nothing.
Our terms are simple.
Jarl Ulfric, what would you want in return?
You heard the man, Tullius. You heard what she said, Tullius.
Of course not! What will you offer for Riften, Tullius? Some empty promises? Maybe some more Imperial bluster?
Aye! We haven't forgotten Markarth, Tullius!
Riften must be returned to Imperial control. That's our price for agreeing to a truce.
But I accepted the Dragonborn's invitation to this council, and I at least will negotiate in good faith.
Ulfric, you can't be taking this demand seriously? We can hold Riften against anything the Empire can throw at it.

Riften is off the table. The Empire barely has a toehold left in Skyrim. We don't need to pay such a high price for this truce. We've made you a fair offer. If you're really serious about this truce, you need to reconsider.
First, let me be clear. The sons of Skyrim know from bitter experience that talking to the Empire is a waste of time, or worse.
Imperial promises are simply a way to lull you while they prepare a dagger for your back.
Do you really think Ulfric will just turn Riften over because some Imperial general barked an order?
Elisif, are you really going to be a party to this foolishness?
That's quite an opening demand, Tullius.
Come on, Tullius, you can't seriously expect us to just hand over Riften at the negotiating table.
This is our homeland, Tullius. All the blood spilled in this war is on your head.
Don't listen to him. Ulfric's been telling lies about himself for so long, he's actually starting to believe them.
If you think that winning a few battles means you're winning the war, you're even worse at strategy than diplomacy.
Jarl Baalgruf, I assume you are familiar with the Dragonborn's plan?

This is quite an achievement, Dragonborn. And General Tullius. Riften is ours! I admit, I really didn't expect you'd be able to arrange a truce. Getting Ulfric to agree to anything at all is quite an achievement. Giving up Markarth is a heavy price for this truce, Dragonborn. I hope it was worth it.
I know how this works, Tullius. I've learned the value of Imperial promises the hard way. Never again.
I know you, Ulfric. You have no intention of coming to terms.
You're losing this war and you know it.
Well that's an excellent question. You haven't overlooked that little detail, have you?
I'm willing to let the Dragonborn decide the fairness of my request. I guess I have no choice but to let the Dragonborn decide. Although I'm starting to doubt your fairness.
You slaughtered the very people you claim to be fighting for! True sons of Skyrim would never do such things.
You're here to blacken the Empire's name, and I won't be party to it.
Come on Galmar. We have a lot of work to do.

If we're not going to get Riften, we need you to give us something. You know as well as I do that that we can't hand over Markarth on these terms. You know I can't agree to these terms. The Emperor would repudiate this treaty and I would be recalled. Don't hand me a mug of sheep's piss and call it Colovian brandy. These terms are still not acceptable. Come on, Ulfric. You have to give a little ground here. The dragons are a threat to us both.
Damned Imperial lies! My men would never stoop to such methods, even in retaliation for your butchery at...
Why would I give you that, if I wouldn't give you Riften? What next, Tullius? Shall I just hand over all of Skyrim?
For what it's worth, I'm sorry to see you go. You fought well for us.
We get Riften back. Now we'll see if there's anything behind your fine words.
Once the Emperor is convinced of the need, then you will see the full strength of the Imperial Legion.
You may think this war is nearly won. You're wrong. I've been fighting you with a mere handful of troops. If you think you can hold Riften, you're as deluded as you've always been.
Out with it, then.

We want Hjaalmarch back, and Idgrod Ravencrone restored as Jarl. You withdraw from Falkreath, and allow Siddgeir to resume his rightful place as Jarl. We want the Pale returned to Imperial control. The traitor Skald the Elder will be replaced with a more loyal candidate. We want Kraldar removed as Jarl of Winterhold, and an Imperial candidate put in his place. Never mind. I can see that these are the best terms we'll get from this council.
So be it. The Empire at least puts the greater good above our own interests.
Yes, let's get this over with.
The only reason I agreed to attend this council was to deal with the dragon menace.
Master Arngeir, are you going to just let him continue to...
I consider even talking to the Empire a generous gesture.

We have no interest in negotiating with the Empire. It's only a matter of time before they are driven out of Skyrim. There's nothing else to talk about, unless the Empire is finally ready to renounce its unjust claim to rule over the free people of Skyrim.
I have something to say first.
Are you done? Did you just come here to make speeches? Or can we get down to business?
I knew he wouldn't be able to resist.
For once you'll actually pay for your crimes. Once again, the Empire takes the blame for the crimes of others.
Please. If we have to negotiate the terms of the negotiation, we will never get anywhere.
This is how the Empire repays us for our loyalty?
Now that everyone is here, please take your seats so we can begin.
She's part of the Imperial delegation. You can't dictate who I bring to this council.
I have every right to be at this negotiation. I need to ensure that nothing is agreed to here that violates the terms of the White-Gold Concordat.
Diplomatic as usual.
Yes!
Hear, hear!
That didn't take long.
Peace, Galmar.
Your chief Talos-hunter?
You are weak. Sooner you realize it, the sooner we can see the back of you.
No. You insult us by bringing her to this negotiation?
Perhaps this would be a good time to get the Dragonborn's input on this matter.
By Talos, the stones on this one! You're in no position to dictate terms to us, Tullius!
I hope that we have all come here in the spirit of...
After that, Ulfric... there will be a reckoning. Count on it.
The Thalmor will treat with whatever government rules Skyrim. We would not think of interfering in your civil war.
Thank you, Jarl Elisif. I appreciate your loyalty.
General, you've proven yourself a good friend to Skyrim. I continue to trust that you will do your utmost to safeguard our interests.
I have nothing to say to that murderer.
But beware - the Empire's loyalty is fickle. They will tire of this war, and then I will be the one dictating terms to you.

You should be pleased, Elisif. You've done well for yourself as the Empire's pet Jarl. What about you, Elisif? Are these terms to your liking? Speak up. I'm sure General Tullius is waiting to do your bidding.
It seems we may have an agreement.

This seems like a really bad idea to me.
I admit, I doubted you, but no more. You've made a dragon submit to your will. A feat to rival the legendary Olaf One-Eye! What glory!
I'll be glad when this beast is gone from here. Do whatever it is you need to do with it, Dragonborn.
Faas nu, zini dein ruthi ahst vaal.
Farengar, very bad idea. Even for you.
By all the gods...
Farengar! Enough, fool!
May Kynareth guard you while you pass through her realm!
Joor mey! What are you doing back there?
Carry on, soldier. This is all part of the Dragonborn's plan.
Surely you wouldn't miss a few scales... or a small amount of blood...
I assure you, you will not even notice me. Most of them are hardly painful at all to a large dragon such as yourself.
I would be most appreciative if you would permit me to perform some, ah, tests on you. Purely in the interests of the advancement of knowledge.
Incredible! Uh... sir, you have no idea how long I have waited for such an opportunity!
