Begone, mage. Do not test my promise to the Dovahkiin.
You're either the bravest person I've ever met, or the biggest fool.
Get ready to open the trap!
You fought well. I find you worthy.
It is long since one of the living has entered here. May Shor's favor follow you and your errand.
At long last! Alduin's doom is now ours to seal - just speak the word and with high hearts we'll hasten forth to smite the worm wherever he lurks.
Hold, comrades - let us counsel take before battle is blindly joined.
We must drive away his mist, Shouting together, and then unsheathe our blades in desperate battle with our black-winged foe.
Felldir speaks wisdom - the World-Eater, coward, fears you, Dragonborn.
But with four Voices joined, our valor combined, we can blast the mist and bring him to battle.
Alduin's mist is more than a snare - its shadowy gloom is his shield and cloak.
Clear Skies - combine our Shouts!
We cannot fight the foe in this mist!
Stand fast! His strength is failing! Once more, and his might will be broken!
Again, together! Alduin is strong! Again, as one! The World-Eater fears us! We can shatter his power if we Shout together!
One more time, and the World-Eater must face us! His power crumbles - do not pause for breath! Again, and we break his grim hold over Shor's realm, and redeem it for eternity!
Again!
Does his strength have no end? Is our struggle in vain?

We must clear this confounding mist. Alduin will hide in this lightless mist until we Shout together, and shatter his power. We must Shout together these shadows to dispel. We're ready, Dragonborn, our wrath to unleash.
Now ends this tale, my eternity be damned!
Through fire and time, the terror has lived. No more, I say! I've set my heart on terrible deeds, death's grim art.
To battle, my friends! The fields will echo with the clamor of war, our wills undaunted.
If it is our lot to end, we'll live in song if not in soul.
At Sovngarde's gates I'll meet my fate with mirthful heart, and know I fell in noblest cause.
Zu'u unslaad! Zu'u nis oblaan!

As for myself, you've proven your mastery twice over. Thuri, Dovahkiin. I gladly acknowledge the power of your Thu'um. And so Alduin's lordship passes to you. Thuri, Dovahkiin. I gladly submit to your mastery of the Thu'um.
Zu'u Odahviing. Call me when you have need, and I will come if I can.
Alduin mahlaan
Dovahkiin los ok dovahkriid
Mu los vomir
Thu'umii los nahlot
Goraan! I feel younger than I have in many an age.
Many of the dovahhe are now scattered across Keizaal. Without Alduin's lordship, they may yet bow to the vahzen... rightness of my Thu'um.
But willing or no, they will hear it! Fare thee well, Dovahkiin!
Sahrot thur qahnaraan
I hope you will return to us soon with the news that justice has finally been done.
But just as Paarthurnax's later deeds do not expiate his crimes, your deeds do not allow us to ignore our duty.
With both Alduin and Paarthurnax dead, a dark chapter in history will finally be closed.
I'm afraid she's right. I'm deeply sorry that this has to come between us.
But our oath as Blades binds us. Paarthurnax must die. There's no excuse now that Alduin is dead.
There's still the matter of Paarthurnax. I'm not ungrateful for what you've done. Esbern speaks for both of us.
Thank you. Thank you, Dragonborn. You've done a great service for us all.
I knew you could do it... I believed in you, and yet... I still didn't think I'd live to see this day.
You've done it... just as the prophecy said...
Let the Way of the Voice be your guide, and the path of wisdom will be clear to you. Breath and focus, Dragonborn. Your future lies before you.
You've shown yourself mighty, both in Voice and deed. In order to defeat Alduin, you've gained mastery of dreadful weapons.
Will you be a hero whose name is remembered in song throughout the ages?
Now it is up to you to decide what to do with your power and skill.
Or will you merely fade from history, unremembered?
Or will your name be a curse to future generations?
Alok, Vuljotnaak. Tiid boaan. Alok, Nahagliiv. Tiid boaan. Alok, Viinturuth. Tiid boaan.
Alduin, thuri!
Vuljotnaak! Ziil gro dovah ulse! Nahagliiv! Ziil gro dovah ulse! Viinturuth! Ziil gro dovah ulse!
Ease your heart, our honor is unstained - it's by Shor's command we curb our onslaught. Let us not spurn our lord's bounty - this hall is his gift, for glory well-earned.
It is by Shor's command that we curb our wrath - so let's feast and sing 'til our fate calls us.
I long to fight that foul worm. Shall Alduin remain so long unchallenged?
Hail, comrade! Shall we by clash of steel ease the gloom of the encompassing mist? My blade is restless, unblooded too long.
With mead and fellowship let's mend our wounds.
Shor's favor found me today. Let's lift a mug of mead together, our wounds to salve and weariness cure.
By a bold stroke, you bested me, friend.
Well fought, friend. Your fury is unmatched.
Aye. Let us forget our sorrow in the fury of battle. Meat and mead must ever make way for the clash of steel - the song of battle.
A cup I'll gladly raise in company with you. None have yet bested me in boasting or drinking.
Come, let us share a cup of mead, and trade tales of our time on Mundus, reliving the glory of our remembered deeds.
I crave a tale of tall ships and fearless heroes, for heart's ease.
Listen well, friend, and lighten your mood while words I'll spin of warriors bold, whose deeds of valor brought undying fame.
Hmph. Yes, Nepos.
For the Forsworn!
You heard him. Go on in.
What? By the gods, Betrid....
Wait. It's okay, my dear. Send him in. Wait. It's okay, my dear. Send her in.
The Reach belongs to the Forsworn!
By the Divines, the Forsworn are here in the city!
Oh, this pendant would look lovely on my sister.
Everyone stay back. The Markarth city guard have this all under control. There are no Forsworn here.
A bit of jewelry for your journey home?
What's going on, Madanach? You wouldn't have old Grisvar killed unless you weren't planning on needing him.
The Reach belongs to the Forsworn!
My brothers, we have been here long enough. It's time to leave Cidhna Mine and continue our fight against the Nords.
Through this gate, just beside my quarters, is a tunnel. A tunnel that leads right through the old Dwarven ruins of Markarth, into the city.
Well, what do you say, my brothers?
Let me out. They're going to kill me!
Madanach. I've brought what you asked for.
Good work. Get ready while I have a word with our favorite outsider.
Madanach! Think you can escape my prison do you? You'll pay for what you've done to my family!
Your family? You've poisoned the Reach with your tainted silver for long enough, Thonar!
Indeed. Avanchnzel is as much a library as it is a city. Built to hold the vast memories of the Dwemer.
This place is huge.
Why are all these metal... things... ignoring us?
Drennen!
Enough. Their services will be more than adequate. Let us continue.
So we grab it and we get out, right?
I assure you, it is. The knowledge contained in the Lexicon created everything you see around you.
You said they were sleeping. I said they were waiting. It seems a few of them were "waiting" for someone to try and take the Lexicon.
Something doesn't feel right.
The Lexicon had better be worth all this trouble.
We're almost there. I can hear the Lexicon. Come on. Quickly!
I can't hold these things! We need to leave!
And yet none of us can pick a damned lock.
I thought you said these things were "sleeping"?
Ours. Soon the Lexicon's knowledge will be ours.
The way out is right there! Run, damn it!
This place is unbelievable.
Anavchnzel is waiting.
We are close now. Can you hear the Lexicon calling out?
So?
Drennen, you do understand that the Lexicon at the bottom of this place holds the accumulated memories of centuries of Dwemer.
Absolutely.
It is large, indeed. I did not anticipate Avanchnzel's size or the time needed to uncover the entrance.
We are thieves, you fool. We're stealing the cube.
I told you we should have hired a thief.
I have the Lexicon! Where's the podium?
I did not come all the way here just to walk out empty-handed.
Calm yourself, Breya. We are closing in on the Lexicon. I can feel it calling. We'll continue without Drennen.
So we're not turning back, you fool.
Aaaaaaaaaaa....
I don't like this place. It feels like we're being... watched.
It's a simple job, Drennen. We get in, we steal the Lexicon, we leave. Don't get jumpy.
Let the field mouse run. Your pay will be double.
My pay will be nothing if we die in here!
You sure that's power we're meant to have?
Once we have the Lexicon, we'll need to take it to its podium. I know what to do from there. Soon the Lexicon's knowledge will be mine.
Great.
If you two cannot handle this, we can find others to hire.
Maybe we should turn back. I don't want to sleep here.
Not to mention our pay.
Of course.
Sure.
Properly controlled, it has knowledge enough to turn paupers into kings.
Besides, you're not scared of a few sleeping metal men. Are you, Drennen?
I can't do this. We shouldn't be here. I'm sorry.
A few hours sleep and we should be ready to continue through.
Wait!
Best get rid of the ones we see. Just in case.
No one seems to know. Perhaps the return of the Dwemer. Perhaps the end of the world.
Waiting for what?

"Olaf gave orders, Winterhold disguises. An attack on Solitude total destruction to follow." "Olaf sent word to Solitude's Jarl, cajoling and mocking and begging for a fight." "Because Solitude would not soon bend knee, Olaf would hurt them while his status accrued."

"His men dressed up and then went out to fight, but they reversed Olaf's orders much to Winterhold's sorrow." "From Winterhold Olaf had sent every message, upon attack he was nowhere in sight." "He sacked Winterhold his only true ally, and used magic bold to blame Solitude." "He sacked Winterhold in dragon form, and bent their minds to blame Solitude."
Thank you yet again. I will make sure our applicant, who was instrumental in... recovering the poem will be well rewarded.
I thank you and the college thanks you, Jarl.
"No shouting match between dragon and man, no fire or fury did this battle entail." "No shouting match between dragon and man, no fire or fury did this battle entail."

"Olaf captured a fast-sleeping dragon, a mighty feat which the meek would not fail." "Olaf struck a deal to make himself king, Numinex let go though none tell that tale." "Olaf was Numinex in human form, on moonless nights he would spread wings and sail."
You have proven your point, Viarmo.  The festival is truly a celebration of Solitude and a condemnation of false kings.
"So ends the story of Olaf the liar, a thief and a scoundrel we of Solitude commit to the fire."
"In Solitude bards train for their service, they also gather each year and burn a King who deserves it."

Furthermore, I believe that such a fine poem deserves some payment of Patronage. The college will be moderately rewarded. Furthermore, I believe that such a fine poem deserves some payment of Patronage. The college will be generously rewarded. Furthermore, I believe that such a fine poem deserves some payment of Patronage. The college will be very generously rewarded.
Ah, Viarmo.  I assume you are here to petition for the reinstatement of the Burning of King Olaf Festival.
I am, Jarl. I wish to present King Olaf's verse from the Poetic Edda. Recovered this very day from the Bards Tomb.
Ah, you mentioned something that would convince us the festival should take place but I didn't expect King Olaf's lost verse. Please proceed.
Make sure that he is. Make sure that she is.
Welcome, people of Solitude! We of the Bards College are pleased to be here to celebrate the Burning of King Olaf.

The festival would not have been possible without the dedication and hard work of our latest applicant. The festival would not have been possible without the dedication and hard work of our most recent inductee.
With the lighting of the effigy...
He becomes a full-fledged member of the Bards College. Please welcome our newest Bard! We remember all those Solitude soldiers out fighting the good fight in this thankless war.
Olaf! It is time!
Olaf!
Arise, Olaf! My vengeance is at hand!
Insolent bard. Die!
I can see to that. We'll need plenty of fresh corpses to rebuild her army, you see.
None can stand against the Wolf Queen!
You've come far, mortal. No doubt you seek to enter Potema's Sanctum.
You'll serve me soon enough.
You've arrived at last. The hero who prevented me from being bound returns to my fold. You've arrived at last. The heroine who prevented me from being bound returns to my fold.
I have much to thank you for, little one. When you die I will raise you and you can take your place by my side.
You've come far, mortal, but can you stand against my inner council?  Let's see!
Don't applaud yourself too soon, worm!
Rip the eyes from her head! Rip the eyes from his head!
Not much further. Come, little thing. Serve me in death.
I swear to you, unnatural magics are coming from that cave! There are strange noises and lights! We need someone to investigate!
Your eminence, my scrying has suggested nothing in the area. Dragon Bridge is under imperial control. This is likely superstitious nonsense.
Then we will immediately send out a legion to scour the cave and secure the town. Haafingar's people will always be safe under my rule.
Yes! Yes! Return me to this realm!
We summon Potema!
What! What are you doing?! You fools! You cannot bind me to your wills!
Summoned with words. Bound by blood.
Long have you slept the dreamless sleep of death, Potema. No longer. Hear us Wolf Queen! We Summon You!
You ants don't have the power to bind me!
As our voices summon you the blood of the innocent binds you Wolf Queen!
Something is wrong. There is an intruder.
Wolf Queen. Hear our call and awaken. We summon Potema!
I shall not be bound.
I will have someone take care of the cave as well Varnius, you can rest easy. You're dismissed.
Thank you, Jarl Elisif. But about the cave...
Oh. Yes, of course you are right. Falk, tell Captain Aldis I said to assign a few extra soldiers to Dragon Bridge.
Perhaps a more... tempered reaction... might be called for?
Th...thank you, my Jarl thank you.
You might want to rethink that. You're missing out on some wonderful opportunities, working in that bar.
I'm not interested, Jaree. It doesn't matter how many times you ask.
Alik'r, hold!
You've proven your strength, warrior. Let's avoid any more bloodshed.
I think you and I have some things to talk about.
We meet at last, my dear lady.
What have you done?
What is this?
Oh, come now. You didn't really expect to manipulate people forever, did you? Your luck had to run out sometime.
I'm not sure I like these Alik'r warriors hiding out here. They seem like trouble.
Keep it to yourself. They're not paying us to talk.
They'll be gone as soon as they've found whoever they're looking for. And we'll have all the more coin.
I mean it! I'll... I'll cut you in half!
So, are you working with them? You think you can take me? You so much as touch me, and you're going to lose fingers.
We're causing no trouble. All we ask is to look for her.
I don't care what you're doing, after what happened you're lucky I don't toss you in jail. Now get lost.
Look, you've already been told you're not allowed here. Turn around and go back the way you came.
We will be back. This is not over.
Curse you!
You just sit tight. I'll get around to it eventually.
Right, right... Oh, look at that. I seem to have lost my keys. Might take me a while to find them.
I said my fine has been paid! Now let me out!
Sorry, my ears aren't so good. You say somethin'?
Guard! My fine's been paid, now set me free!
Brother? Is... Is that you?
What in the world?
Thorald? Thorald!
I'm here! I knew I'd find you!
There's no time. We've got to get you out of here! Come on, let's go!
Unngh...  Uhhh...
Welcome to our home.
How do we know he's not spying for the Battle-Born? This was foolish! How do we know she's not spying for the Battle-Born? This was foolish!
Avulstein, put that down! He's here to help us find Thorald! Avulstein, put that down! She's here to help us find Thorald!
All right, mother.
I can't take any more of this. No weapons, please. Let's just talk.
Mother, what's the meaning of this? Who have you brought into our home?
We can't trust anyone! Who knows what they'll do if they find me here.
Get to the nearest way out!
We've got to find Thorald quickly!
I can't believe you came for me!
You beasts are the worst.
Adelaisa, I'm sorry.
Come now, dearie, surely we aren't all that bad.
Sorry isn't good enough, Orthus. There's a lot of gold at stake here, and sniveling isn't going to get it back.
Just... leave me alone! I've brought your mead, now drink it and shut your filthy mouths.
Oh, we've got other things in mind for our mouths, sweetie.
I've got a top man on the job right now. He should be returning any moment. I've got a sharp woman on the job right now. She should be returning any moment.
This must be him, then. This must be her, then.
No! Someone help me! Please!
Oh my. That...
You... you go first.
You're under the arrest, for the Murder of Susanna of Candlehearth Hall. And Friga Shatter-Shield. And all the rest.
We're wise to your scheming, you coward.
What is the meaning of this?
Yes, sir.
In you go.
You. You're coming with me.
We're finally going to arrest the Butcher.
This isn't over, Jorleif!
I'm sorry, sir. But you'll have to come with me.
Yes, sir!
Get him out of my sight.
Make your excuses from the Bloodworks, wizard.
Has the whole city lost their brains?
I've been scrying and auguring to find the murderer myself.
It doesn't matter. Look, it's refilling with your tonic as we speak.
Master, look. It's the Phial.
Marvelous.
What? How?
I'll be fine.
You see, you're not well! Have a seat and I'll fetch you some tonic.
I'll... I can... just...
Master, you're far too old for this sort of journey. We don't know what's inside...
Bah. If there was a tonic that could help me, I would have found it by now...
Now, if you're going to get those thieves, you should head to Bleak Falls Barrow, northeast of town.
You. Over here!
You can see it from here, though. The mountain just over the buildings.
We have to go through town and across the bridge to get to Bleak Falls Barrow.
Wh- no... I.... Oh, by the Eight, fine. But only to the edge of town!
I wonder why they only stole Lucan's golden claw. I mean, we have plenty of things in the shop that are worth just as much coin.
Lucan found the claw about a year after he opened the store. He never quite explained where he got it. He's a tricky one.
So this is your plan, Lucan?
Oh really? Well I think your new helper here needs a guide.
Those thieves must be mad, hiding out there. Those old crypts are filled with nothing but traps, trolls, and who knows what else!
Yes. So now you don't have to go, do you?
No. Not again. Help!
You fool, why should I share the treasure with anyone?
I know I ran ahead with the claw, but I need help!
Is... is someone coming? Is that you Harknir? Bjorn? Soling?
It's coming loose. I can feel it.
That's it. Keep hacking at it.
Don't stop. Keep cutting.
This is the bridge out of town. The path up the mountain to the northwest leads to Bleak Falls Barrow.
I guess I should get back to my brother. He'll throw a fit if I take too long. Such a child....
Help! Can anyone hear me? I'm stuck down here.
You, you there! Help me, I'm trapped.
Is anyone out there? Anyone?
That dark elf wants to go on ahead, let him. Better than us risking our necks.
So we're just supposed to sit here while Arvel runs off with that golden claw?
Just shut it and keep an eye out for trouble.
What if Arvel doesn't come back? I want my share from that claw!
I said no! No adventures, no theatrics, no thief-chasing!
We are done talking about this.
Well what are you going to do then, huh? Let's hear it!
Well one of us has to do something!
Oh, a customer. Sorry you had to hear that.
You found me! Laelette was trying to find me too, but I'm glad you found me first.
She kissed me on the neck, and I got so cold that the fire didn't even hurt.
She wanted to play with me forever and ever.
Laelette was told to burn mommy and me, but she didn't want to.
Laelette thought she could take me and keep me, but she can't. I'm all burned up.
I'm tired. I'm going to sleep for a while now.
Destroy him!
Yeah. Kind of scary too.
Kill the vampire!
Um...this place looks dangerous.
And it's full of vampires?
Yes!
Kill him!
Yeah!
Cowards! We must kill the vampires. We have to make them pay! Morthal is full of cowards! Let's go kill that monster.
Take us to Movarth's Lair! I'm going to Movarth's Lair to kill that monster. Are you with me?
Take us!
Let's kill him!
Of course. But why not let him go in first? Of course. But why not let her go in first?
Make Laelette go away!
Ysmir's beard! She's...she's a vampire!
Laelette! She's dead!
Now you just stay here, with all your friends, and I'm going to go get my shovel.
Let me just take this coin purse off your hands for you. And those nice boots you've got there.
Well, seems like you have a bit of gold left in your pockets, don't you, my friend?  Mmm, yes...
Do you agree to be bound together, in love, now and forever?
It is from her love of us that we first learned to love one another. It is from this love that we learn that a life lived alone is no life at all.
We gather here today, under Mara's loving gaze, to bear witness to the union of two souls in eternal companionship.
I do. Now and forever.
It was Mara that first gave birth to all of creation and pledged to watch over us as her children.
May they journey forth together in this life and the next, in prosperity and poverty, and in joy and hardship.
Ah, here's the blushing bride now. Let's begin the ceremony. Ah, here's the proud groom now. Let's begin the ceremony.
You smell like a pig's pen, too. What a stink! Have you been rolling in the dirt all day?
I am not! You're lying!
Look at you! You're as filthy as a pig in a pen!
You're a liar! I won't listen to you. Leave me alone!
I'll tell you who I don't envy - those poor children who lost their parents in this war.
It's too fine a day to dwell on such things. Let's get back to work and forget about wars and orphans for awhile.
Another fine day at work in the fields. I don't envy those city folk who miss out on the joys of working the land.
I was lucky. If you hadn't rescued me, I'd probably be a thief, a mercenary or something even worse.
Lives lost, crops burned, land ruined... there's no greater sin than war. And yet, you were an orphan, and you've made something of your life.
Hey, people have paid money for stranger things. Take our cow dung - we sell that by the wagon load.
Hah! Who in their right mind would pay for dirt? You'd get laughed out of Whiterun for even trying it.
Maybe we should start selling the soil along with the dung. We could make a tidy profit.
When you're rich, you can waste as much money as you like on far-fetched business ideas. In the meantime, there's a farm to run.
The way our crops have been growing, Rorikstead must have the richest soil in the hold.
Glad to hear all my hard work has paid off. Maybe we'll fetch a better price for our crops next time we're in the city.
The last time I was in Whiterun, the tradesmen were talking about you. It seems your reputation as a businessman is growing.
Thanks for the offer, Jouane, but I'm saving up for a new sword.
Anything I can pick up for you on my next trip into the city, Erik?
We don't need your charity, Breton. If my girls deserve something nice, it'll be their father who buys it.
Good day, Lemkil. I saw some nice dresses for your little girls while I was in Whiterun. I'd be happy to purchase them, if you like.
How thoughtful! I'll come take a look after supper.
I picked up a set of fine silver brushes in the city, Reldith. I thought you might be interested.
You're right, it's none of your business. How about you keep your nose out of it?
I'm not saying it's my business, but I have to ask. Why are you so cruel to your little girls?
Hah! And what would a witless oaf like you know about raising children?
You keep on like you are, you'll end up with two daughters who hate you.
Your daughters are growing up fast, Lemkil. Seems like only yesterday they were newborn babes.
There's times I think you're the coldest man in Skyrim. This is your own flesh and blood you're talking about.
They've grown, all right - lazier and more stupid.
But I don't want to be safe! I'm not afraid of the dangers out there. The only thing I'm afraid of is wasting my life on this farm.
I know where this is going, son. As I've said many a time. the world is a dangerous place. You're much safer here at the farm, with me.
Father, how old were you when you left home?
Yes, that's your mother's side of the family talking. Just stay on for one more season, that's all I ask.
I'll take your challenge, but if I win I get to start a new life as an adventurer, and with no objections from you.
Strong, yes, but how clever are you? I'll tell you what, if you can open the lock on my chest, you can have everything in it.
I've told you a hundred times, I lock that chest for a reason. I don't want you getting a head full of ideas about adventure and glory.
I just wanted to try on your old armor, from back when you were a soldier. I thought I might be old enough to wear it.
I heard you sneaking around downstairs last night. Were you trying to break into my chest again, son? I've told you to leave it alone.
I'm old enough to decide how to live my life, and I'd be honored to wear your armor, if you'd just let me. I'm strong enough to handle it.
I'm trying something new, offering discounts for bulk purchases. So far, that seems to be working.
I hear your crops sold well at the market. Well done, Ennis.
Ah, there's nothing like fresh air and honest labor to bolster the spirit.
True enough, but there's nothing wrong with a little adventure now and then. Not much excitement in working the soil every day.
Maybe you're right. Even so, I can't help wondering if some other force it at work here.
Luck? I think it has more to do with the hard work and good soil.
Looks like we're in for quite a harvest. We've had better luck with our planting than any village in the hold.
It pleases me to know that I can still be of use even in the twilight of my life.
Well done! I don't know where I'd be without you, my old friend.
The last wheat shipment fetched a fine price at market.
Those little girls of yours are growing like weeds, Lemkil.
Yes, and just like weeds, they're nothin' but trouble.
So far, things are going well. Let's just hope the weather holds.
Are you making good progress with the planting?
Oh! Are you going to teach me how to turn into a mud crab?
Now, clear your mind and breathe deeply. Good concentration is very important for spellcasting.
Today I'll teach you a useful spell that might just save your life. If you should ever fall into a river, you'll be very glad you learned it.
Wow! Then I could dive into a river and swim so far away that Britte and father could never find me.
Oh, it's much better than that. I will teach you how to breathe underwater, with no need to turn into one of those ugly creatures.
Such is our way! Such is the ancient custom of Skyrim, and all Nords!
There was no murder! Ulfric challenged Torygg. He beat the High King in fair combat.
By opening that gate for Ulfric you betrayed the people of Solitude.
Roggvir. You helped Ulfric Stormcloak escape this city after he murdered High King Torygg.
On this day... I go to Sovngarde.
Guard. Prepare the prisoner.
You should tell her that her uncle is scum that betrayed his High King. Best she know now, Addvar.
Svari, you need to go home. Go home and stay there until your mother comes.
They can't hurt uncle Roggvir. Tell them he didn't do it.
Very well, Roggvir. Bow your head.
I don't need your help.
You're all heart, Vivienne.
Positions.
Lock the city gate.
Liar!
Traitor!
Cut em down!
Booooo.
He doesn't deserve to speak!
Of course.
My little girl. Always strong. Do you know where you have to go?
Father!
I'm to go to the temple in Markarth. I... I'll have to leave you and mother.
Please, lead on.
It's our honor to have you there.
Fjotra, dear. Did they hurt you?
This man is going to take you to Markarth. Are you ready? This woman is going to take you to Markarth. Are you ready?
Of course not. My spirit remains strong.
Now, come with me, child. We'll prepare you for the goddess's presence.
Lead us to your Sybil.
Dibella, guide us.
Please, don't just let it stay like this. It's disgraceful.
It was taken by a lightning strike. Wish I had time to deal with it, but it's hard enough with all these wounded from the war.
What is it... what has happened to the Gildergreen? I have traveled long here to worship beneath its branches.
But this is supposed to be your work.
I really don't have time to deal with you right now. Please just let me get back to my work.
Well, I see that my time is up. Come back tomorrow if you wish to buy.
How did you get that, then? No one's seen them in years!
That's what you said about the Wisp Essence and it turned out to be crushed nirnroot mixed with water!
What a waste of time.
Oh come on, are you talking about the Snow Elves?
That was a simple misunderstanding, but this item is the real thing.
Lads and lasses I give you, Falmerblood Elixir!
Patience, Brand-Shei. This is a rare opportunity, and I wouldn't want you to get left out.
How much does it cost?
Gather 'round all! No pushing, no shoving. Plenty of room! This way everyone! Over here! You need to hear this!
I have something amazing to show you that demands your attention!
Everyone! Everyone! Gather 'round!

Grow back that missing limb! See into other people's thoughts! Learn a library's worth of knowledge in moments! Wield powerful magic incantations! Live for thousands of years! Who knows what powers the elixir will unlock! Please hurry, I have only a few bottles left! Only twenty septims a bottle!
He has to be lying! Twenty coins? No one has that much. Don't listen to him, he's making this up. Why would you even listen to him? He gives other merchants a bad name. This is ridiculous.
One sip of the elixir and your wishes will be granted. Great wealth, everlasting life or perhaps limitless power could be yours!
My sources must remain a secret for their own protection but I can promise that the contents are genuine.
Come on, Brynjolf... what is it this time?
Mystical beings who live in legends and were masters of great magic. Imagine the power that coursed through their veins!
The one and only.

I dunno, sounds like I should try it. What if he's right? Maybe I'll buy one. I could get rich and stop selling these trinkets. This is just what I need right now. I can't afford to get one, but can I afford not to? That Wisp Essence didn't help, but maybe this will.
Only twenty gold septims! Hurry before my supply is gone.
Damn. I knew I shouldn't have waited.
This is insane! I didn't steal anything! I never saw this ring before in my entire life!
All right, Brand-Shei. Turn out your pockets, we know you have it.
I'm telling you, I don't... wait, what's this ring? This isn't mine!
We can do this one of two ways. You can walk with me up to the keep, or I can drag your lifeless body. Your choice.
Have what? What in blazes are you talking about?
But... I... very well.
That's right. It isn't yours. You're under arrest, Brand-Shei.
Don't play stupid. I said turn out your pockets... now!
We've all heard that one before, Bryn! Quit kidding yourself.
Dying breed, eh? Well what do you call that then!
Give it up, Brynjolf... those days are over.
I'm telling you, this one is different...
It's time to face the truth, old friend. You, Vex, Mercer... you're all part of a dying breed. Things are changing!

Stop! That's priceless! Please, I don't have anything to pay you with! Don't destroy my urn! If I had it, I'd pay! There's no need to do that! No! You're going to break it! I can't pay, I can't! I can't believe you're doing this! Stop!
Just pay them, Bersi! Oh my word! This isn't happening!
This better not be another waste of the Guild's resources, Brynjolf.
Mercer? This is the one I was talking about... our new recruit.
Before we continue, I want to make one thing perfectly clear. If you play by the rules, you walk away rich.
You break the rules and you lose your share. No debates, no discussions... you do what we say, when we say.
Mercer, aren't you forgetting something?
You claim this recruit possesses an aptitude for our line of work. If so, let him prove it. You claim this recruit possesses an aptitude for our line of work. If so, let her prove it.
Wait a moment, you're not talking about Goldenglow, are you? Even our little Vex couldn't get in.
Hmm? Oh, yes.
Since Brynjolf assures me you'll be nothing but a benefit to us, then you're in. Welcome to the Thieves Guild.
Goldenglow Estate is critically important to one of our largest clients.
However, the owner has suddenly decided to take matters into his own hands and shut us out. He needs to be taught a lesson.
Brynjolf will provide you with the details.
Did you get a look at that thief that they sent to break into the place? What I wouldn't give for a night with her.
I can't believe how lucky we got landing this job. It's a far cry from working for the Stormcloaks.
No idea. Maybe he got tired of getting stung by these damn bees.
Keep your eyes open, they'll try to hit us again... I just know it.
Sure. Then you wake up in the morning with your purse empty and your gear stolen. No thanks.
You're telling me. Playing nursemaid to a bunch of bees and drinking mead all day beats dying on some battlefield.
Agh... so bored! Only one fight in the last few weeks? This is gonna' drive me crazy.
If they do, we'll send them crying back to their boss again.
Have you seen Refnir? I told him to check out the well drain, but he never reported back.
So why did he sell this place? I mean look at it. This is how to live.
Aringoth said as soon as the deed goes through, we're done here. Then we'll head south and look for more work. Deal?
Probably got drunk and fell into the lake. Who cares.
And you... you're coming with me to Dragonsreach. We'll see how quickly your memory clears in the city's prisons.
Now move.
You assured me this place was clean! I'll see... see to it that you remain in irons for the rest of your days!
Well, Sabjorn. Now that you've taken care of your little pest problem, how about I get a taste of some of your mead?
No, please! I don't understand...
I... I don't know. What's wrong?
Help yourself, milord. It's my finest brew yet... I call it Honningbrew Reserve. I think you'll find it quite pleasing to your palate.
I beg you... please. This is not what it seems!
By the Eight?! What... what's in this? Shor's Bones! What... what's in this?
Silence, idiot! I should have known better... to trust this place after it's been riddled with filth.
Oh come now, this is mead... not some wine to be sipped and savored.
Farewell, Sabjorn.
It will be my pleasure.
You... you're in charge here until I can sort this all out.
Look, I assure you, this is all just a huge misunderstanding!
I said move!
I knew it... Mercer sent you to kill me! Guards, there's an intruder!
He didn't want to hit the bar like the rest! Ha ha ha!
Oh my... that's the worst one yet. How about we stop talking and keep our eyes open like Gulum-Ei said?
What, seriously? Come on, I thought that was funny!
You'd better find that chest that fell off the boat or Gulum-Ei will have your hide!
I know! I know! Just shut up and let me look, okay?
Um, I don't know, why?
Okay, got another one for you.
Three guards run into a bar, but the fourth one just ducks. Why?
Fine, go ahead.
There's two more of them ahead.
That door up ahead... looks perfect for hiding an ambush. Be ready.
Bone chimes... clever. Rigged to wake the draugr I'd bet. Don't blunder into any of them.
The stench in here... this place smells of death. Be on your guard.
Karliah always was a nimble minx... slipping passed these draugr must be child's play for her.
Pull the chain over there, and watch out for the spikes. Looks like Karliah reset all of the traps.
We're on the right track. She's been through here as well.
Karliah's been through here. What does she expect to find?
They say that these ancient Nordic burial mounds are sometimes impenetrable.
Fortunately, these doors have a weakness if you know how to exploit it. Quite simple, really.
Quite simple really, I don't know what the fuss is about these locks. All it takes is a bit of know-how and a lot of skill.
Without the matching claw, they're normally impossible to open. And since I'm certain Karliah already did away with it, we're on our own.
That should do it. After you.
Karliah's close, I'm certain of it. Now let's get moving.
Ah, it's one of the infamous Nordic puzzle doors. How quaint.
This one doesn't look too difficult.
Gallus had his wealth and he had you. All he had to do was look the other way.
You're a clever girl, Karliah. Buying Goldenglow Estate and funding Honningbrew Meadery was inspired.
But I can promise the next time we meet, it will be your undoing.
I'm no fool, Mercer. Crossing blades with you would be a death sentence.
Did you forget the Oath we took as Nightingales? Did you expect him to simply ignore your methods?
How interesting. It appears Gallus's history has repeated itself.
Karliah has provided me with the means to be rid of you, and this ancient tomb becomes your final resting place.
But do you know what intrigues me the most? The fact that this was all possible because of you.
You always were a quick study.
Enough of this mindless banter!
Give me a reason to try.
Not quick enough, otherwise Gallus would still be alive.
Do you honestly think your arrow will reach me before my blade finds your heart?
"To ensure an enemy's defeat, you must first undermine his allies."
It was the first lesson Gallus taught us.
Farewell. I'll be certain to give Brynjolf your regards.
Come, Karliah. It's time for you and Gallus to become reunited!
Does the journal say where this wealth came from?
Hmm. This is intriguing, but highly disturbing.
I'm not familiar with the Twilight Sepulcher. What is it? What's Mercer Frey done?
Anything else, Enthir? Anything about... the Nightingales?
It's alright Karliah. You don't have to say a word.
The last few pages seem to describe "the failure of the Nightingales" although it doesn't go into great detail.
Gallus also repeatedly mentions his strong belief that Mercer desecrated something known as the Twilight Sepulcher.
Yes. Gallus seems certain that Mercer had been removing funds from the Guild's treasury without anyone's knowledge.
It appears that Gallus had suspicions about Mercer Frey's allegiance to the Guild for months.
Gallus had begun to uncover what he calls an "...unduly lavish lifestyle replete with spending vast amounts of gold on personal pleasures."
Shadows preserve us. So it's true...
Hmm. Yes, here it is.
I'm sorry Enthir, I can't say. All that matters is we deliver your translation to the Guild immediately.
Farewell, Enthir... words can't express...
'Accidents' like this don't just happen! Someone is trying to sabotage my uncle's research! Yes, I'm positive I heard something.
No, no! This can't be happening!
Another trap, most likely. Things are dangerous... three of the guards died when the lower hall flooded with steam last week.
Better them than us. We lost three good men to the traps up there, and for what- just to see another damn spider clanking around?
What the...?
I... oh, all right. If there is a thief, he won't leave this tower alive. But shouldn't we inform Master Calcelmo?
Well, at least this post is safe enough. Come on, let's get back to work.
...As you say, sir.
Everyone, fall back! Run for it!
You heard me, captain- our work must not be disturbed.
Kill any intruders on sight. Call for backup if you need it. But let no one through.
What a waste! There must be a dozen men up there!
What do you think this is?
Sir, are you serious?
Yeah. Calcelmo called in his entire expedition team- said he needed every man he could get to protect his research.
Aedra, what a day!
All right men, spread out and search the tower. No telling who- or what- we're dealing with here.
I'll deal with my uncle. Just... go! Scour this place from top to bottom!
Calcelmo's orders- no one gets through to the tower. Kill any intruders on sight. Call for backup if you need to.
This can't be true. I've known Mercer too long...
No, it... it can't be.
It says Mercer's been stealing from our vault for years. Gallus was looking into it before he was murdered.
Use your key on the vault, Delvin. We'll open it up and find out the truth.
What's in that book? What did it say?
What's she on about?
I have Gallus's journal. I think you'll find its contents disturbing.
By the Eight! It's gone, everything's gone! Get in here, all of you!
Now what's this so-called proof you speak of?
Wait just a blessed moment, Bryn.
He didn't need to pick the lock.
You better have a damn good reason to be here with that murderer.
It's true, Brynjolf. Every word. Mercer's been stealing from the Guild for years, right under your noses.
That door has the best puzzle locks money can buy. There's no way it can be picked open.
No tricks, Karliah or I'll cut you down where you stand.
I've used my key, but the vault's still locked up tighter than a drum. Now use yours.
Please, lower your weapons so we can speak. I have proof that you've all been misled!
There's only one way to find out if what the lass says is true. Delvin, I'll need you to open the Vault.
The gold, the jewels... it's all gone.
That son-of-a-bitch! I'll kill him!
We can't afford to lose our heads... we need to calm down and focus.
Vex! Put it away... right now.
Delvin, Vex... watch the Flagon. If you see Mercer, come tell me right away.
How can Mercer open up a vault that needs two keys? It's impossible. Could he pick his way in?
Do what he says, Vex. This isn't helpin' right now.
Fine. We do it your way. For now.
Let me see.
Aye, lass... and I've come to a decision.
Mercer Frey tried to kill both of you, he betrayed the Guild, murdered Gallus and made us question our future. He needs to die.
Then it's all true... everything I heard in the stories. The Nightingales, their allegiance to Nocturnal and the Twilight Sepulcher.
Brynjolf, the time has come to decide Mercer's fate. Until a new Guild Master is chosen, the decision falls to you.
We have to be very careful, Brynjolf. Mercer is a Nightingale, an Agent of Nocturnal.
Just outside of Riften, beyond the Southeast Gate is a small path cut up the mountainside.
At the end of that path is a clearing and an old standing stone. I'd ask you both meet me there.
So, this is Nightingale Hall. I heard about this place when I joined the Guild, but I never believed it existed.
I have two others that wish to transact the Oath; to serve you both in life and in death.
My Lady, I've come before you to throw myself upon your mercy and to accept responsibility for my failure.
I'm trying to understand why I'm here, lass. I'm no priest, and I'm certainly not religious. Why pick me?
The assumption that the Nightingales were just a myth was seeded within the Guild on purpose.
It helped avert attention from our true nature.
This isn't about religion, Brynjolf... it's business.
I call upon you Lady Nocturnal, Queen of Murk and Empress of Shadow... hear my voice!
We will honor our agreement in this life and the next until your conditions have been met.
Lady Nocturnal, we accept your terms. We dedicate ourselves to you as both your avengers and your sentinels.
What's wrong, Brynjolf? I can almost hear your brow furrowing.
This is Nightingale Hall. You're the first of the uninitiated to set foot inside in over a century.
What sort of arrangement? I need to know the terms.
Aye, there's always a catch. But at this point, I suppose there isn't much to lose.
If it means the end of Mercer Frey, you can count me in.
Okay, lass. We've got these getups on... now what?
Beyond this gate is the first step in becoming a Nightingale.
The terms are quite simple, Brynjolf. Nocturnal will allow you to become a Nightingale and use your abilities for whatever you wish.
And in return, both in life and in death, you must serve as a guardian of the Twilight Sepulcher.
Ah, Karliah. I was wondering when I'd hear from you again. Lose something did we?
Revenge? How interesting...
Very well, the conditions are acceptable. You may proceed.
My appetite for Mercer's demise exceeds my craving for wealth, Your Grace.
Very well. I name your initiates Nightingale and I restore your status to the same, Karliah.
And in the future, I'd suggest you refrain from disappointing me again.
You surprise me, Karliah. This offer is definitely weighted in my favor.
You're already mine, Karliah. Your terms were struck long ago. What could you possibly offer me now?
Woah there, lass. I appreciate the armor, but becoming a Nightingale? That was never discussed.
Yes. That's why we need to prepare ourselves and meet Mercer on equal footing.
If she's to accept you as one of her own, an arrangement must be struck.
To hold any hope of defeating Mercer, we must have Nocturnal at our backs.
Now, if you'll both proceed to the armory to don your Nightingale Armor, we can begin the Oath.
Climb down that ledge and see if you can...
Karliah, when will you learn you can't get the drop on me?
He's here and he hasn't seen us yet. Brynjolf, watch the door.
Aye, lass. Nothing's getting by me.
Damn! This place is coming down! Quick, get the Skeleton Key and the Eye and lets get out of here!
We have to find another way out of here before the place fills with water!
No luck there, lass. Something must have fallen on the other side of the door because it isn't moving!
Shor's Bones! Look at that monstrosity.
This is where we saw Mercer. We must be getting close.
I can hear water rushing through these pipes. We must be beneath a lake.
Aye, lass... and we'll be ready for him.
Let's keep moving.
Looks like we can take the low road or the high road across this chamber. Your choice.
Aye. Whatever you want to do, we're with you.
The stench... this place reeks of Falmer.
It's a Dwarven Centurion. Very tough and very deadly.
It's Mercer! Look... down there!
So this is what we heard. The entire tower collapsed.
Wait a moment... what's that?
Falmer patrol up ahead. I don't think they know we're here.
Look at the size of this place. Have you ever seen anything like it in your life, lass?
This must be their hive. We'll have to keep silent if we want to avoid drawing their attention.
The only reason to do that would be to block pursuit. It must be Mercer.
We'll have to find another way around.
Damn it! There's no way through.
Mercer must have triggered these pistons. We're going to have to search for a way to open them.
He's close. I'm certain of it. We must prepare ourselves.
I'm on it, lass.
Even the Falmer don't deserve the pain these implements must have inflicted. The dwarves were a cruel race.
I'll bet my last septim that there's a mechanism around here somewhere.
He's toying with us. He wants us to follow.
Then this is it. We do this for Gallus and for the Guild.
We can take the beast on or sneak around. It's your call, lad. We're right behind you. We can take the beast on or sneak around. It's your call, lass. We're right behind you.
Can't say that I have. Imagine the riches hidden within these walls.
There's a mass of the Falmer in this chamber. We can sneak through or take them down... I don't care. As long as we get to Mercer.
Mercer was able to knock this thing down? Gods...
It's the Key, Brynjolf. In his hands, there's no telling what he's capable of.
Damn you, Mercer!
I'm sorry lass, I... I can't...
What's... what's happening... I can't stop myself.
Fight it, Brynjolf... he's taken control of you!
Get the damn Key and let's get out of here before we end up like Mercer!

You can't kill what you can't see! I've mastered the shadows... and now your life is mine! Come, "Nightingale!" Find me if you can! Karliah's taught you nothing! Your lessons begin anew! I should've finished you when I had the chance!
Hmm. The gate below still looks closed.
I've seen a puzzle like this before... there's got to be another lever to pull, but you'd better hurry. A septim says this mechanism's on a timer.
Karliah, I'll deal with you after I rid myself of your irksome companions. In the meantime, perhaps you and Brynjolf should get better acquainted.
My, my. What do we have here?
It's been a number of years since I've set foot on your world. Or perhaps it's been moments. One tends to lose track.
I bid you to drink deeply from the Ebonmere, mortal. For this is where the Agent of Nocturnal is born.
The Oath has been struck, the die has been cast and your fate awaits you in the Evergloam.
What you fail to realize is your actions were expected and represent nothing more than the fulfillment of your agreement.
So... once again the Key has been stolen and a "champion" returns it to the Sepulcher.
Now that Ebonmere has been restored, you stand before me awaiting your accolades; a pat on your head... a kiss on your cheek.
Don't mistake my tone for displeasure, after all, you've obediently performed your duties to the letter.
Fear not. You'll have your trinkets, your desire for power, your hunger for wealth.
But we both know this has little to do with honor and oaths and loyalty. It's about the reward; the prize.
Farewell, Nightingale. See to it the Key stays this time, won't you?
What will you do now, my love?
Farewell, Gallus. Eyes open... walk with the shadows.
Karliah?
I feared I would never see you again. I was afraid you'd become like the others.
When your debt to Nocturnal has been paid, we'll embrace once again.
Gallus!
Nocturnal calls me to the Evergloam. My contract has been fulfilled.
Goodbye, Karliah.

If it were not for the actions of this Nightingale, your fears would have come true. He honors us all. If it were not for the actions of this Nightingale, your fears would have come true. She honors us all.
Will I ever see you again?
I trust you've applied the appropriate pressure in order to change their mind?
Yes, I'm afraid you're right. Such a shame...
I have. I think we may have to turn this one over to the Dark Brotherhood.
Sorry Mercer, they no longer wish to be involved in our operation.
Brynjolf, have you had a chance to speak to our contact in Whiterun?
Do we have anyone reliable to send out there? I don't want to look the fool again in front of her, Brynjolf.
Remind me why we even bother to allow him to be a part of the Guild.
Two reasons. He's rich and because we need every sword we can get right now.
Maven has been nagging us about her request. Any thoughts?
Yes, I know. That last job was my fault. I obviously thought Niruin was ready, but I was wrong.
There's no need to be concerned. We've been through more difficult times than this.
I'll speak to the Jarl and see what I can do. Just keep them at bay a little longer.
I think we need to prepare for the worst. The coffers are dwindling and I can barely keep our contacts happy.
Normally I'd agree, but we've already lost so many contacts across Skyrim. If we lose the ones in Riften, we may as well close up shop.
Delvin, please tell me you have good news.
You tell this sorry bunch of thieves that they need to put down their flagons and get to work if they want to keep their status!
If I told you that, I'd be lying. We haven't had a bite in weeks. Our clients are starting to get angry.
I will, I will...
So is it true, bandits get... you know, real friendly with the wildlife?
So, Thrynn, you were a bandit, huh?
Yeah, what of it?
You're an idiot.
Oh, really? Well then... how can I make that happen?
Absolutely.
So, what do you think, my dear? Could a beautiful woman like you ever see yourself with an old codger like me?
When you're in your grave and I'm standing over it. Now get out of my way!
That's impossible. I distinctly heard that lout in the tavern say it was a full shipment of furs. They should be worth a fortune.
You idiot. He said "firs" not "furs." It was a damn logging caravan!
Delvin, that last shipment we heisted on the Cyrodiil frontier was worthless!
Oh my... umm, you won't let Mercer hear about this will you? Ahem.
Thank you, Vex. You've always been the most reliable one in the Guild.
I've picked up some new clients and did a few jobs on my own, but I'm not sure if that will cover our expenses.
Well, what the hell is Mercer going to do about this mess? Have you even talked to him?
Mercer is being Mercer. If he has a plan to get us out of this rut, then he isn't sharing it with me.
Brynjolf, something stinks around here and it's more than just the Ratway. We all know it. The question is, what's Mercer going to do about it?
How are you feeling, Vex?
Well, I see your wounds have healed but your pride still needs some time.
Pretty angry actually. I can't believe I botched the Goldenglow job. That should have been like stealing a sweetroll from a baby.
Your idea to start a brothel, right? Do you want me to tell you exactly what I think?
Hold a moment, Rune. What did you think about my idea?
I think if Brynjolf catches wind of it, he'll boot you right out of here... so drop it already!
Well, yes! Please!
Yeah, I know what you mean. If things don't start getting better soon, I may look for work elsewhere.
I'll keep that in mind.
What in the name of Oblivion is going on in this place?
Hey, I still have a contact in Valenwood that may have some work for us. You're welcome to join me.
This place is getting worse and worse.
She said that she barely had enough coin to cover it and I should come back later. Can you imagine that?
I think I know, but go ahead.
I tried to fence some goods to Tonilia, and you know what she told me?
You stupid cow. You don't know what you're missing.
No, but I know that you're going to turn up missing if you keep up this kind of talk.
So, Sapphire. Can I do anything for you, or more to the point... to you?
Vipir "the Fleet." The only man who's foolish enough to name himself after his bedroom prowess.
You seem to be a bit closer to Brynjolf than the rest of us. Is he giving you any idea why this place seems to be falling apart?
What about Mercer? Have you asked him?
If he does, he isn't telling me a thing. I've asked, but all I get from him are more questions.
No, and I'm not about to either. I value my life you know... you may want to remember that for yourself.
All right. I have everything you asked for all ready to go.
I don't understand it either. They were a sure thing, I swear.
I hope this deal goes through. I'm putting quite a bit of coin on the line... and the last two you set up fell through.
You just better hope this one isn't another waste of my coin.
Well, if you don't want to hear it, that's your loss.
So, the ending of my tale I began earlier...
If I wanted to hear a tall tale, I'll read a children's storybook. Get some better stories, Vipir.
Is this your tale of single-handedly fighting off a pack of trolls or my favorite... where you bedded four women on the same night?
Yeah, it's really something else, isn't it?
You know, things are really starting to move around here. I mean, look at the place. I've never seen so much merchandise.
At this rate, the Guild won't be such a laughingstock anymore.
I agree. It'll be nice to get back the respect we lost in the last few years.
Take a look around. Have you ever laid eyes on such wealth?
Never. This is the best the Guild's done since I've been a part of it.
How's the training going?
Better than ever. With the Guild back on its feet, there's more coin to throw around. How about you?
Couldn't be busier.
Let's just hope it stays this way for a long time.
So I'm finally seeing you with a smile on your face.
It's this place. It feels like home. It's just nice to finally have something going right in my life.
Karliah?
Vex?
Everyone is in agreement, so all I can do now is name you Guild Master and wish you good fortune and long life.
Agreed.
Absolutely.
Look, I've never been good at these things, so I'm just going to keep it short.
Being Guild Master means more than just getting a cut of all the loot, it's about being a leader and keeping this rabble in order.
With that in mind, I propose that the position of Guild Master should be yours.
Sure, why not.
Now everyone get back to work.
Delvin?
I call upon Oblivion realms. The home of those who are not our ancestors. Answer my plea!
As in death there is new life, in Oblivion there is a beginning for that which has ended.
I call forth that power! Accept the soul that we offer!
As the sun ends the night, end the darkness of this soul, return life to the creature you see before you!

Am I going have to beat it out of you? Is that what you want? You start flapping that jaw of yours or I'll start flapping it for you. You understand me? Where'd you stash it? Look at me when I'm talking to you, eh?
Honest, I didn't take it! I… I don't know, it wasn't me. I swear!
Rise up and live again! I grant you a new life! Come on, get up! This should work. I've done it before. Gah! This staff is useless... I'm useless. The whole world is useless!
I told you, it's the wedding of Vittoria Vici, an extremely well connected merchant with the East Empire Company. The Emperor's cousin? Remember?
Why are we even going to a wedding at this far flung end of the Empire anyway?
Come along, no more stops, we need to find our way to Solitude.
Hopefully these gifts will put us in her good graces, secure that import deal, and lead the way to an audience with the Emperor.
Wha... Your shoes? We get robbed by bandits, my clothes torn to shreds by some giant cat, our bodyguard eaten by a dragon...
I hate it here. Those were my favorite shoes, ruined and for what? We never even made it to the wedding.
When we get back to Cyrodiil, I swear I will hire an army of battlemages to come up here and set fire to the whole damned province.
And you're worried about your shoes?
No, how did you find me? Just give me more time, I can pay Maven back!
Maven sends her regards Letrush.
You! You must have told Maven about the horse. If you'd just stuck to the plan, I wouldn't be in this mess.
Listen, wench, we're on to you. We know who you are, so you'd better come with us right now!
We've made a mistake. Now move along before that mouth of yours gets you into trouble.
What? Oh... you're right.
She doesn't have the scar.
I'm not going anywhere.  Now back off before I do something drastic.
Brother, I think she's telling the truth...
I don't have time for this foolishness. Now come along quietly and we won't have to get rough.
Next time you're looking to pester someone, make sure it's the right person!
I don't know who you think I am, and I don't care. Leave me alone!
I'd rather have two bottles of mead then two wenches, friend.
Drink Honningbrew Mead with a wench on each arm? Ha ha!
Ah, is there any way you'd rather spend the day than drinking Honningbrew Mead?
The meads won't argue your ear off about which one should go first!
Why's that?
Please, someone help me!
Help me! A vampire!
Another victim fell for our ruse!

What's he doing poking his nose in there? What's she doing poking her nose in there? Is he... sifting through trash? Is she... sifting through trash? What's he rummaging around in there for? What's she rummaging around in there for? Look at him, rummaging through refuse. Wonder what he's lost... besides his mind. Look at her, rummaging through refuse. Wonder what she's lost... besides her mind. Tsk. What a man will do for a few coins... Tsk. What a woman will do for a few coins... Picking through garbage. Has he no shame? Picking through garbage. Has she no shame? What's he digging around in there for? What's she digging around in there for? What's he doing? Looking for rubies in rubbish? Get a job! What's she doing? Looking for rubies in rubbish? Get a job!

Maybe he's looking for something to eat? Maybe she's looking for something to eat? He might find something good in there. One man's trash is another's treasure. She might find something good in there. One man's trash is another's treasure. The poor dear must truly be hungry to comb through rubbish like that. Hope he finds something edible. The poor dear must truly be hungry to comb through rubbish like that. Hope she finds something edible. Sometimes it pays to look in every nook and cranny. When you're hungry, you'll look anywhere for food. Can't blame him. When you're hungry, you'll look anywhere for food. Can't blame her. Desperate times call for desperate measures. Maybe he found what he was looking for in there. Desperate times call for desperate measures. Maybe she found what she was looking for in there. How unfortunate he has to dig through refuse like that. Someone should give him a piece of bread. How unfortunate she has to dig through refuse like that. Someone should give her a piece of bread. You never know what you'll find laying around in a crate or barrel. People toss the darnedest things in them.
Come on. Hurry it up already. The waiting is killing me.
I can't wait to be invisible.
Boo! Ahahahaha! Oooooh... weeeeoooooo....  That's right. Who's invisible? Me!  Surprise! Ahaha!

What is it doing? Walking around nearly naked... Oh! Look over there! That's certainly unusual. Some folk - they got no shame. Well now! That's a shamefully absurd way to go around in public. Ummm... they'd lock me up if I went around like that. What is that half-naked fetcher trying to prove? What a vulgar display. That's not something you see every day... Gracious! This one is certainly unaccustomed to such sights... Well now! Aren't you putting on quite the show? Shameful, really. I blame the parents.  Oh, dear. Would you look at that? How embarrassing. Look at that fool. Gah! Look over there. I can't believe it. It takes a lot of confidence to walk around naked. Trust me on that. Whoa. Crazy person... Something must be wrong with its head, to strut around like that. They're half-naked. That ain't right. Somebody's gotta say somethin'... Look! Look! Somebody get that idiot some armor... A bit much, going around like that... Why the impropriety! Never see me strutting around like that! Crazy, naked n'wah... Whoa... Not even I'm that drunk... Positively vulgar. Somebody get that fool a blanket. Despite the shame, this one can't help but stare. By Ysmir's beard! I didn't know it was gonna be a party! For shame! You should be locked up for strutting around like that. Oh my. Been a lot of years since I've seen something like that... Got to admire the chops it takes to walk around like that. Not my thing, but who am I to judge... Wait until the boys hear about this. Now that's something else, right there!

If you cause problems, I'll have to ask you to leave. You're making my patrons nervous. Put the weapon away. Put that thing away. You're making people nervous. We've all seen your little weapon. We're impressed. Now, please put it away. It's time to put the weapon away now. Thank you. It is making patrons nervous. It needs to put the weapon away, now. You. Weapon. Away. Now! You can bring weapons in, but you can't use 'em in here. Got it? If it's not too much to ask, put the weapon away? Thanks. I trust I won't have to, but I'll bust your head in if you cause problems for my patrons. While a good fight is always entertaining, my patrons don't like blood in their food. Put the weapon away. If you don't mind, my patrons would appreciate it if you put the weapon away.

Don't break anything with that weapon, okay? You break it, you buy it. Please... don't break my wares! If that weapon breaks anything, you will be buying it. This is a proper store. Start acting like a proper customer. Sheathe that weapon. Don't start swinging that thing in here. If that weapon breaks anything of mine, I'll break something of yours. Put that thing away, or get out. You should probably put that away before you knock something over. Break my stuff with that weapon, and I'll break you. Watch it with that thing! Fine weapon, but you wouldn't mind putting it away, I'm sure. Look. You're making my customers nervous. Put the weapon away. You. Weapon. Put it away. Now. Don't start swinging that thing in here. You break it, you buy it. Brandishing your weapon is not going to help you negotiate a better sale... You're disturbing my other customers. That weapon breaks my wares, we're gonna have us a real problem... You won't be intimidating me into lower prices. Put that thing away. Walking around with your weapon out is bound to make people nervous. We understand each other?  If that weapon causes problems for my customers, I cause problems for you. Got it? Unless you're here to sell that weapon of yours, why don't you put it away. Come on. Put the weapon away. You're making people nervous.

Why the drawn weapon? Is it contemplating violence? Neat weapon. You're not going to hurt anybody, though. Right? I trust you'll put your weapon away? You planning on using that weapon? Civilized people don't brandish their weapons unless they plan to use them. Umm... you're not planning on using that weapon, are you? At least not on me... right? You'd better know how to use that weapon if you plan on swinging it around in here. Perhaps you'd care to put your weapon away? Hmm? There a reason you're walking around with an unsheathed weapon? This one wonders why you brandish your weapon so? Might want to put it away that weapon... unless you plan on using it. You got no respect, strutting about with that weapon out, threatening everyone. Dear. You should put that weapon away. You got guts walking around with that weapon out. Looking for a fight? Is that it? Put that thing away before someone gets hurt! Now, now... no need for weapons. Nice weapon you have there. But I don't suppose you'd consider putting it away? What's this? Is it spoiling for a fight? If not, it should hide its weapon away. You want to fight? That why you have your weapon out? Wow. Nice weapon! Can I hold it? I promise not to break anything. Honest! Put your weapon away. You're not planning on hurting anyone with that weapon there, are you? So... carrying that weapon around like that makes you feel safe, does it? Uh. Hey. That weapon there is just for show. Right? I mean, you aren't going to hurt me or anything... right? In some parts of the world, wielding a weapon openly like that is an invitation to combat... Ooh, real tough, wagging your weapon around... I suggest you put away your weapon. Wouldn't want to cause a... scene. You're not planning on using that weapon in here, I hope. That's mighty bold, strutting about like that, looking for a fight. This one will oblige if he must. Oh ho! What's with the weapon? Looks like it's about to get rough in here.  Damn fool parading around with your weapon out. You planning on hurting someone, huh? You're making people a bit nervous. Should consider putting that weapon away.  Ever see someone killed with their own weapon? Would you like to? Walk into the the wrong place with your weapon drawn? You might not walk out again.... It's probably best if you put that weapon away. Nice weapon you got there. Care to put it away?
Come on. I don't want to hit you until you have your ward ready.
Get your ward ready.
All right. That should do it. I think I'm ready to try the College again. Thanks!
Great! Now I'm going to cast some spells at you. Keep your ward up so I can study it.
I think I see what I was doing wrong...
By the gods...
Dragon!
Everyone, inside. Now!
Not bad. Reminds me when I first started smithing.
Good job. I can see you know what you're doing.
You made that from the remains of a dragon? Amazing.
Masterful. That's a work of art, right there.
That's a decent weapon you've made there.
Not too shabby. Apprentice level work, but solid. Keep at it.
You don't see many people crafting with that these days. Impressive.
That's some good armor you've put together.
Now that's how it's done! I doubt anyone in Skyrim could have weaved a better enchantment.
Watching you reminds me of my first days as an enchanter.
Ah, fire. A capricious element. Often deadly, but always exciting.
That's a decent enchantment. But keep studying, you've only scratched the surface.
It's wise to carry a few summoning enchantments around.
It's intriguing the way certain materials are more or less receptive to the force of lightning, is it not?
Well done. Not many enchanters could pull that off.
An excellent elixir. Your technique shows a command of the alchemical art.
That's a fine potion you've put together.
An "interesting" mixture... Keep experimenting. You'll improve with practice.
You've produced a rarefied solution there, an infusion of pure essences. Artfully done.
That's a good concoction. But keep trying new things. Alchemy rewards inquisitive minds.
You've brewed a truly vile poison there. I pity the beast that tastes that.
Alright now. Everyone back away. Let the law handle this.
Oh no... what happened here?
If anyone saw anything, step forward. Otherwise, step away from the body!
Looks dead to me.
Not sure, let's watch and find out.
But...
You there! Wait a moment.
Is he... dead? Is she... dead?
Is that the murderer?

Let me know if you see anything you like. I'm kind of busy, but if you need any potions or ingredients, let me know. I'll be over here if you need any potions or ingredients. Hello there, can I pour you a Black-Briar Mead? Ah good, back for some more Black-Briar mead, eh? Welcome to the Pawned Prawn. Come on in, take a look around. Welcome back to the Prawn. Let me know if you need anything. Oh, do come in! I hope I have what you need. Take a good look around. I'm sure you'll find what you're looking for. If not, let me know, I might have it stored away. Got something for just about everybody in here. Give a holler if you have any questions. The Mortar and Pestle makes potions, if you can't tell from the name. Just step up to the counter. If you are here to purchase, I have many spells available. Do come in. Welcome. There are many things here that cannot be found elsewhere. Good to have a customer! You need food or drink, you say the word. Always good to see folk come back for more. You need a drink, you just let me know. It's down the stairs, dear. Just come right in.
Can I help you? Aren't you a sight for sore eyes. Hello friend. Make yourself at home. You lost? I trust you're not planning any trouble. What can I do for you, friend? Good to see you. Come on in.
That can be arranged.
I don't think so! I saw it first! I'm taking it. Not if I get it first. No. It's mine! We'll see about that. I'm taking it anyway. No! I think not.
They're fighting over that thing, I think.
Damn. Another fight.
What's all the commotion?
Hey! That's my sword. Don't touch that dagger! It's mine. I don't think so. That axe is mine. Keep away from that bow. It's mine. Hands off. That's my armor now! You're too slow. I saw it first.

Hey! What's this? Who left that here? Well! Finders, keepers as they say. If nobody wants that, I'll take it. Damn shame to leave that lying around. It's a bit worn, but I'll take it. Looks like it's my lucky day. Hmm. What's this?

You can take it over my dead body! If it's a fight you want, it's a fight you'll get. Back off! You'll have to take it from me. Your blood won't bother me! You'll have to fight me for it. I'll hurt you if I have to. You're too slow and stupid to take it from me.
Someone's going to get hurt.

What's this? It thinks it can just throw refuse wherever it likes? Really, the nerve of some people, leaving their trash wherever they please. What kind of filthy barbarian just throws their trash on the ground? Oh, by all means. Just leave your refuse wherever you see fit. There's a place for trash, and that's not it. In my day, we knew how to dispose of trash properly. What's the matter with you? You think you can just go dropping your junk wherever you like? Look at this one. Spoiled as a child, I'll bet. Allowed to leave trash just lying around... I swear, is there no end to these uncouth savages, just throwing their trash wherever they please... Hrmmm. Pick up your trash, fetcher. I never did understand the local custom of simply leaving one's trash wherever is convenient... Who does that? Who just leaves their garbage lying about? Gah! Quit throwing your garbage everywhere. One person's trash is another's treasure. Don't be surprised if you find that gone... And they call me a savage. Least I don't leave my trash lying around...
Let me know if there's anything else you need.
I'll show you to your room. Right this way.

Come on in. The Silver-Blood Inn has plenty of strong drink and clean rooms. Come on in. Just stoked the fire. Take a seat and get the cold out. If you've got the coin, you've come to the right place. Pull up a seat. Welcome. Let me know if you want anything... think I got a clean mug around here somewhere. Come on in. We got warm food, warm drinks, and warm beds. Ah, a visitor. Old Hroldan Inn has hundreds of years of history, friend. Welcome to the Vilemyr Inn. If there's anything I can get you, just let me know. Finally, someone comes in. Kick off your boots, stay awhile. Let me know if there's anything I can help you with. I got nothing but time these days. Come on in. Let me know if you need anything, or take a seat by the fire and I'll send someone over.

Saadia, wake up dear! Hey, Talen... get off your lazy tail and take care of the customer! Frabbi, a customer needs a drink! Lynly, would you mind taking care of the customer please? Look alive, will you!
Yes, mum! Keep your scales on. Too lazy to give him a drink yourself? Oaf. No problem. Yessir!
No! There's got to be more Skooma... Shut up! Shut up!  Don't lie to me J'zhar! You hid it! You always try to steal it from me!
Where is it? I know you were trying to keep it for yourself J'zhar... You always try to keep it for yourself!
No... No! You must be the one who took my skooma!
What? Who is this, Brother? Another of the smooth skins looking for food? But this one wasn't trapped with us...
Oh, of course you want me to leave. Just waiting for me to turn my back. So you can have all the glory for yourself!
Sulla look, the passage is open, wait... there's someone down there!
Sulla, let's just get out of here. Hasn't there been enough death?
No! Blackreach was to be my discovery!
Don't fall behind!
At last, the treasure is mine! All mine!
Cowards, every one of them. Running at the first sign of trouble...
Yes!  The path is clear!
Riches and fortune, within my grasp, and I have to give it all up because they're afraid of a few dead bodies...
Keep digging! Ugh... If Lu'ah Al-Skaven can raise an army of Draugr, then why do I have to babysit them?
They burned his body before I could raise him... it should have been returned to me...
Take this with our gratitude.
I could not raise him, but I will raise an army to avenge his defilement!
You will not stop me from killing those who wage this pointless war!
Thank you for releasing us from her spell.
Rise from your graves to defeat this worm!
Now we can rest in peace once again. Come Fjori, my love...
I shall have vengeance for the death of my husband. Rise!
Yeah, but raising Draugr to take on both the Imperials and the Stormcloaks? That's just crazy.
I think it's sweet Lu'ah is so worked up over her dead soldier...
True, but I'm not going to be the one to try to oppose her...
I am Lu'ah Al-Skaven. Who are you to disrupt my work? Begone, or I will add you to my army of the dead!
If you can remain calm, even in the midst of chaos, your arrow will most likely find its target.
When I tell you to, try and hit each of the three closest targets in eight seconds.
If you can learn to keep your composure and trust that each shot is true, then you should be able to quickly handle multiple targets.
Now hit the target to the left.
Shoot the left target.
I'll count to three and then say "go." You have eight seconds to hit each of the three targets. Draw string and get ready.
My older brother took me out hunting a lot when I was little.
She always said composure was the key to a successful archer.
So whenever we came across more than one deer in a single location, it was imperative we kill as many as we could.
Great shot. Now hit the target to the right.
You did it! All three targets in eight seconds. Nice job.
Shoot the right target.
My father was rarely home, so it was my mother who actually taught me how to use a bow.
Shoot the middle target.
Remember to stay within the boundaries and only use the practice arrows. I have some if you don't have any.
Aim for the middle target.
OK, let's see what you can do.
At the time, it was difficult to keep food on the table, let alone have enough left over to sell at the market.
Now it's time to use all three at once.
We've talked about composure, speed, and precision.
Just remember everything I've taught you and you should be able to complete it.
It may take you a couple of tries, but that's what practice is all about.
However, with such a long shot, it's more than likely that's the only shot you'll be able to take before your prey runs off.
I'll count to three and then say "go." You have ten seconds to hit each of the four targets. Draw string and get ready.
OK, your turn. Try and hit that target way in the back, far behind the other three. Remember to take your time and make your shot count.
You did it! All four targets in ten seconds. Nice job.
Often times you won't be able to get as close to your prey as you'd like and you'll have to settle with a long shot.
When I tell you to, try and hit all four targets in ten seconds.
I'm warning you now, this challenge will be quite difficult.
We've talked about speed and composure. Now we'll go over precision.
If you find yourself in such a situation, then you need to make your shot count.
Don't rush your shot. Crouch down, get comfortable, and take aim.
Shoot the far target.
Been a long time since someone took the leap. Longer still since any survived it.
I once performed the entirety of the Poetic Edda from atop Bard's Leap before trying my luck... Well, you can see how that turned out.
Yes, kind morsel. Let us go up, and mind Melka on the way.
Press only middle button! Clever trick, yes? Nobody ever thinks of the middle.
Who enters? Will nobody save poor Melka?
Careful here, there's a trick to this. Trick is to not bleed to death. Ah, and there's a lever, too.
I spit on you, dead sister.
Ah, my parlor. No finer place to boil eyes, no...
Petra, you traitorous grouse! Die!
It is no matter, this fool will be the next act of the show.
And who is this?
You've been here for a while, right? What was it like back when we could still make runs out to the coast?
The Captain has it locked away in that drowned ship by his quarters. He says it's "to keep it safe" but I know he's just keeping it for himself.
Maybe. For now just lay low and do your job. I have a feeling we'll be rid of the Captain soon...
Well, before that cave-in sealed our ships in here we could loot any size ship we wanted.
If only we could get our hands on that treasure. We could get out of here and never look back.
Where did you keep all that loot?  I've been here almost a year and haven't seen any of it.
Stop yammering and keep your eyes peeled. They could be here at any moment. If I were them I'd come straight here, sword swingin'!
Can you believe one person came in here and took out this whole camp?
He requests more barrels of ichor to be delivered to the Arcanex tomorrow.
Orchendor promised a place where we would be accepted and taken care of.
Yes, what is it?
We've been here so long and what do we have to show for it?
