I'm sorry to wake you, my Brother. I have a request from Orchendor.
I know you can't hear me, brother. I don't like what we've become.
Keep your eyes and ears open my Brothers and Sisters.  Orchendor needs us to keep vigilant while he convenes with Peryite in the Arcanex.
Are you asleep?
Yes, suffer for you.
Yes, yes, as with you. Now be off.
Yes, show yourself to us. Until that day, we will continue to devote our lives to you and suffer for you.
I know this place will eventually kill us. I have come to accept that. But I will always regret that day I introduced you to Orchendor.
Yes, my Brother. Forgive me. May the blessing of Peryite be with you.
Yes, a sign. We are lost without your guidance.
On the ninth of Rain's Hand our prayers went unanswered, yet here we stand, not faltering in our belief that soon you will show yourself to us.
But who am I kidding, I know you wouldn't let me leave, brother. You truly believe in Orchendor and his promises.
Now leave me to my sleep. My strength and patience are waning.
If we do not please you, give us a sign so that we may understand why.
Yes, a blessing. For many months we have sought your guidance, yet we have heard nothing from you.
I want out. I want to leave this place. I long for the fresh air of the Reach. This place only makes us sicker.
I'm sorry my Brother.
Peryite, heed our call if you deem us worthy. Our leader, Orchendor, has led us here and for that we are thankful.
He has shown us that our suffering is not a punishment, but a blessing.
Forgive me for saying this, brother, but I have not felt Peryite's presence.
This is the reason you wake me? I already have Orchendor's request taken care of.
He promised Peryite would be present at all times and give us comfort in our suffering.
Yeah, I don't know how I feel about what goes on down there.
I bet Naris gets a kick out it. Nasty fella he is.
Ah, the sweet smell of burnt flesh. Nothing better really.
They drink all day and night and what do I do?
I work the forge.
They die too quickly. Maybe I'll try and hold off on the paralysis next time. Give me more of a moving target. Good practice.
Why do they need me to do this?  We use magic, not weapons.
You work the forge.
You better quiet down before you end up there. Then I'd have to work the forge.
I swear they're making me do this for a laugh. At least I'm not dealing with the prisoners down below.
I'm going with you whether you like it or not.
You want in there? Here's my spare key. Take whatever you want.
I'll just prepare the subject now...
Greetings, mother.
I can't let you do this, mother. You have to die now!
Daughter. Who is this you have brought me?
I found a willing subject for you. Payment has already been discussed, of course.
Splendid! Please take a seat on the chair behind me, would you?
This is the last hagraven between us and my mother!
Watch out for pressure plates here.
The door up ahead will be locked. Klotha, one of the hagravens, will have the key on her.
The boss is going to cut those creepy cave people to pieces!
Yeah! It'll teach them to steal from us! One of them took my good helmet.
I hope one comes running up here so I can stab it right in the face.
I would be fine if they didn't.  Have you seen their eyes? They don't have any! Gross.
I will take you down too. I am not splitting this horde with anyone.
You will pay for stealing from me you eyeless freak!
Hello there, friend. Have you come to enjoy the sights and sounds of this beautiful sanctuary, as I have? Truly remarkable, isn't it?
I knew I heard something. What's this bridge doing down?
So, stop your worrying and get some rest. Your shift is coming up and I don't want you dozing off again like last time.
Keep looking. Someone's here, I can feel it.
This again? I told you we have someone standing guard out there. And, don't forget the rock trap we rigged up.
Anything?
No, haven't seen anyone.
We did! Keep your eyes peeled. I don't think we're alone. You check the entrance. I'm going to look over here.
Aren't you worried someone will wander in here? The entrance isn't exactly hidden you know.
I thought we had a guard posted outside.
Sounds like easy money to me. You're on.
So you're the one who's been down there killing all my wolves. You're gonna die for that!
Get him! Rip his throat out!
I'll do you ten gold at three to one on the white one.
Give em the dogs, boys!
Just shut up and play the game.
I'm just saying that these ceramic lamps make me nervous. They just seem so... fragile.
Oh! Um, he he... Hold on... I... I can explain...
Wait, it's haunted? I don't like ghosts... let me think about this for a minute...
Hmm....
Wait... who in blazes is this?
Valmir, you rat. You're not a soldier at all! Must be one of the Thalmor!
Why don't you go in there and get it?
You there! You look like a sympathetic soldier. I require your assistance!
Let's see... found the Dragon Cult... laid siege... people already dead... poisoned themselves... blah, blah, blah...  ah! Here it is!
So the Dragon Cult poisoned their own well, which explains the ghosts. However, Skorm thought the well was the key to entering the inner areas.
That all happened in the First Era, so the well should be clear of poison by now. It says the key to the well is likely somewhere in the crypt.
But.. stealing the boss's sword? Did he have a death wish?
Damn it, not now!
Ra'jirr was always dragging her into things.
But... Eisa? She's smarter than that.
Who knows. The cat was crazy. She was a fool to trust him.
The boss went down there? Today?
Now you're sounding as crazy as the cat. Be going on about the Pale Lady next.
What? There's a whole shift down there!
Get her!
Kyr's orders. Nobody goes in or out until he gets back. Or the boss will skin you soon as he's done with Ra'jirr.
I've got a bad feeling about this... something's just felt wrong down there lately. Eerie.
There she is!
Yeah, he's after Ra'jirr- never seen him so angry.
Gods, what a mess.
Hey, what the...?
*cough* *gasp*
No! Noooooo!
Yeah... Let's wait a little longer. Then...
Something's wrong... Boss' been down there too long.
Gotta have a sharp axe to cut through all that fat...
Hurry up with it, we've got a merchant in the pit to take care of after we carve this thing up.
Looking for work?
This looks like some sort of lever puzzle.  We'll have to figure out the correct order to flip them.
Maybe the order has something to do with the Symbols up there.
An alchemy lab, it could be in here.  It's worth a look.
These wall carvings are ancient, we must be getting close.
That gem looks suspicious to me.
There it is!  On the table.
That's Vokun, the guardian of the scroll.  It must be just past him.
Good riddance.  Let's move on, the scroll must be in the next room.
Sigh... fine, take whatever you want, so long as you help me get rid of Vals.
Hey! Those belong to my family!
Careful, there's a pressure plate around here. I've triggered it before and got pelted with darts.
Okay, I think this door should lead to the main burial chamber where Vals is holed up. Let's get in there and put and end to this.
Sovngarde is a myth, you s'wit! And now you can join your ancestors in service to me!
Agna once told me there is a secret room deeper in where they buried disgraced members of the family. Maybe that will get us into the main chamber...
He's barred the door. Gods only know how he's... defiling the bodies of my ancestors in there!
This looks like the area Agna told me about. She said that the bear would show the way...
You found it! The passage goes through the sarcophagus... I don't like this... but we'd better keep going.
The dead should be made to serve the living, not the other way around!
I'll return my ancestors to Sovngarde, and you with them!
No! Aunt Agna! Talos, why didn't I go in with her?
Ah! Oh, by Kyne you startled me. There's a necromancer around here so watch yourself.
We offer this soul to The Revenant: he who watches over the opponents of Arkay and his power over life and death. Fie upon Arkay and his followers!
Is there someone out there?
You have to help me, they are going to kill me!
Fie!
You can't just leave me here!
Fie. We beseech you. Darken this gem so that we may use its power to restore The Order of the Black Worm.
Yeah, fie!
The Order shall rise.
Grant us this power so that in your name we may vanquish our enemies.
That's done it! Let's get in there.
You can't shake us off that easily. Let's see what's here!
This is it. We've found Gathrik's tomb.
Well? There must be a way through. Look around.
Would you look at that!
What are you on about? Let's just get the treasure here and go.
Don't rush ahead. This is a trap if I ever saw one.
This is it! Gathrik awaits us!
Beem! What are you doing?
Treasure, that's what! Get off your scaly rump and let's go.
Hush, Salma. We aren't alone.
How can you just sit here and wait? We should be in there!
We must gather our strength. Who knows what's inside?
Oh, Beem-Ja. I never meant for this. What have I done?
Beem-Ja!
Hey, Longhammer, set us up with a round of... what in Oblivion happened in here?
Take the money, just let us go...
Shut up or they'll kill us, you idiot! Once they're gone I'll pick the lock...
Come on... there! I got it, let's go!
No! You'll never take me alive!
Send another one in here! Send two! I don't care! One of you get in here! I could put all of you down! What are you waiting for? I know you want to kill me. Now's your chance!
Yeah, why?
But, I've got the key to the Sabre Cage! Look!
Take down that one with your bare hands too?
What's that supposed to prove? Get back on patrol!
Wasn't our last catch a Cave Bear?
Why, you don't think I could do it?
Troll's blood was he a tough one!
Pfft
So, you're saying you brought that cat down alone?
Looks like the boss is at it again.
Don't say that to loud, you don't want it getting back to him.
Why? What's he doing now?
He's on one of his drunk rants again. Except this time he's challenging everyone to a duel over in the hole.
We've got him locked in there now, but he's still challenging anyone that looks crooked at him.
Someone should let that cat lose.  That'd shut him up real quick.
Heh, a Nord skull makes the best axe blade. 'bout all they're good for.
...hear he's decided to let the Hags turn him into a Briarheart.
Heart of thorn... bones of the wild... in life, Forsworn...
That's a true Reachman. Hope he heads to Markarth to take out some of those Nords.
...rise from death, Blood of our Blood.
You - over here, quick. Before any of them show up!
Please, stranger! I need your help!
I will find you, Fjola!
Hey, who's there?
Hello? You! Over here! Please, I need help!
Please, do you have a potion you can spare? Please! I'm not sure I'll make it on my own.
That is a lot of blood. Not sure how much longer I can hold out here. I really got myself into it this time.
It's just across the bridge and up that hill.
We're close now. I can see the camp.
It was a stupid plan, and now Rigel is so mad she won't even let us cut him down from there!
I tried to tell him that he wouldn't get past the traps, but he wouldn't listen...
Aye, and she's added more traps now as well... A moment of silence for our fallen friend...
It's got to be somewhere around here! Now where did I put it?
Oh, and I wasn't entirely truthful before. This is actually going to hurt a lot. You see, you have to be dead in order for the spell to take hold.
Don't worry though. It'll be relatively painless...relatively.
Hhhmmm...maybe I put it over here.
Ooooh...yes...yes. You've fallen for my trap! Greed makes a great lure. Odd you didn't die from the fall though. Most do.
Oh, and don't mind my assistant here. He may have seen better days, but he's still more help to me dead than he was alive.
Ah...Here it is. Now, if you'd be so kind as to stand still this will be much easier for me to do.
Come on! You know you want what's in that chest. Just walk toward it! Just walk toward the chest! Gravity will do the rest. I know you're up there. Go get the treasure. Doesn't it look pretty?
Alright, let's see if we have something here to end this as quickly as possible.
No matter. Another one will be along any time now.
Well...that's disappointing. This one didn't survive the fall either.
Please, you can't leave me in here! If you let me out I can show you where they hide their best treasure.
Please! Help me get out of this cage. I don't know why those things locked me up and I don't want to wait around to find out.
One of those things has the key to this cage. If you get me out of here I'll help you slaughter the rest of those crows.
Hey! Over here! Get me out of here! Hey you! Let me out! I can help!
I'm glad they didn't find my lucky dagger. It's time to gut these rotten birds. Lead the way!
Actually... on second thought, I'll just kill you!
Now that we've got that out of the way, I'll take everything you have... or your life.
Leave this place... Leave this place...
Leave... Leave... Leave...
I return from the war to find my home overrun with bandit filth.
Those bastards.
Agreed, we can't afford to try again.
Help will arrive soon.
Would you two shut up before Brurid hears you messing around.
Funny coming from a woman who's breath smells like she just kissed a draugr.
And it shows, I've seen horkers with smaller guts.
It's been forever since I've eaten so well.
Feel free to grab a pick and help them out. I prefer not to sully myself with manual labor.
They seem less intelligent each time you raise them, if that's even possible.
You hear that? The others must have found something!
These thralls of yours are slower than Argonians in a blizzard.
Bah. Weak-willed rabble. Even dead they're almost useless.
As long as they can swing a pickaxe where I tell them, they're as smart as we need them to be.
There goes another one.
We'd better go see. These can tend to themselves for a few minutes.
Fools! You will not hold me here any longer, Valdar!
This place has had you shaking in your armor ever since we arrived.
Can't say that I have.
I'm fine, I'm fine. Let's move on.
Find anything worthwhile yet?
Quiet! I think I heard something.
You've been at it for five minutes. Here, let me try.
I think I almost got it. Come on, just open.
I can't get it open.
This is getting ridiculous. If we can't get this open soon, the boss will have our heads.
So, you in?
'Course not. Dogs I could train. But a half-starved wolf? Not a chance.
...Yeah. We can't have that rheumy-eyed fool as our watchman, even if he is Hajvarr's uncle. Time we dealt with both of them.
Right. Lucky if it doesn't rip our throats out.
You think it'll work?
Look out! The wolf is loose!
We strike tonight, at dusk. Be ready.
You. Over here!
So we're just supposed to sit here while Arvel runs off with that golden claw?
I know I ran ahead with the claw, but I need help!
Is... is someone coming? Is that you Harknir? Bjorn? Soling?
Just shut it and keep an eye out for trouble.
That dark elf wants to go on ahead, let him. Better than us risking our necks.
What if Arvel doesn't come back? I want my share from that claw!
No. Not again. Help!
You fool, why should I share the treasure with anyone?
It's coming loose. I can feel it.
That's it. Keep hacking at it.
You will be called on to take swift action. Rise to the challenge, and discover what you are capable of.
You are on the right path, and you will prevail.
It is imperative that you return to your College at once.
You have done well thus far, but trying times are ahead.
Ancano! Stop this at once! I command you!
I don't care what it is, I want it down now! I want to know what he's doing in there!
Don't go near him!
What's going on?!
Who are you? Where's Gavros?
I'd almost given up hope. Let me get the door...
What the...
G...Gavros? Is that you?
[coughing]
Crystal....  gone...
Find... Paratus... in Oculory...
It was my idea to replace one of the key elements with our focusing crystal. Months of enchantments went into it.
Let's just hope they got it right this time.
No matter what Gavros said, this was my idea first. The Council is going to know that when I get back.
I was the one who thought of using this... this Oculory. I don't know what the dwarves called it. Something unpronounceable, I'm sure.
From all our research, it seems they were intent on discerning the nature of the divine.
This machinery, all of it, was designed to collect starlight, and then... I'm not sure. Split it, somehow?
What are you playing at? Is this some attempt to stall my work?!
Something in Winterhold, it looks like.
Something is creating an incredible amount of interference.
...but what's this? These results... They're not at all what they should be.
Years of work, finally going to pay off...
You've done it! That's all of them!
Almost there! We're so close!
That's it! You've got one of them lined up!
Purely to help safeguard the Empire, of course.
What's important is that all of this work was designed to reveal to us sources of great magical power.
Also, I doubt you'd be able to comprehend the details.
I can't explain the details. That would be giving away many secrets the Synod have learned over the years.
The other... Well, that can only be Labyrinthian.
And yet, in the end, only two locations have been revealed to us. One is your College.
Here it is. Magnificent, isn't it?
Place the crystal in the central apparatus, and we can start the process for focusing it.
Took an incredible amount of work to get it running again. Now I'm hoping it'll all be worth it.
Get moving, now. I'll be fine.
Come on, get up... I need you on your feet.
I don't see the Arch-Mage. He must've been blown clear. I need you to find him immediately, all right? Make sure he's safe.
I have no idea what happened. Ancano did it, I think.
I don't know. It's like a ward, but who's casting it? Ancano? How?
Instead of projecting the sky, we project all of Tamriel, and then harness the latent energies to overlay the positions of...
Have you ever seen the Orrery in the Imperial City? It was the inspiration for this idea.
This projection should be lit up like the night sky...
So I hear. Come here, you.
I don't want you to leave Ivarstead.
Bassianus, sweetie, what is it?
Faleen... I...
Oh, and to be with you!
What good are fish if you have to eat them alone?
We must leave. Your father will never approve of us, and I grow weary of this place.
Why not?
Fastred, I have something to say to you.
Sssh. It's all right. You don't need to say anymore. I had no idea you were so... nuanced.
Oh, Klimmek...
Where will we go?
Because... I would miss you.
I love you.
Klimmek? What is it?
Fastred, we must speak.
To Riften, my pet. How you'll adore the city.
But I thought you only cared about your fishing!
I'm so confused. What's happening?
Of course I am. What brings you here?
It doesn't matter. I'm here. We're together now. And we will be forever.
But that battle isn't expected until tomorrow... Ruki, what's going on?
Fenrig! You're alive!
I had heard that Gjukar's men were wiped out. I came to find you.
I'll make the preparations immediately!
